NOTES: A suicide car-bomber, widely believed to be involved in Boko Haram, hit the main gate of the Borno State Police Command Headquarters in Maiduguri, killing a Police inspector, a traffic warden and four other civilians, injuring 24 tricycles drivers and passengers commuting on the Airport Road when the blast occurred at 11.26am. Eight killed, 24 injured. Some reports have the death count seven, while others, eight. Earlier in the day another suicide bomber detonated himself near a school elsewhere in the city.
Gunmen shot dead a police constable outside his home late in the day.

A suicide bomber blew up his car just outside the police headquarters in the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri, killing eight people and wounded 19 others. It is not clear of the victims were police or civilians.
Medical students of Igbinedion University are reportedly abducted.
Unidentified Gunmen shoot dead a police official who was visiting from out of town.
Suspected "cultists" hacked a NSCDC (branch of military) to death with knives and machetes before one assailant was arrested by local police.
Following the suicide attack of a church, a large group of Christian youths protest, blocking a major road. Clashes with police began; five were reported dead, plus injures.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A man drove a bomb-laden car to the entrance of the Christ Chosen Church and detonated it. At least six deaths reported, including the bomber, 52 injured, but number may rise. Boko Haram later declared responsibility.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Three Boko Haram gunmen enter a church and open fire on congregants. At least one dead.
A group of "ex-militants" attack an oil pipeline operated by a private corporation. Many militants believe these corporations are unjustly extracting the resource.
Police battle suspected kidnappers, rescue two victims in two adjacent locations. One suspect killed in each location.
Police battle suspected kidnappers, rescue two victims in two adjacent locations. One suspect killed in each location.

27 people, including one police officer are killed in an apparent revenge attack on a town. Many others injured. The attack began at 1am while most slept, gunmen going house to house killing residents in cold blood. Following the attack many of the remaining residents fled this and surrounding villages in fear of further attacks.
A traditional ruler escapes death when a group of unidentified gunmen attack him in an apparent assassination attempt.
Federal Government College students claim gunmen attacked students outside off campus and injure several. Police deny these reports.
A group of pensioners, numbering over 100, gathered at the Federal Secretariat, Abuja, protested against alleged neglect by the Pension Reform Task Team.
During a protest of pensioners, members of Nigerian Immigration Services assaulted several journalists covering the protest.
A group of six gunmen driving in a bus with no plate number followed a lawmaker to his house and shot him dead. Assailants unknown, as well as the lawmakers political affiliation.

All five Peoples Democratic Party governors boycotted the inauguration of the PDPs committee for the July 14 Edo State governorship election in Abuja. Included in their absence from the event were several PDP senators.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two policemen have been killed and three others wounded in an attack allegedly carried out by Boko Haram. The gunmen were able to flee the scene.
Following a ethnic clash outside of technical school the bodies of two are discovered by police.
A politicians cousin is abducted by unidentified men. The group later demeans N50m for his release.
National Youth Service Corps members serving in Ekiti State in Ado Ekiti protested against the non-payment of their allowances by the state government.
Unknown men assaulted a journalist in the presence of police, who did nothing to help.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Nigerias Joint Security Task Force (JTF) on killed four suspected militants and arrested seven others during a raid at Naibawa Kwanar Masallaci quarters in the West African countrys northwestern state of Kano.

Aggrieved members of the Hausa community clashed with policemen, two killed in the brawl. An eyewitness said that the Hausa attacked the station to avenge the death of one their kinsmen. By the end of the clash the police station was destroyed by fire.
Six students are killed over the weekend by suspected cultists. No name or group given.
A PDP chief is kidnapped and later discovered murdered by unknown assailants.
Following a series of Boko Haram church blasts Christians are incensed, set up road blocks in suburban Kaduna.
ex-Niger Delta militants (unnamed, could be MEND) clashed with suspected student cultists on Sunday, several injured.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram bombs Ekilisiya Yanuwaa Nigeria (EYN) Church, three worshipers killed, 54 injured.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four are dead in a Boko Haram Christian church bombing in a town known as Trikaniya.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram suicide bombers hit a churches during Sunday services, driving a explosive laden car into the building. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Authorities in Kaduna State impose a 24 hour curfew following the violence. 23 dead, plus injuries. Some reports have the death toll as high as 40. 75 were killed in the total church bombings plus retaliation through rioting.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Nassarawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Ungwan Baraawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram (who later takes responsibility) suicide bombs two church during Sunday services. The blasts happened in the Wusasa and Sabon-Gari districts of Zaria. 22 believed dead.
Traders and customers at Artisan Market in Enugu on Sunday fled different directions when three men suspected to be cultists shot dead an unidentified man inside the market.
Following several church bombings Christian mobs barricaded roads and attacked motorists who appeared to be Muslim.

Following several attacks on Christian churches, a large group of Christian youths retaliate in the Sabon Tasha and Trijania neighborhoods, kill 52 people with sticks and swords and destroy a mosque. 125 injuries believed.
Rioting violence erupted late in the day following Boko Haram attacks on Sunday. Much of the violence lasted until Tuesday.

Traders begin a protest march against some Chinese business men who they accused of undermining and killing their businesses. Speaking during the protest, the national Chairman of the association, Mr. Azubike Nwachukwu , said Nigerian dealers have been operating at a loss since the Chinese business men started retail selling of the leather products at a very cheap price.
Gunfire and rioting rocked two northern Nigerian cities on Tuesday in a fresh round of unrest, prompting authorities to slap curfews on both after weekend violence killed 52 people.
Gunfire and rioting rocked two northern Nigerian cities on Tuesday in a fresh round of unrest, prompting authorities to slap curfews on both after weekend violence killed 52 people.

Muslims fired AK-47 rifles, burned tires and destroyed at least one church in the northern city of Kaduna, two days after rioting by Christian youths killed 52 people. This is apparently a retaliatory action. Police arrested several involved. Some reports state there were 101 left dead after three days of violence in the effected towns.

Osun State deputy governor, Titi-Laoye Tomori, was yesterday held hostage and booed by Action Congress of Nigeria (ACN) protesters who were not satisfied with the governments action to a particular cause. It should be noted the deputy governor is of the same party as the protesters.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: There was gridlock on Tuesday in Ikorodu area of Lagos State after members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers blocked Ikorodu Road to protest against the seizure of their vehicles by the states Task force on Environmental and Special Offences and Traffic Management Authority.
Two rival cult groups clash in Calabar, causing deaths and destruction of property. Exact number of deaths unknown.
Police arrest 57 members of an ethnic cult group they believe are responsible for a recent murder and clash at a university.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Day two a Boko Haram attacks on Damaturu.Three police officers killed, four others injured.
Security forces arrest six members of Boko Haram who they believe are linked to Sundays church attack in Biu.
Violence sparks between Muslims and Christian groups, five dead.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Violence renews in Kano City, explosions and shootings at police vehicles are reported in the evening. At least three police officers killed when they are slain by their own stolen weapons.
Police discover an unexploded bomb near a village hall.
Five are killed during a riot what was triggered after commerce between a Christian boy and a Muslim woman. The deaths have not been confirmed.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Security forces arrest a member of Boko Haram following a shootout who they believe was responsible for a deadly Christmas Day bombing of the church near Abuja.
Security personnel kill nine members of a Christian militia who had been warring with a Muslim militia in Kaduna. The security groups was attempting to restore the peace.

Traffic was disrupted for several hours at the ever busy Onitsha -Owerri highway as students of the National Metallurgical Training Institute, NMTI, protested an alleged plan by the federal government to scrap the institution or merge it with another one yet to be named.

93 people suspected to be members of the two rival cult groups that have been terrorizing residents of Calabar in the last few days have been nabbed by police. The groups seem to be organized (unknown command structure), but are not named.
An explosion went off outside a nightclub in the Nigerian capital Abuja, breaking windows and damaging cars, but no casualties were reported.
Kano State Police command on Friday arrested four persons for allegedly trying to plant a time bomb at Waje Friday mosque in Fagge Local Government Area of Kano

Abakaliki, the Ebonyi State capital, at the weekend, virtually came to a halt when over 50 women from Ivo Local Council stormed the city to vent their anger over the suspension on a trumped up charge of drunkenness and boarding a tricycle, of the member representing their constituency in the House of Assembly, Princess Lillian Igwe.
A family of six including a six month old child and a 70-year old grandmother were murdered by Fulani gunmen at Kumpun village in Mangu Local Government Area of Plateau State.
Two large explosives are discovered in a residential area of Jos by residents. Police were able to recover the pair before they detonated.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Attackers with guns and explosives raided a jail in a restive Nigerian city on Sunday, leaving four Prison Guards dead and freeing 40 inmates. Boko Haram is blamed. The gunmen also attacked a school in the town.

An explosion near a cluster of bars in the northern Nigerian city of Bauchi, recently targeted by Boko Haram Islamists, has injured nine people. No group has claimed responsibility for this blast, but Boko Haram is suspected.

Gunmen with explosives attacked a police station on Tuesday in the northern Nigerian city of Kano, previously targeted by Islamist militant group Boko Haram. The clash lasted into a second day, resulting in the death of seventeen militants and one police officer.
Gunmen attack a police post, no report of death of injury.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Day two of attacks on a police station by suspected Boko Haram. Seventeen militants and one police officer killed by the end of the battle. Several arrested.
Unidentified Gunmen attack a police station, two civilians, two insurgents killed. Several other police stations were attacked in the metro area in an apparent coordinated effort.
At least 147 persons have been arrested by the police in central north Nigerias Kaduna State for alleged involvement in reprisal attacks on churches across the state.
Explosives were found planted at a police station and filling station, but were detonated by a local bomb squad before they were able to cause damage.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attack a police station and a bank in a small town. "Many lives" were said to have been lost in the attack.
Gunmen have killed the Rivers State Chairman of the All Nigeria Peoples Party, Mr. Julius Nwaofu. He was shot several times after leaving the airport. Assailants unknown.
Fulani gunmen attacked and killed the local chief of the PDP, his wife and child.
Police and the JTF arrest a militant leader known as "General Cairo" who they believe have been responsible for the destruction of oil pipelines in the region.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Police say security forces have killed suspected sect members during a military raid on their hideout in a besieged city in Nigerias northeast. The police were not clear with regard to the number of deceased.
Following a tip, police discover a pair of bombs placed by unknown persons. The bomb squad detonated to bombs before they were able to cause damage.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunfire and explosions rocked the northeastern Nigerian city of Damaturu on Saturday as security forces launched a pre-emptive offensive against Boko Haram Islamists. The offensive followed intelligence that BH was planning to launch an attack on the city. The violence was most heavily concentrated in the Nyanya and Obasanjo Estates areas of the city.

An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded on under a bridge near a village in the Riyom Local Government of Plateau State, north-central Nigeria, just as the police detonated two more bombs planted in the same area, some 40 kilometers from Jos, the state capital. No word of causalities. Riyom has witnessed some bomb blasts and constant rifts between members of the Berom ethnic group and Fulani herdsmen, though there is no word who is responsible here.
Gunmen entered Kurna Asabe area of Kano metropolis and killed a former local government councilor, a woman and a teenager. The Politians political party was not mentioned.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces shoot and kill three suspected Boko Haram members. One female was arrested.
Unidentified gunmen have shot and killed two people leaving one other person critically injured when the struck at Gwandu quarters of Shamaki ward in Gombe metropolis.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attackers killed nine construction workers in the restive northeastern city of Maiduguri, the base of the Islamist sect.

Members of the military gathered at the Gowon House headquarters of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) in Abuja, seeking immediate redeployment from the northern states over fears of Boko Haram attacks.
An explosion that went off near a shopping mall in Nigerias capital causing one injury.

Youths from the Hausa community clash with a group of Yoruba truck drivers who they believe killed a prostitute in their community. Three dead, 25 large trucks destroyed. This is a history of violence between these two groups.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected gunmen believed to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked the Borno State Housing Corporation (BOHC) office complex in Maiduguri, killing its General Manager, Isa Madu Ngaram and an engineer.
Local police with the help of two local youths arrest four members of an unnamed terror group.
Police discover and detonate a pair of explosives in the Congo Russia neighborhood of the city. It is unknown who the perpetrators are, however, the police force publically blamed Boko Haram.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill one member of the sect.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack a Damaturu slum with explosives and firearms. Causalities and damage unknown.

Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid six villages in the Barakin Ladi region (villages either unincorporated or not named) and kill at least 63. Most of the victims were found at the home of a Christian pastor, where the large group was gathered for safety. More than 200 displaced among the villages.
Fulani militias attack the town on Kushen in the Barakin Ladi area. 15 reported dead.
Fulani militias attack a Christian village early n the morning before attacking others in the area. 8 reported dead.

Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid several villages in the Riyom government area causing numerous deaths. Specific villages were not named. 58 were killed among to two areas. More than 200 displaced among the villages.

State security forces push back against Fulani attacks, causing a two hour battle. Two police and 21 assailants killed. 14 civilians were listed among the dead, though it is not clear if the civilian death was caused by this fighting or the original Fulani attacks.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram attacked the residence of an Islamic cleric, Shehu of Borno, Alhaji Abubakar Umar Garbai El-Kanem, killing a resident of the palace as well as a trader in a nearby market.

Muslim Fulani herdsmen (and/or Boko Haram) raided several villages. Here, a cemetery in Barkin Ladis area known as Maseh, at least 22 were killed in a raid, including two politicians. Most of the victims are of the Christian Birom ethnic group. The group was at the cemetery to bury the victims of the previous days attacks in the area. More than 200 people displaced among the villages. Later the Fulanis blame the military for the attacks.

Following Fulani attacks on Christian Birom villages, a mob of Birom and other Christian youths form to retaliate against members their attackers ethnic group or religion. Deaths caused, unclear number.

Fulani militiamen attacked a Brigadier General when his staff was changing a flat tire in the car he was travelling in. The militia group may have purposely blown the tire to set up the assassination.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack and kill an Islamic cleric, Sheikh Ibrahim Majimi, at his home.
A womens group of 2,000 protest the planned demolition of their houses. Reports of police violence.
Reports of two small villages attacked by unknown people in Plateau State. Over 140 dead. The military disputes this claim.
Unknown gunmen kill four, injure one.
Reports of two small villages attacked by unknown people in Plateau State. Over 140 dead. The military disputes this claim.

Seven people wounded and many houses were destroyed when a neighboring community attacked another. The attack is believed to be motivated by the possession of land. The victims were of the Nkpor community.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A suicide bomber kills 10 in a Mosque near the Shehus palace. The Shehu is the top Islamic leader in the state. Six others injured. The bomber was a teenage boy, whom security experts believe was involved with Boko Haram.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill a Divisional Police Officer for unknown reasons.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A bomb is detonated in a car outside a church during Sunday services, no causalities. Police arrest two suspects following the incident, who are believed to be involved in Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attack a small town outside Kaduna, kill one.
A lynch mob attacks a suspected bike thief, kills him.
Police forces discover and raid a bomb factory in a church.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Heavy gunfire reported in the Yobe State capital. Suspected Boko Haram members raid a police station. The organization later claims credit for the attack.

ACTOR2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Members of the Onitsha Communal Militia attack two members of MASSOB, injuring them. The two were attacked for allegedly preventing them from collecting illegal levies from Onitsha traders.
When a grenade is thrown at a Islamic school in a Jos suburb security agents respond with gunfire. One small boy was killed by the blast.
An explosion outside a government building kills at least one. It is unknown is perpetrated the incident, though it is believed to be either Boko Haram or a Fulani group.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Hotel staff discover an unexploded bomb. Boko Haram is suspected.
the National Union of Electricity Employees (NUEE) begin a multi-day protest of a Nigerian electrical companys merger with a Canadian counterpart.
Two communities protest a proposed merger into a new state fearing neglect by newly formed government.
Two communities protest a proposed merger into a new state fearing neglect by newly formed government.
A group of soldiers attacked a group of police with rocks and bottles after soldiers witnessed a police officer accosting the driver of a bus whom they believed was interrupting the flow of traffic.
One s dead after Fulani herdsmen clash with area natives over the alleged destruction of farming crops.
Police forces discover an explosives outside a Catholic school in the capital and dispose of it before it is able to detonate.
Members of the National Youth Service Corps protested the non-payment of allowances by the government.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a JTF team along a road. Unknown causalities.

ACTOR1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Youths of the MASSOB violently take over portions of a State Park, injuring 16 and causing damage.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Six are dead, including a police constable when gunmen on motorcycles attack a market area. Boko Haram is widely believed to be responsible.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be of Boko Haram, target Ibo Christians in an open air market and kill four.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be linked to Boko Haram attack a radio station and kill three. Sharada is a Kano neighborhood south east of the downtown area.
A group of youths began throwing stones and other objects at an election official, accuse him of manipulating the voting process.
During the planned demolition of a shanty town a police officer shot and killed an evicted resident and community leader.
Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked the villages of Kai, Nyongon, Kachim, Kuffan, Begduk and Yokhol (all unincorporated) in Gashish District. There were no causalities.

ACTOR2: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: A gunman attacks a regional leader of MASSOB, but the leader escapes unharmed. It is unclear if this was an assassination attempt or a robbery.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram kills a 10-yesr-old boy and wounds 10 others. The explosion occurred in the citys Tundunwadan Dan-iya area, a nightlife and pub district, a common target of Boko Haram, who later clamed credit for the blast.

Unidentified gunmen shot dead a Health Ministry worker after he was followed. The reasons for the killing are unknown. Witnesses claim the assailants did not leave the scene of the crime until they knew the victim was dead.

A group of women barricaded a Shell petroleum facility in an event that lasted four hours. The group believed the company had not met their obligations to provide community amenities. The protesters also accused the company of environmental and social negligence.
A prominent Christian leader is killed, his wife abducted, after unidentified gunmen storm their church.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Following the killing of two Indians, members of Boko Haram attacked a police station in a separate attack in a different area of the city. Two police and civilian shot dead in the attack.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Armed men of the Boko Haram sect attacked a police station, set it ablaze. It is suspected these are the same gunmen involved in the attack in rural Bauchi State

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two Indian nationals are killed in a suspected Boko Haram attack on their factory. Other were injured.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack a police station. Three police reported killed.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Shortly after Boko Haram killed two Indian nationals in a factory, the JTF makes 26 BH arrests and kills two in a raid.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: On motorcycles, suspected Boko Haram assassinate a senior member of the police forces while he ate at home. Three of the officers guests were also shot and killed.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attackers opened fire on Mosque worshippers. Three of the gunmen were shot by police who were present to protest the worshipers, while a fourth was killed when the explosive device he was carrying went off prematurely. Conflicting reports have the death count at five.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Motorcycle gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, opened fire on the car of a senior Nigerian air force officer Sunday, killing the driver and an aide (both junior air force officers), but the senior officer was not inside the vehicle at the time. Two pedestrians were collateral damage.
The traditional ruler of an area is kidnapped by unknown men, later released.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Explosions, including a suicide blast, rocked two police stations in Nigerias northwestern city of Sokoto. Boko Haram later claims credit. Six killed, including civilians, 30 others injured. Other reports have the death count at four, others three.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen on motorcycles attacked the country home of the Nigerian Vice President. The Vice President was not in the residence at the time, though one civilian was killed. Boko Haram later claimed credit for the attack. Two of the three perpetrators arrested.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Nigerian troops kill two members of Boko Haram new the countrys border with Chad. The alleged insurgents were caught carrying rocket-propelled grenades, Kalashnikov rifles as well as other assorted ammunition and weaponry.
Police discover and dispose of a explosive found at a school. Boko Haram is suspected, but there is no evidence to support the claim.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a second police station into another area of the city, in an apparent coordinated attack.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram simultaneously attacked two police stations in Gombe. "They threw explosives and opened fire on the police post in central Gombe. Some of the policeman were inside while others were outside. The explosions were followed by gunfire. There was a shootout between the gunmen and policemen which lasted till 10 pm (2100 GMT)," a witness said. "There were a lot of gunshots lasting for more than an hour. I cannot say if anybody was hurt or killed in the attack," he continued.
Members of the Ogoni ethnic group declare their independence from Nigeria, calling on the UN to recognize them as a nation.
Report of a bomb explosion at a church. However, conflicting accounts report no explosion at all.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A Muslim leader escaped a suicide attack in a mosque by suspected Boko Haram, who later claimed credit . "The bomber, however, detonated the explosives and blew himself off, injuring two policemen and three civilians in the process," a local official said.
Military forces raided a Boko Haram bomb factory in Kaduna.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a oil vessel off the coast of Nigeria, killing two sailors and kidnapping four others. The victims were not citizens of Nigeria. Following the event the Nigerian military launched efforts to recover the victims.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram detonated explosions in three neighborhoods in Maiduguri. Following the violence soldiers went door-to-door arresting suspects. Some residents report unneeded violence at the hands of the soldiers. No reported death or injury.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a second neighborhood in Maiduguri.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a third neighborhood in Maiduguri.
Hundreds of Ogoni ethnics took to the streets at Ogale-Eleme, Rivers State to protest the non-implementation of a UN potable water campaign.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A suicide bomber rammed his car into a military patrol in the northeastern Nigerian city of Damaturu, killing himself, six soldiers, and two civilians. Boko Haram was suspected and later claimed responsibility. Nine other were hospitalized.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Anambra, Enugu and Ebonyi Drivers Welfare Association
NOTES: A confederation of bus drives protested the government imposition of a tax.
Rival "cult" groups clash over the course of two days, causing at least tow deaths and other injuries.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram opens fire on a crowded church during an evening service, at least 19 dead. Unknown injury number.

A commercial motorcyclist, popularly called okada rider was stabbed in the stomach by two hoodlums suspected to be Fulani herdsmen on the long bridge end of the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway. The attack did not appear to be criminal.
Relatives of fallen police officers gather at police headquarters to protest the non-payment of pensions. Witnesses believe they numbered in the 1,000s.

Unknown assailants opened fire on a group of soldiers on patrol, sparking an exchange of fire that left two soldiers and two of the gunmen dead. It is unclear if the perpetrators have any connection to the church attackers the previous night.
Day two of rival cult clash.
Communal violence has occurred in Benue State with 10 persons killed and property worth millions of naira destroyed in Ojantele and Ijegwu communities in Otukpo and Obi local council areas.
Communal violence has occurred in Benue State with 10 persons killed and property worth millions of naira destroyed in Ojantele and Ijegwu communities in Otukpo and Obi local council areas.
Police claim they arrested three suspects in connecting to recent area mosque killings. Secondary sources could not confirm the arrest.

Members and adherents of the BSDF declare their independence from Nigeria, believing the land of southeast Cross River State rightfully belongs to Cameroon. Upen their declaration the group launched a radio station.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram kill two police officers along a rural road.
A team of the JTF raided a Boko Haram hideout, recovered weapons.

Over 40 lawyers in Asaba, the Delta state capital on Friday barricaded magistrates courts to protest the abduction of a newly appointed judge, Justice Marcel Okoh. The lawyers, who gathered under the auspices of the Nigerian Bar Association, marched through some streets of the state capital to the courts and said no court would be allowed to sit until Okoh is released.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram kill one member of a security forces and wound two others in a "militant attack."
Unidentified gunmen attack a church, set it ablaze. Injuries, one death reported.
Security forces raid a suspected Boko Haram hideout and recover a large cache of weapons.
Police arrest six persons believed to be in connection with a recent attack. Few details given.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CNPP: Conference of Nigerian Registered Political Parties
NOTES: Adherents to the CNPP protest a local election, believing it was fixed.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A JTF raid on two Boko Haram hideouts results in the death of two militants and the arrest of 30 others. Panicked residents flee the city in large numbers.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A JTF raid on two Boko Haram hideouts results in the death of two militants and the arrest of 30 others. Panicked residents flee the city in large numbers.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Joint Task Force (military force) killed 20 suspected Boko Haram members in a shootout as they raided their hideout in Maiduguri. Conflicting report: some accounts have this event occurring on the 13th of the month.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be members of Boko Haram attack a church in Gombe.
State police arrest 16 believed to involved with a church attack in the area. Exact location unknown.

The Joint Research and Allied Institutions Sector Union on Monday in Enugu embarked on a demonstration to protest the Federal Governments perceived failure to implement the agreement to improve the welfare of its members.
A physically challenged group protests neglect by the state government by barricading a road outside the capital city.
A gang known as the Area Boys attacks a journalist.
Six unidentified men attack journalists on a train.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Three people were killed in a bomb blast on a northern Nigerian road leading to a mosque where a cleric had condemned the Islamist militant group Boko Haram. The ordinance was delivered on motorcycle.

Two suspected suicide bombers were killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) while another person suspected to be a member of the group escaped with injuries. Their bomb was concealed in a camera case. The assailants were unknown, but it is likely they were members of Boko Haram. Some reports have the death count at three.
Local traders protested the demolition of their shops and structures by the State Government.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A gun duel between Boko Haram and JTF security forces lasts two hours. One militant death reported, one soldier injured.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces battle Boko Haram when they raid their hideout. 30 arrested.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and a civilian while wounding three others in an attack targeting a military vehicle. The members of the military were not harmed.
Members of the JTF, the military, make militant arrests and recover weapons.
Hundreds evacuate a downtown building after a bomb scare.
The NUJ holds a protest demonstration against recent violence on journalists. The demonstration was held in part in front of the governors home.
During a Muslim celebration festival unknown persons bomb a police station. The blast injured one person and destroyed property.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attack a mosque and shot dead a member of the Borno Emirate Traditional Council (BETC), Zanna Kaselama.

Violence broke out at the Rivers State University of Science and Technology (RSUST) as "hoodlums" attacked officials of the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) opposed to the appointment of an acting vice chancellor.
Police arrest a governors aid over a connection to Boko Haram and an attack on a Christian church recently.

Protesters threating violence stormed the premises of the State Oil Commission expressing grievances over alleged neglect by the commission. The group, mostly youths, armed with weapons, caused employees to flee.
An unidentified gunman is killed after a three hour gun battle with police.
Two students are dead after an attack by Fulani Herdsmen on their village. Reports of women raped and houses burnt.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A policeman was reportedly injured when suspected Boko Haram members fired at a military roadblock along Maiduguri Road, Kano, while the police stopped a violent confrontation between Boko Haram and some residents of the area. Many cars damaged.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: After a suspected Boko Haram attack in their neighborhood, a group of Christian youths seek revenge on their attackers. Police we able to foil most of the violence.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram militants disrupt a Eid-el-Fitr celebration, no report of death or injury.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram suspects attack a Christian church and a school. No report of injury or death. It is believed this group is the same group that attacked the police station elsewhere in the city.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram suspects open fire on separate mosques, killing two.
Police break up two Boko Haram (suspected) bomb factories, arrested two l
Police arrest two suspected suicide bombers in a Ikeja airport. The two suspects are believed to be in connection with a raided bomb factory in Kogi State earlier in the day.
Protesters gather after the state House Assembly did not swear in a recently elected official.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram suspects attack a police station/prison and exchange gunfire. Reports of civilian injury or death, though numbers are unknown The gun battle lasted at least two hours according to witnesses.
Lecturers gather at a university to protest to demand the release of a kidnapped colleague, who was taken by unknown men for a large ransom.
Two suspected assassins are killed in a police gun battle. The two are believed to be in connection with the death of a British national.
Fulani militiamen raid a village and, kill two Christian residents.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen (suspected) shoot and kill a Irish national working for a construction firm.
Unidentified gunmen follow a police officer into a Mosque, kill him.
Unidentified gunmen invaded Okordia community in Yenagoa Local Government Area, Bayelsa State, and abducted a clan head, or traditional ruler at a local palace.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A group of armed men, believed to be Boko Haram, shoot and kill a police officer during a gun battle.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a government official.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram detonated an explosive in the Gwange area of the city late in the afternoon. Sporadic gunshots were reported in the area soon after. There was a explosion earlier in the day elsewhere in the city.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber was killed as well as a passerby when his explosive detonated prematurely. The suspected target was members of the JTF.
Protesters demand the removal of the Naval Chief of Staff for the naval detention of a man.
A group of pensioners gathered on the grounds of their former employer to protest non-payment.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram attempt to bomb a JTF patrol, but the device exploded prematurely destroying nearby shops. Members of the JTF react with gunfire costing five members of BH their lives.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A JTF patrol is ambushed by members of Boko Haram. One officer was reported killed.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A group of suspected Boko Haram ambushed a JTF patrol, though the counterattack killed all five attackers.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attacked a military checkpoint, kill an intelligence officer.
A JTF raid on a suspected Boko Haram hideout recovers a large cache of weapons.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram, weekend, stormed New Marte, Marte Local Government Area of Borno State, where they killed a Police Sergeant (names withheld), and two civilians. The group also burnt a police headquarters and a local church.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Six are shot dead by suspected Boko Haram. The event may have occurred on 2nd September.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram members detonated a bomb in the Sabon neighborhood of Gombe. No causalities confirmed.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram kills a man in Gwange Ward of the city.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram kills a man in Ummarari Ward of the city.
A group protests the planned destruction of a open-air market.
Unidentified men attempt to attack three police vehicles with explosives, but are unsuccessful.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A local government secretary of Bama Council area of Borno state, and his friend, a university lecturer were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram in the same area where six people were shot and killed by the same group on Saturday.
Unknown gunmen burnt the personal house of Damaturu local government PDP chairman Alhaji Audu

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram carries out a series of coordinated attacked on telecommunications facilities in several areas. Two bombs failed to detonate in tow separate areas along Gombe road.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram carries out a series of coordinated attacked on telecommunications facilities in several areas. One is injured at this location, while several others ran for safety following the blast.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Men believed to be of Boko Haram attacked a home and killed four Igbos. It is unclear if the group was targeted because they were Igbos or if the attack was coincidental.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Men on motorbikes, believed to be Boko Haram, destroyed MTN and Airtel mobil phone telecommunication masts during the early morning hours.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram set ablaze a telecommunications office in a coordinated effort to destroy much of the areas infrastructure. Sources revealed that the assailants, who were about 10 in number, stormed the telecommunications office around 2a.m. Wednesday and chased away the security men on duty before setting the building on fire.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attacked two buildings housing the Ministry of Religious Affairs and the states Pilgrims Welfare Commission (YPWC) located on Potiskum Road. There was no official confirmation of the casualty figures but hospital sources claimed that 16 bodies were brought to the facility by the police and the JTF. The attacked carried into the early hours of the following day.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: An attack on a JTF patrol results in a counterattack and the death of seven Boko Haram attackers. 13 others arrested.
A journalist for the Nigeria Guardian claims to have been attacked by police and security forces for taking photographs of a cabinet ministers car stuck in mud.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram continuers their attacks on telecommunication offices.
Air Nigeria employees protest unpaid benefits at a major airport.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The Militarys Operation Restore Order shoots and kills seven suspected members of Boko Haram and arrested 13 others during a raid operation.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Harams attacks on telecommunication offices continue, many buildings in the area set ablaze.
Unidentified gunmen disrupt a political meeting.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military officials kill seven suspected members of Boko Haram at a military checkpoint. 13 others arrested. No casualty was recorded on the part of the soldiers
House Assembly aides protest unpaid salaries. The group numbered in twenty.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A JTF task force raid a Boko Haram hideout, arrest five members.
Striking workers throw stones and raid the office of a university vice chancellor. The group was upset over the non-payment of allowances.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Nigerian forces arrest 11 members of Boko Haram and recover weapons.
Local government workers in Ekiti State protested against non-implementation of the new minimum wage in local government areas.
Employment of a university protest the non-payment of allowances.
Following a gunfight, the JTF arrested six suspects of a recent kidnapping of a university lecturer.
Employees of the states internal revenue service protest the non-payment of taxes by shop owners.
Protests are held over the recent firing of Delta State Oil Producing Communities Development Commission (DESOPADEC) by the House of Assembly.
Ijaw youths attack a police station in violent protest over an attack by police on an ex-militant Ijaw commander earlier in the week.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of a member of the Federal House of Representatives (name withheld), killing a young boy in the process.
Police reinforce security around the city following waves of Islamic protests in the region, as well as in Jos.

Following the end of Fridays Jumaat prayers, large groups of Muslims gather in Zololo Junction for an anti-American/Israeli protest, in the wake of violence in Libya and Egypt. In response, soldiers told the demonstrating youths to refrain and stop the demonstration and disperse. But the warning was not heeded, forcing the soldiers to shoot sporadically into the air to disperse them. Security forces added further security to the cities of Kano and Kaduna, anticipating further protests.
A group of 2,000 university students gathered to protest reported sexual harassment of female students by some staff of the school.
Residents of Iperu gather to protest the killing of a police officer in recent days.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen kill a security officer and three members of his family. Authorities believe Boko Haram is responsible.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected of belonging to the Boko Haram Islamist sect late Sunday shot dead at least six people who were playing ludo game in northern Nigerian city of Bauchi. Conflicting reports have the death total at 5.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Soldiers manning a checkpoint in northern Nigeria shot to death two ranking members of Boko Haram, including Abu Qaqa, a spokesman for the group.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Members of the JTF killed one member of Boko Haram and arrested two others. Following the shootout the JTF recovered 36 large explosives from a den. The deceased was later learned to be an official in the organization.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A soldier and 13 members of suspected Boko Haram were killed during a shootout after an explosive was thrown into a military vehicle. Other reports have the death total at 10.
Unidentified persons kill four, injure nine and virtually destroy a small village in the early morning hours. It is possible the violence was driven by ethnic unrest.
Gunmen shot dead the acting Chairman of Maiha Local Government Council of Adamawa State, Lawan Datti. Reasons unknown.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the justice commissioner, Zannah Malam, in a small town outside of Maiduguri.

Hundreds of Bakassi youths gathered at the national assembly building to warn if nothing was done by the Federal Government before the October 10 deadline to reclaim the disputed oil-rich area, they would raise a terror group like Boko Haram in Cross River State.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Soldiers shoot and kill two suspected Boko Haram commanders on the outskirts of the city.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on two police officers, killing them. along Afikpo Street

Thousands of Muslims, under the auspices of a pro-Iranian Shiite group, Islamic Movement, gather to burn US and Israeli flags and denouncing a US made anti-Islamic film, following the possible AQIM attack in Benghazi and other worldwide protests.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen stormed a medical clinic, kill the medical directors son.
Four persons killed following a PDP inter party conflict over a candidate.

Youths of the surrounding communities of a oil flow station protest the companys handling of a recent oil spill in the area. After police maintain a presence near the protesters several of the youths engage the them with violence.
32 suspected members of Boko Haram were arrested in a combined JTF/Police effort. The raids took place in several wards of the city over a six hour period.
Tens of thousands protest in Kano against a anti-Islam US film. The group chanted "death to America, death to Israel and death to the enemies of Islam".
Shiite Muslims in the Nigerian town of Katsina burned U.S., French and Israeli flags and a religious leader called for protests to continue until the makers of the film and cartoons are punished.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The JTF killed four and arrested three suspected members of Boko Haram during two separate raid operations throughout the city.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The JTF conducted two separate Boko Haram raids in different parts of the city. Four dead, three arrested.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The Nigerian military kills 35 members of Boko Haram and makes sweeping arrests over two days in three neighborhoods (not named) across the city.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The JTF raids a Boko Haram bomb factory, make 156 arrests of suspects, including a high profile leader of the group.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a car suicide car bomb outside a Catholic Church, at least three killed, plus the bomber, scores injured. Some reports have the death count as high as five.
Thousands of Shiite Muslims gather to denounce the US, UK and Israel following waves of protests around the region. No incidents of violence reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The Nigerian military kills 35 members of Boko Haram and makes sweeping arrests over two days in three neighborhoods (not named) across the city.
Three protesting Lagos State University students are injured when police break up their demonstration against a delay in university payment.
One is killed when two armed men entered Lagos State University and opened fire on students. Two others injured.
State police uncover a Boko Haram bomb factory in a Kano suburb and make two arrests.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces arrest 15 members of Boko Haram who had infiltrated security forces as security border agents.
Police stop a planned protested by the before it is able to begin. The group wishes to secede the Bakassi area from Nigeria to bring it into Cameroon, which it shares many common cultural traits.
University students riot over the killing of a fellow student by a hit-and-run driver. Much of campus property destroyed, including cars and animals of the agricultural department.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram shoot and kill two police officers along a road.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four people are killed when suspected members of Boko Haram open fire on guests of a wedding. At least one reported injury.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Security agents shot and killed two suspected members of Boko Haram as they attempted to carry out operations on a Christian church following an attack on an Islamic school in the same area.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected detonate a suicide style bomb near an Islamic school causing unknown causalities, though injures have been widely reported.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped the Delta State Commissioner for Higher Education, Prof. Hope Eghagha, assumedly for ransom. During the operation, his orderly, a police sergeant, was killed in the crossfire while his driver reportedly sustained serious injury.

Several groups, including ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities, NLC and the national socialist movement gathered to under the umbrella group JAF to protest Nigerias woes on the 52nd university of independence.
Fifty children, dressed in green and white colors, in Lagos staged a peace walk to advocate for violence against women and children, as well as their peace and safety.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram detonate an explosive targeting military patrol, causing one death and four injuries.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two police officers. Boko Haram maintains a presence in the State, but they were not openly suspected here.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shoot and kill 20 at a government housing complex before fleeing ion a boat in the Ngadabul River.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to Boko Haram, opened fire in a student housing area near a polytechnic school in the northeastern Nigerian city of Mubi, killing at least 40 and injuring at least 15 others. In the following days the death count was raised to 48 and a curfew was imposed. It was later learned the gunmen personally knew their victims, specifically targeting Christians. The following week it was determined by authorities the perpetrators were in face Boko Haram. (Conflicting report: some sources have the attack occurring on 2 Oct, while other have the attack on 1 Oct, still others have differences in the causality count. )
An unidentified man (unknown affiliation) detonates a bomb in a heavily populated area of the city, but causes no damage or harm. The individual was later arrested.
A traveler is attacked and nearly killed by ethnic Fulanis.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF forces shoot and kill two suspects in connection to a shooting in a government housing complex which killed twenty.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF forces arrest two Boko Haram members in Kaduna State.
Security forces arrest over 100 suspects, including two students, in connection of a killing at a technical school in recent days.
Nigerian police make several suspected Boko Haram arrests following an attack on a technical school with killed at least 40 students.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Police arrest two suspected members of the Boko Haram sect.

Rival political groups clash following protests. It was reported that the AC was present, but its rival remained unnamed, though it is likely the PDP: Peoples Democratic Party. No injuries reported, though fighting lasted over half and hour.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: One person is dead and 10 others injured when a explosive detonates in a hotel/ Boko Haram is suspected.

An explosion detonated by unknown persons causes seven causalities, which of whom were brought to a military hospital. Conflicting report: The depots Public Relations Officer, Capt. Ibrahim Abdullahi, told the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) in Zaria that no death was recorded in the incident.

Unidentified people attack a Labour Party campaign rally. LP leader publically blame a rival, Action Congress, though this could be a political maneuver. Later in the week it was learned the attackers were cultists.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two University of Maiduguri students. Authorities are uncertain if it was the work of Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram detonate an explosive at a beer garden. Three reported deaths, 12 injuries. Conflicting reports (Xinhua) have one killed, 11 injured.
A teachers union protested the cancellation of World Teachers Day by gathering the singing anti-government songs.
A explosion near a television station kills a woman and wounded five children. It is unclear who the perpetrators were.
A violent mob killed four university students who they believed were thieves. The victims were stripped naked, beaten with sticks, doused with petrol and set ablaze with tires around their necks.
Kwarbai Community Forum in Zaria Local Government Area of Kaduna State at the weekend protested over the arrest of its member and his family for allegedly involvement in Boko Harams activities.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen clash with JTF members in two separate areas of Damaturu. No deaths reports, several gunmen arrested.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen clash with JTF members in two separate areas of Damaturu. No deaths reports, several gunmen arrested.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen attack a small town market with firearms, killing three Chinese construction workers an a Nigeria aid.
Unknown gunmen have attacked Dogon Kuka village in Yobe State, killing 17. At least two victims died immediately. Authorities will not specify if they believe Boko Haram is a suspect.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF members raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill 30, including a senior leader, second-in-command Bakaka, and arrest 11. Conflicting report: some sources claim 31 deaths and 10 arrests.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Mala Kaka, a traditional ruler outspoken against Boko Haram is shot and killed in his home.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the majority leader of the Benus State House assembly, Paul Biam (PDP), and release him 24 hours later. It is unclear if the motive for kidnap was political or criminal.
A motorcycle delivery/taxi group protest the newly imposed restriction to certain roads.
A motorcycle delivery/taxi group protest the newly imposed restriction to certain roads.

Nigerian soldiers angry about the killing of two soldiers in a Boko Haram blast, shot dead more than 30 civilians and seven soldiers in thoughtless rage. A witness saw that soldiers had set fire to about 50 homes and businesses around the area, which sits near the Nigerian Union of Journalists state office and other buildings in Maiduguri. It appeared the soldiers attacked the area using assault rifles and heavy machine guns mounted on armored personnel carriers. Rounds shot from the heavy machine guns destroyed cars and set roofs on fire, which razed buildings and caused damage at a two-story shopping complex.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram (though they did not claim responsibility) detonate a remote controlled explosive near the local headquarters of the Nigeria Union of Journalists. Two passerby soldiers were wounded in the attack when their van drive over the device. Conflicting account: several local residents claim to see six dead taken away by medical units.
Unidentified gunmen attack the official residence of an army commandant, killing at least one member of security personnel.

Nigerian soldiers angry about the killing of two soldiers in a Boko Haram blast, shot dead more than 30 civilians and seven soldiers in thoughtless rage. A witness saw that soldiers had set fire to about 50 homes and businesses around the area, which sits near the Nigerian Union of Journalists state office and other buildings in Maiduguri. It appeared the soldiers attacked the area using assault rifles and heavy machine guns mounted on armored personnel carriers. Rounds shot from the heavy machine guns destroyed cars and set roofs on fire, which razed buildings and caused damage at a two-story shopping complex. The military later denied the ever occurred.
Unidentified people attack a political headquarters of the PDP as factious members protest party policy.
Students of the University of Port Harcourt burn houses and cars in protest the recent killing riot and killing of four of their colleagues.
Residents of Ajeromi Ifelodun Local Council of Lagos State march to the headquarters of an electric company to protest a recent rate hike due to a recently imposed tax.
Students block the entrance to state offices, preventing the governor and his deputy from entering. The group was protesting an alleged non-payment of their bursary allowances.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two policemen escorting immunization officials were shot dead today by gunmen on motorcycles at Kofar Dawanau area of Kano metropolis. It was later learned Boko Haram was responsible, and arrests were made.
Two unidentified men assassinate a Enugu State monarch, or traditional ruler, at this shop. Police make several arrests in connection to the murder later in the week.
Three Christian Berom farmers are killed by Islamic Fulanis, adding to the ongoing ethnic strife.

Cross River lawmakers left the state house and went into the streets to protest the Federal Governments decision not to appeal the judgment of the International Court of Justice (ICJ) which ceded the oil-rich Bakassi Peninsula to the Republic of Cameroon. The protest march ended at the governors office with Governor Liyel Imoke appealing for calm.
Students gather to protest a rate and fee hike of the university. Police react to the demonstration with an increased presence, but to not engage the students.

Unidentified gunmen on motor bikes attacked a Federal Road Safety Commission (FRSC) patrol vehicle, killing two officers and injuring one seriously. The motivation for the violence was not speculated on.

Unknown gunmen yesterday bombed a police station and Unity Bank branch in Gwaram town in Jigawa State with Improvised Explosive Devices (IED). Though the perpetrators were unidentified, Boko Haram has engaged in similar activities in the past.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Police arrest eight suspected members of Boko Haram who they believe are responsible for the shooting deaths of two police officers the previous day.

A day following similar violence, a Fulani militia attacked Riyom Local Government Area of Plateau, 14 reported deaths. The attack may have been directed at Berom ethnic Christians, however this information is not clear. Conflicting information asserts 21 deaths over two days of attacks.
Hundreds of residents of housing estate gather outside the National Assembly building to protest its planned demolition by the government.
Hausa Muslims and Berom youths clashed over a disputed land where Muslims usually used for their praying ground during Islamic festivals. One person is allegedly killed.
A 75 year-old woman, along with her three children are killed by unknown gunmen. Fulani herdsman were later suspected, and several were arrested in connection with the murders.
Members of the PDP hold a political rally in protest of internal factions of the party which they believe are working counter to the vision of the party.
Workers of the Electoral Commission protest the government over non-payment of wages.
Four are killed in three separate towns (names unknown or not provided) in a Riyom district over a continuing conflict. The death tool raised to 20 over the course of a week.
Youths take to the streets to protest the killing of a man they believe was beaten by the police.

Unidentified gunmen kidnap the Rivers State Commissioner for Power, Mr. Augustine Nwokocha, along with his assistant. The perpetrators may have been pirates seeking ransom, witch is common in the area, though the facts are unclear.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A blast, seemingly targeting soldiers, detonates, but causes no causalities. Authorities believe the perpetrators are of Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four members of a family are killed as they exited a church. Boko Haram is suspected, though authorities cannot determine why this specific group was targeted.

Unknown assailants, disguised as police, attack a mosque in rural Kaduna, as well as the home of a local leader, killing at least 24 people in the pre dawn hours. Some believe the perpetrators were a local band of thieves seeking revenge, others, Boko Haram.
Nomadic Muslim herdsmen attacked a rural Christian village in central Nigeria over long-running land disputes, killing at least 30 people. The name of the village attacked is unknown or not provided.
Classmates of a murdered student protest against the violence, throw stones at police when they attempt to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas. Gunmen killed a "traffic warden" in this location.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Members of the JTF shoot and kill 24 suspected members of Boko Haram while repelling an attack. The militants launched their attacks from the homes of civilians late Monday night and a protracted firefight carried into the following morning. Conflicting report: the Daily Trust claims the death count was 54. Zannari areas of Lagos street

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Witnesses said a gunman suspected to belong to Boko Haram shot dead a police traffic warden in the city within view of a military checkpoint. The gunman simply walked away after the attack unstopped, witnesses said.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: During a firefight between Boko Haram and JTF forces 10 civilians are allegedly killed by Boko Haram in crossfire. Following the battle military command disputed this claim. Zannari areas of Lagos street
The police detonate an IED after it was discovered by a local opposite a motor park. There were no causalities reported.
Students at the Osun State College of Education riot in protest of two colleagues killed in a car accident. Fifteen injured, vehicles vandalized.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two of a firefight that killed 24 suspected members of Boko Haram. Zannari areas of Lagos street
About 2,000 block traffic in protest of a stone quarry company, which they believe have not paid agreed upon royalties to the town.
Multiple explosions targeting JTF forces in a market cause injury, but no death. Perpetrators unknown.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A bomb targeting soldiers is detonated by Boko Haram. 24 killed in the explosion, soldiers retaliated against local civilians following the attack.
Following a Boko Haram bomb attack against them, soldiers retaliated against civilians. Four houses burnt and witnesses heard gunshots.
A bomb detonates in a industrial area, no injury reported.
An explosion damages a church building, no reported causalities.
Fulani herdsmen have attacked a bus killing four people in Gwatukuru village near Dass Local Government Area in Bauchi State. Nine injured.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack a suspected security checkpoint. Two soldiers sustain injuries.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Security forces arrest a high profile member of Boko Haram, Shuaibu Mohammed Bama, at the home of a Senator. Few details provided.
The bloody clash between Fulani herdsmen and Eggon farmers in Kadarko Community in Nasarawa State, has left three people dead.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Multiple explosions occur throughout the city for the second straight day, detonated by suspected Boko Haram. A military source said some buildings had been destroyed by homemade bombs and a security checkpoint was attacked, death toll stands at 11.
Security forces discover and dispose of unexploded bombs throughout the city. Authorities believe the explosives were planted by Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A Chinese construction worker and three others are shot and killed by suspected Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram detonates an IED outside a church at 11am. Four killed in the attack, three injured. Hundreds of residents flee the city following the three days of attacks.
Participants in a governorship election enter a ballot distribution center to protest the poor distribution of materials to all polling places.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF forces arrest a senior commander of Boko Haram, but decline to share his name. The arrest occurred at the home of the former governor of Borno State.
Residents discover the bodies of nine people they charge were killed by soldiers hunting suspects in a roadside bomb blast four days earlier.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Eight people are killed after a Boko Haram attack, the third in as many days for the city. At least 30 dead over the course of the campaign, though the JTF say this number is inaccurate, asserting the number is closer to 13. The local hospital counts 23.
Police forces discover and successfully control-detonate an explosive hidden within the grounds of Gombe State University.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: An explosive device targeting a military patrol went off on a road in Nigerias northeastern city of Potiskum, setting the vehicle on fire. There were at least six soldiers on board the car, but their status is unclear. A nearby market was affected by the blast as well.
Police forces arrest a Osun based reported over an unfavorable article. He man was released several hours later.

Commercial cyclists popularly known as okada on Monday marched through some major streets in Lagos, protesting the state governments fresh clampdown and seizure of their bikes. Many attacked police officers and vandalized property.
An IED explodes in a crowed market, causalities unknown.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF teams raid several homes in the morning, arresting several suspected members of Boko Haram.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: JTF forces arrest a suspected member of Boko Haram who is believed to be behind a string of ethnic assassinations.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: The headmaster of Ari Primary School, Musa Magazai and one Mallam Galtamari, along with his two children, were killed in the early hours by gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect. The killings were perpetrated despite the 4pm-7am curfew imposed by Governor Ibrahim Gaidam last Monday.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, have burnt the house of a village head in Gwaje, Alhaji Mohammed Salisu Auwal, and killed two of his children. Witness: The gunmen ransacked my neighbors house, tied down the two kids, believed to be the biological sons of the village head inside the house and burnt them beyond recognition."

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack the home of a man and set him ablaze.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, kill the son of a political figure.
A explosion, believed to be a bomb, injures two in rural Bauchi State.

A suicide bomber rammed an SUV loaded with explosives into a Catholic church holding Mass on Sunday in northern Nigeria, killing at eight fifteen people and wounding 145 others. Some witnesses said the death toll could be as high as 12. They said the dead included children. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Christian youths retaliated against a group of Muslims following the blast, believing Boko Haram, or another Islamic group responsible. The death toll grew as the day wore on.
Fulani militiamen attack a pub, kill four of the patrons and injuring seven others. It is not clear if this is a ethno-religious attack.

Following the attack on a Catholic church a group of Christian youths angrily assaulted several Muslims passing by the Church in an act of revenge. One individual is burned alive by the mob. Also, Muslim youths in their strongholds, of Tudun Wada, Rigassa and Kawo were said to have armed themselves in readiness for any possible reprisals from Christians.
Leaders communities in Akuku-Toru Local Government Area of Rivers State on protested against the alleged plan to cede oil wells in the council to neighboring Bayelsa State.
