Two House of Representatives aspirants and their allies or supporters clash in Ibadan, at least ten injuries.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Miringa, destroys communication and snatched a sports utility vehicle belonging to the Borno State chairman of the All Progressives Congress.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram reportedly takes over Wulgo. Date(s) unknown, violence unknown.

Scores of residents of Unity Estate, Igbogbo-Baiyeku Local Council Development Area, LCDA, protested to (or at, not known) the Lagos State House of Assembly over incessant violence against the community by some land grabbers popularly called "Omo-Onile."
University of Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital (UPTH) workers protested against the storage in their morgue of the body of a doctor who died of the Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) for fear of outbreak.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack and overtake Dalwa. It appears this was done by the same group and the same operation as the excursion into Jibwhiwhui. Fourteen dead between the two towns.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with "very little resistance from military forces." The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with "very little resistance from military forces." The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

Unidentified gunmen attack an army post in a Bauchi suburb. The sources describes the attacks as "insurgents," but does not further attempt to identity the attackers. One soldier reported dead, another injured.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack Jibwhiwhui village (and its immediate areas) over two days, killing 14.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: After gaining control of Gamboru from government forces on 25/08 residents report Boko Haram had been tracking residents who had fled the area and killing them. Residents said 42 people have been killed while many others have been abducted - many forcibly conscripted into the military. Dates of the specific killings not known.

Youths believed to be members of a faction of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta State forced the shutting down of the Erhioke Flow Station over the politics of the management company.

Two persons were killed while many others were displaced in Shangev-Ya district of Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State, following a communal clash "at the weekend" between Dzev and Mbakyaa communities.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack Jibwhiwhui village (and its immediate areas) over two days, killing 14.
BringBackOurGirls supporters marked the 140 days of the abduction of Chibok schoolgirls in a protest condemning government inaction.
A group of Coca dealers protest at a local Ministry of Agriculture office over a levy directed at them.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram members reportedly took over Bama town - the second largest town in the state - and hoisted the sects flag, following a gun battle between they and Nigerian soldiers. "Scores" killed before soldiers fled the city alongside civilians - thousands displaced. Military sources who spoke to journalists in Maiduguri said the soldiers were able to kill about 70 of the militants and injure about 30 others. Some reports have the death total as high as 130. The number of soldiers and civilians killed are not known. Despite several sources reporting the fall a Bama to Boko Haram, Xinhua and This Day (Lagos) reports the military repelled the attack, the latter describing the battle as Boko Harams "Waterloo." It is possible Boko Haram retreated, regrouped, and attacked again. A military airstrike was involved in the battle.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack and kill two police at Magama Gumau station in Toro LGA.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram overtakes Banki during the evening hours without violence. Many residents flee into Cameroon.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram overtakes Bara without violence. Many residents flee into Cameroon.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the Chief Magistrate for Enugu South at his home, specific location unknown.

During the early hours of the day unidentified gunmen burn a brewery and shoot sporadically. Witnesses place the death total between 50-55, others 18, though official reports hold the total at seven. Wukari is mainly Jukun, and it is believe the origin of the attack is related to the removal of the traditional ruler of the area.
55 are reported killed following a Fulani attack on the Nasarawa-Eggon communities of Agbolagu, Kampani and Fadama-Bona.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANNM: National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives
NOTES: The National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives (NANNM) staged a protest over alleged poor working conditions.
Students demonstrate along Benin-Ore federal highway outside Igouriakhi in protest over poor infrastructure and unpaid salaries of their lecturers.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
NOTES: Nigeria Union of Local Government Employees, NULGE, Kabba-Bunu branch protest non-payment of salaries.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on a Eggon settlement. The attack occurred mid-morning. Some sources have the death total as high as 31.
Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Ilorin-west Local Government Area of Kwara State protested the inauguration of a factional party chairman in the area.
Residents of Otuoke protest, forcibly shutting down nearby Federal University. The protesters were angry that the management of the institution denied them employment and admission opportunities.

Residents of Sabo-Oke area of Ilorin, Kwara State attacked workers of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) who went there to disconnect electricity supply over unpaid debts. No reported injuries.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Gulak in the early hours of the day, causing residents to flee. Several residents from surrounding villages also fled. Causality not known.

A group of members of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Kwara State staged a protest against the state leadership of the party over alleged imposition of a candidate as the partys chairman in Ilorin West Local Government Area.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces launched an attack on Boko Haram in Kawuri, killing 50 of its members. The attack was pre-emptive, as information was gathered that Boko Haram was planning an attack on nearby Konduga. Following the operation soldiers went on patrols in Konduga.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and "other towns" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and "other towns" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and "other towns" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

At least six persons were allegedly killed and five others injured as a result of an attack on Lamba Gyambar community in Wase local government area of Plateau State. The unidentified assailants attacked the community around 11pm shooting sporadically and setting homes ablaze.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Twenty members of Boko Haram are killed (some sources claim 21) in an attempt to overtake Buratai and target a military commander. The attack took place during the morning hours. A school building was also razed.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: "Fierce" fighting between Boko Haram and military forces in Mubi. "Scores" of [Boko Haram] killed in the fighting, soldiers reported injuries. Exact date is not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Michika, "making strong gains" in several parts of the city. Boko Haram later claimed they had gained control over the entirety of the city. Causalities not known.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.
Protesters marched in and around Agbor over a missing voter register for the area. The demonstration was peaceful.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Following an assault on Michika by Boko Haram, military forces launch a campaign to liberate the city, which included an air assault. During the battle, one known causality of note was the son of a former politician, all totalling 24. Boko Haram causalities not known - the fighting was reported as "fierce." As a result of the attack, the army has moved sensitive weapons from Mubi. Despite an early report the military had retaken the city, it was later learned Boko Haram maintained control of the area.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: On 08/08 military officials announced they had retaken Bama following a air bombing campaign. The dates of the bombing runs, causalities, and the actual transfer of territory were not reported. Despite the alleged takeover, later reports suggest that many of the villagers have died or are dying of starvation.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Bazza village. Date vague, causalities unknown.

No fewer than six persons sustained various degrees of injuries while about 15 houses were destroyed as youths attacked residents of Ogbetiti/Okeluche village in Ikenga Ogidi community, Idemili North Council Area. The attack is believed to have been motivated over the control of land.
Staff of Nigeria Export Processing Zones Authority (NEPZA) protested at the organisations headquarters in Abuja over alleged poor welfare.
Retirees protest the non-payment of their pensions in Asaba.
A group of youth in the Ode-Ugborodo community attack a group of sailors during the early morning hours after ordering them to leave the area. Two injuries reported.
A riotous mob attacked the vigilante group (not identified) guarding the Main Market for allegedly killing a labourer over a SIM Card dispute.
An explosive went off at the Okaka Estate, Yenagoa, Bayelsa State, causing panic among the residents. Although nobody died, one person was reportedly injured.
BringBackOurGirls supporters protest in Abuja for the removal of presidential aids.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Former Military Forces of Nigeria; Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
NOTES: Retired military personnel protest over irregular pension payments in Abuja.
Retired soldiers, numbering 100, protested in Benin City over the non-payment of pensions. The group threatened guerrilla warfare if their demands were not met.
Retirees of the Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN), protested in Lagos against the non-payment of their accumulated pension benefits.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.
Workers of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado Ekiti, have staged a protest and called for the removal of the Rector of the institution after several employees salaries had been cut.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: PENGASSAN workers strike and protest at the Group Managing Director office in Abuja.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the casuality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the fate of the pilot is not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram launches a "massive" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the causality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the pilot was later captured by Boko Haram, who nearly a month later released a video of his beheading.

Young people believed to be students of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado-Ekiti, went on rampage as they protested power outage in Erifun community where many students of the institution are known to reside. The protesting students stoned the vehicle of legal luminary and also attempted to vandalise one of the hostels in Afe Babalola University. The violent protest also carried over into nearby Erifun.
Anglican Church leaders and petitioners protest the destruction of their church building.
Protesting students of Federal Polytechnic clash with police over power outages. Causalities, injuries not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram abducts a group of 50 women and children from Gulak. "[Boko Haram] started loading our women and children into their vehicles, threatening to shoot whoever disobeyed them. Everybody was scared," a witness stated. The date of the attack was not included in the report, but is likely to have occured on 13/09 or 14/09.
Fulani gunmen attack Mbar in Bokkos LGA killing five with machetes. The attack occurred during midday.

No fewer than twenty persons have been feared dead and scores of others injured when Fulani herdsmen allegedly invaded Tunari village in Wukari Local Government of Taraba State. The attackers were said to have stormed the village at 10 am and set houses ablaze while most residents were attending a church service.

Students of Lagos State University (LASU) External System stormed the Governors Office, Alausa, Ikeja, in protest over various complaints, including high fees, extended academic calendar, delayed issuance of results, among others.
A group of ex-militants protest in Bomadi over the proposed creation of a lopsided number of polling units in their area campared to other areas of the country.
11,000 aggrieved pensioners of Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) embarked on peaceful protest to demand payment of their entitlements.
30 women in the Watt Market, Calabar protest at the Cross River house assembly over what they describe as double taxation by the state government.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashs with military forces in Baaza and Michika.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram again attempts to overtake Konduga. Military forces retaliate, killing an estimated 100. The battle is believed to have lasted over twelve hours.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashes with military forces in Baaza and Michika.
Trader protest levies at Eke-Awka market.
Various groups protest a ban on Okada-motorcycle business in the area.

A group of villagers attempt to lynch a Nigerien national on the suspicion of involvement in an alleged ritual murder of a young girl. The police intervened, however, drawing ire from the larger community, many of whom later attacked the police station. Four rioters were killed (some sources claim eight) when the police launched a defence, 89 arrested.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces fight through a Boko Haram ambush, capture a senior leader, identity unknown. One soldier was reported dead after the battle.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Following an extensive battle the previous day, Boko Haram again returns to Konduga (presumably to retrieve their dead) and is engaged into another battle. Sixty reported Boko Haram deaths, military forces wound and kill a notable commander, later revealed to be Abubakar Shekau, though Shekau may have been captured in nearby Benisheikh. A matter of dispute: some believe this may have been a been a body double. It was gathered that when the militants discovered that Konduga was a no go area, they headed to nearby Benisheikh and laid ambush for troops on patrol duties.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attempts to take over the Kano-Maiduguri highway in Ngamdu, and are dramatically pushed back by military forces who report to have killed 150 or more in the ensuing battle.

A group of villagers attempt to lynch a Nigerien national on the suspicion of involvement in an alleged ritual murder of a young girl. The police intervened, however, drawing ire from the larger community, many of whom later attacked the police station. Four rioters were killed when the police launched a defence, 89 arrested.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two suicide bombers and a gunmen enter a university campus, kill 15. Boko Haram was later blamed for the attack. Among the dead were the two suicide bombers.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram kill the Governor of Adamawas uncle during a raid on his Madagali residence. The attack was an apparent targeted assassination. Following the attack it was reported a Boko Haram commander was residing in the residence.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Fighters from Boko Haram stormed the northeastern town of Mainok, attacking civilians, sparking a gun battle that killed at least 36 people and continued into the following day. Among the dead were civilians.
Police open fire and kill two vigilantes as they attempted to lynch a group of suspected armed robbers.
Gunmen wearing military uniforms attack Tadabale villiage, kill two people and steal cattle.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Fighters from Boko Haram stormed the northeastern town of Mainok, attacking civilians, sparking a gun battle that killed at least 36 people and continued into the following day. Among the dead were civilians.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Dressed as customers, suspected Boko Haram attack a market in Monguno, killing 9 and injuring 10. The attack occurred "at the weekend."
A vigilante group lynches three suspected kidnappers.

Unidentified gunmen attack a Kogi police station at Adogo, stealing weapons and a armoured vehicle. No causalities or injuries reported. Police later reported the attack had been foiled by their forces.
A group of women throw mud and stones at the convoy of Governor Yero at Fadan Karshi (Kaibi). The group was upset the governor had not visited their town following a series of recent attacks.

Urhobo youths, under the aegis of Coalition of Urhobo Youth Organisation, CUYO staged a peaceful protest at the Delta State Government House against what they described as the victimisation of Urhobo candidates who applied for the position Vice Chancellor of the Delta State University.
Players of a Kaduna-based football team protest the government over non-payment of salaries.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Ten Boko Haram commanders surrender to military forces at Kawuri. Their capitulation comes days following reports Abubakar Shekau was found KIA.
A group of Eggon youth attack a Nasarawa Eggon village and burned a house belonging to a relative of the state chairman, who may have been Fulani - motivation not known. Injuries not reported.
Supporters of Ekiti State governor-elect, Ayo Fayose staged a peaceful protest against a potential court ruling that would potentially truncate his authority as governor.
Disengaged workers of the defunct Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) in Kano staged a peaceful protest over the non-payment of their entitlements by the Federal Government.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces and an unnamed vigilante group arrest between 50 - 150 fleeing members of Boko Haram in Biu. The group is believe to have fled from fighting in Konduga last week.
Ten Eggon people were killed when a large number of Fulani gunmen invaded the Gidan Gambo settlement of Lafia-East. The attack may be related to a Eggon-led attack on a village in the area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Over one hundred zonal chairmen of Lagos State branch of RTEAN stormed the national headquarters of the association in Abuja, protesting what they called an attempt to impose a candidate by the state government as their chairman. The date of the protest is vague - it may have occurred on 25/09.

Supporters of Ekiti State governor-elect, Ayo Fayose staged a peaceful protest at the Ado Ekiti High Court, against the trial of the governor-elect on his eligibility to contest the June 21 governorship election. This was the second such protest in Ado-Ekiti in as many days.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SKIPFO: Southern Kaduna Indigenes Progressive Forum
NOTES: Members of the Southern Kaduna Indigenes Progressive Forum protest the presence of Governor Yero at Fadan Karshi (Kaibi), accusing the governor of neglect following an attack on the village. The protest comes days following a similar protest in the area.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

NOTES: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.
Two factions of the PDP clash over a leadership position at the capital building in Awka. Injuries unknown, though the source described the fight as a "melee."
