Violence became a series tit-for-tat attacks over the several days. Two deaths recorded, one on Sunday and the other on Monday.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram releases a video on 12/20 of their members executing civilians who were lying face down in a Bama dormitory. The date of the executions are not known, but likely occurred following the capture of a portion of Bama on 16/12. Causality numbers not known or reported.
Some lawmakers loyal to the Ebonyi State Governor were attacked by party rivals loyal to the speaker of the state House of Assembly, resulting in injuries to three persons at the Assembly.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Witnesses claim Boko Haram moved an operational base from Gwoza area to Bama, less than 70km away from Maiduguri. Specific date of transfer or establishment not clear. Source dated 19/12.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
NOTES: NUGLE workers protest inaction by the state government to pass a law to their benefit. The protest was staged outside the state house building in Akure.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: The National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS, protested what it described as the "poorly and uncoordinated" distribution of the Permanent Voters Card, PVC, in Lagos.
Workers at Akwa Ibom Airport protest over two days over poor conditions of service.
Ex-militants protest in Warri over late amnesty payments. Date unknown: Source published on 19/12 stated the protest occurred "a few days ago."

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram lines and executed 50 elderly people in Gwoza LGA "this week." The group captured their victims as they tried to flee the area, collecting and shooting them by firing squad at Uvaghe Central Primary School.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani attacked Adekaa village in Agatu Local Government Area, killing six. The reason for the attack is not known. In the days following residents reported several unidentified persons wandering in and out of the village.

Aggrieved former Niger Delta militants under the federal governments amnesty programme protested over the non-payment of arrears of their allowances. The protesters blocked the East-West Road near Patani, a boundary town between Bayelsa and Delta states.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Bulabulin on 16/12, battles with military forces before being repelled after several days (17/12 - 19/12). An estimated 75 members of Boko Haram killed and two soldiers in the battle. Bulabulin lies near Gumsuri, the cite of a recent mass Boko Haram abduction.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram militants killed an unspecified number of people in Madagali LGA of Adamawa State in the "past few days." Source dated 19/12.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram militants waylaid motorists in Madari village, Kukawa Local Government Area of Borno State, killing 10 people, and kidnapping a young woman with her two-year old child.
The son of a former PDP chairman is abducted the killed by unidentified gunmen in Abuja. The date of the killing is not known; it was reported a state official "condoled with the families" on 17/12.
No fewer than 10 persons were said to have been killed when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked Sabon Gida Shagogo in Donga local government area of Taraba State.

About 10 people were reported killed, including a young child, in the early hours of the day in Angwan Dauda (Ungwan Daudu) village, Sanga local government area of Kaduna State following an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen.
Ex-militants protest in Mbiama over late amnesty payments. A similar protest occurred in Warri "a few days ago."
Academic and commercial activities in Federal University, Oye-Ekiti and the town itself were paralysed, as workers and students took to the streets to protest poor working condition.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Bulabulin on 16/12, battles with military forces before being repelled after several days (17/12 - 19/12). An estimated 75 members of Boko Haram killed and two soldiers in the battle. Bulabulin lies near Gumsuri, the cite of a recent mass Boko Haram abduction.
A clash between supporters of All Progressives Congress, APC, and Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, in Lagos Island, has left two persons dead over two days.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: IGGO: Imo Grassroots for Goodluck Jonathan Organisation
NOTES: No fewer than 2000 youths under the auspices of the Imo Grassroots for Goodluck Jonathan Organisation (IGGO) took to the streets of Owerri burning brooms and All Progressives Congress (APC) flags in the state. They also burnt their partys membership (APC) cards and symbols in front of the Government House Owerri, declaring the APC party dead in the state. Additionally, the youths also declared their allegiance to the PDP.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Bulabulin on 16/12, battles with military forces before being repelled after several days (17/12 - 19/12). An estimated 75 members of Boko Haram killed and two soldiers in the battle. Bulabulin lies near Gumsuri, the cite of a recent mass Boko Haram abduction.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Attempts by Boko Haram insurgents to capture Damagun was resisted by security forces, leading to a fierce battle that lasted well over two hours. Witnesses said the insurgents threw many explosive devices into Damagun police station and shot sporadically into a military base. No causalities reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Disguised as headers, Boko Haram launches an assault on a Damboa mosque only to be pushed back by military forces in the area. A reported 80 Boko Haram dead, two soldiers. Causality numbers vary from source to source, some reporting as numbers as high as 115.
A clash between supporters of All Progressives Congress, APC, and Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, in Lagos Island, has left two persons dead over two days.

Two female undergraduate students of the Federal University of Technology (FUT) Minna, were nearly lynched to death by irate members of the public when they were suspected and accused of being suicide bombers.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.
Members of an oil union protest in several locations, preventing all workers from entering oil installations in all eight of Bayelsas LGAs. Locations within each LGA not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces launch an infantry offensive on Boko Haram held Goniri town, which included an air strike. Causalities not known.

Suspected "cultists" target and shoot a member of the OPC and a bus driver in Benin following a clash over several days between two street gangs. It is not clear if the targeting was expressly political.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram sect attacked the headquarters of Geidam Local Government Area of Yobe State. It was gathered that the attackers stormed the town around 4.30 p.m. through the eastern part of the town in Hilux vans and motorcycles. At least 20 dead, including a state official and a cleric, plus injures. A Geidam resident also told [the source] that the insurgents freed also 17 prison inmates before torching the prison building located near the emirs place.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A car bomb at a bus station in Gombe city killed at least 20 people and injured 60. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack a market in Bauchi, seven reported dead, 25 injured. Over the next week the death count is raised to 19. 130 shops destroyed.

Oron youths in Akwa Ibom protested over "undue marginalisation" of Oron nation by the current administration. The youths, numbering more than 1,000, conducted a peaceful demonstration march from Oron to Civic Centre, Oron Beach and Oya Oron Junction.
A suspected suicide bomber of unknown origin rammed an automobile into a military checkpoint in Bajoga. No heavy damage reported.
Police disrupt a Bring Back our Girls protest with a barricade in Abuja. The barricade "enraged" the protesters, though there was no report of violent incident.

A soldier was seized and apprehended by a crowd at a mosque who suspected he was a suicide bomber after he refused to reveal the contents of his bag; police intervened to protect him from attempts to beat him.
Police shoot and kill two Fulani brothers who refused to bay a bribe. The police were later arrested.
Two German engineers are killed while travelling in Nigeria. Location and perpetrators not known.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed 10 civilians in Tataura. A few other victims sustained varying degrees of injury. The source describes the gunmen as "bandits, "though did not articulate anything stolen from the victims.
Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen were reported to have invaded Tattaura village in Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna State, killing 10 people about 10p.m. on Saturday, 27/12.

ACTOR1: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
ACTOR2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: NURTW and RTEAN unions clash at Lipakala junction in Ondo. It is believed NURTW initiated the attack after RTEAN levelled an insult to its leadership. At least two injuries reported. Date unknown - source dated 28/12.
A bomb blast targeting spectators of a football game detonated and kills a sugarcane vendor in in Potiskum. No other reported deaths or injuries.

An explosive buried at the assembly ground of Ari Kime primary in Potiskum, Yobe State killed a wheel barrow pusher. [The source] gathered that the bomb went off around 7:35pm when a water vendor using a wheel barrow tried crossing assembly ground and stepped on the bomb. A resident in the area said that those who planted the bomb may be targeting final year students currently attending special classes for the their Senior School Certificate Examination (SSCE). Perpetrator identity not known.
Unidentified gunmen kill a pharmacist in Enugu. The gunmen are suspected to be hired assassins, though their motive is not known.

Youths and other supporters of an All Progressives Congress (APC) senatorial aspirant from Delta State protested at the partys national secretariat in Abuja over alleged imposition of another candidate as the partys flag bearer for Delta South senatorial district. The Delta Coalition for Change (DCC) were also involved in the protest.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MOSOP: Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters from Ogoniland under the aegis of MOSOP shut business activities and vehicular traffic along the Port Harcourt-Aba Road in Port Harcourt to protest against their perceived political and environmental marginalisation by political parties in Rivers State.
Hundreds of people took to the streets in Saminaka town, headquarters of Lere Local Government Area of Kaduna State over the posting of a Sharia court judge to the area.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A group of three suicide bombers detonate their vehicle at a security checkpoint killing only themselves. Military injuries not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack Kautakari, kills fifteen residents. Witnesses said scores of insurgents armed with rifles and petrol bombs stormed Kautakari around 7am. Kautakari is in the Chibok area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MOSOP: Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People
NOTES: Hundreds of youths from the eight local government areas that make up Rivers West senatorial district protested at the PDP headquarters in Port Harcourt in what they described as the sham primary election of the party for the senatorial district. The group, under the aegis of MOSOP, threatened to boycott an upcoming election. MOSOP held a similar protest in Port Harcourt earlier in the week.
Soldiers shot and killed a suspected suicide bomber outside a military barracks in Bolari after she refused to be searched. The affiliation of the bomber unknown.

Four are dead following two non-consecutive days of clashes in Mangu LGA (specific locations not known) between Fulanis and a group of unnamed Mwagahvuu speaking people. The clashes occurred on or between December 31 2014 and January 2, 2015. Note: Mangu and Barakin Ladi are adjacent; each event may have been spill over from a connecting area.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen have kidnapped 40 boys and young men in Malari on New Years Eve. The kidnapping is believed to be forces conscription into their fighting force.
Seven are killed when a bomb detonates on a Potiskum bus. Perpetrators not known.

Unidentified gunmen beheaded one person and shot dead another in Kantoma village of Mangu Local Government Area, Plateau state. Residents blame Fulani herdsmen, though authorities have not speculated as to the perpetrator.
A suicide bomb exploded in Maiduwa town, killing six people; the perpetrator was in the car at the time of the attack.

"Indigenes" (possibly Bassa) attack a Fulani settlement at Ekpan-Abugi location, Kupa district of Lokoja Local Government. Several buildings damages, causalities not known. Exact date of the attack not know. Source claims the attack occurred "recently."
A suicide bomber attacks a military barracks in Gombe killing "several." A similar attempted attack occurred in Bolari the previous evening. Perpetrator not known.
A suicide bomber blew himself up at the gates of a church in Nigerias northeastern city of Gombe during a New Year service, wounding at least eight people. Perpetrators not known.

At least 10 houses were confirmed burnt and some people injured in Shurun village of Barkin Ladi local government area of Plateau State following a spill over of attacks between indigenes (not identified) and Fulani herders. No deaths reported. It is believed the battle was triggered by the beheading of a man earlier in the week. Note: Mangu and Barakin Ladi are adjacent; each event may have been spill over from a connecting area.

Four are dead following two non-consecutive days of clashes in Mangu LGA (specific locations not known) between Fulanis and a group of unnamed Mwagahvuu speaking people. The clashes occurred on or between December 31 2014 and January 2, 2015. Note: Mangu and Barakin Ladi are adjacent; each event may have been spill over from a connecting area. One source claims ten dead on the second day of fighting. (Nigerian Tribune)
About 15 people have been reported killed in Ambe-Madaki village in Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna state in an attack by unknown gunmen. The attack occurred in the early morning hours.

Unidentified persons attacked and killed the district head of Zangang in Attacked chiefdom area of Kaura local government of Kaduna State, Mr Yohanna Daniel Shinkut. Residents in the area link the attack on Funalis, cause unknown.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram launches a major attack on Baga, eventually taking over the town after military forces abandoned a base. Exact causality figures are not known, though most estimates are near 100. [A source] also confirmed the abduction of about 40 young men by [Boko Haram]. The attack caused residents from the surrounding area to flee. Boko Haram attack villagers throughout the week causing mass causalities.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces attempt to retake Baga town, which had been captured by Boko Haram the previous day. Clashes reported; state military forces were eventually pushed back. "Significant" Boko Haram deaths reported. Throughout the day Boko Haram continued their assault on civilian in the city.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A sustained, several day-long attack (3-4 days) of residents by Boko Haram of the held town of Baga. Early estimates have 2,000 dead throughout the week, though this figure may be a total count in the entire area throughout the week. A witness claimed the majority of the dead were the old, women and children. The town was destroyed following the several attacks through out the week. 3,200 displaced. Conflicting report: Despite the high casualties government officials claim no more that 150 dead.
An explosive placed in a polythene bag detonates in Lugda (Lugga), killing one. The explosion may have been accidental, though this fact remains unclear.

Gunmen in the early hours of the day attacked residents of Kantoma Village in Mangu Local Government Area of Plateau State, killing two people. Ten houses were also said to have been torched in the attack. The attack may be linked to ongoing ethnic strife elsewhere in the LGA.
The Federal Polytechnic, Ado-Ekiti was shut down by protest staged by all workers union who demanded the removal of the Rector, accusing her of embezzling a sum of money.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Troops from the 7 Division of the Nigerian Army, clashed with suspected Boko Haram insurgents at Mainari village, not far from Kawuri in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State. Military forces were on their way to attempt to recover Baga town. A credible source described the encounter as "a bad outing" stressing that troops had to retreat when it was evident that going further would not yield positive result. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A sustained, several day-long attack (3-4 days) of residents by Boko Haram of the held town of Baga. Early estimates have 2,000 dead throughout the week, though this figure may be a total count in the entire area throughout the week. A witness claimed the majority of the dead were the old, women and children. The town was destroyed following the several attacks through out the week. 3,200 displaced. Conflicting report: Despite the high casualties government officials claim no more that 150 dead.
The bureau chief of several national newspapers is assaulted by PDP youths while taking photographs of a rally in support of Governor Oshiomhole (PDP).
Students parents of the Delta State Ministry of Women Affairs Primary School protest over delays of renovations to the school.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
NOTES: University of Benin students protest the recent demolition of parts of university by the Edo state government.
Victims of 2011 post-election violence protest over non-payment of compensation from the state and federal governments.
The Federal College of Veterinary and Medical Laboratory Technology ceased operation after students protest an increase of school fees.
Youths "recently" protest against a still in the construction of a hydroelectric dam - exact date not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A sustained, several day-long attack (3-4 days) of residents by Boko Haram of the held town of Baga. Early estimates have 2,000 dead throughout the week, though this figure may be a total count in the entire area throughout the week. A witness claimed the majority of the dead were the old, women and children. The town was destroyed following the several attacks through out the week. 3,200 displaced. Conflicting report: Despite the high casualties government officials claim no more that 150 dead.
Suspected PDP shoot APC supporters in Bori. Causalities not known, some "laying critical in hospital."

Suspected PDP members attack the home of an APC gubernatorial candidate (Alhaji Muhammed Inuwa Yahaya) in Gombe, assault his security detail and ransack the house. The group also destroyed the partys bill boards, posters and buildings. No causalities reported.

Scores of residents in Lagos took to the streets to protest what they described as imposition of Executive Secretaries by certain leaders in the All Progressives Congress (APC). It is not clear if the protesters were APC members themselves.
Supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC), including youths and women staged a protest in Makurdi, Benue State over imposition of candidates by the state leadership of the party.

University of Benin students protest the recent demolition of parts of university by the Edo state government for a second day. The group attacked property of the Edo State Government, set a bus alight, and blocked the entire Benin-Lagos Road for over two hours before armed soldiers and Policemen were deployed to disperse them.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces launch at least one airstrike against Boko Haram positions in or around Baga following attacks on the town. Casualties not known.
A man and his daughter are arrested by security forces attempting to smuggle an explosive into the Federal Government Girls College (FGGC), Jalingo.

Seven people sustained injuries while 23 houses were burnt during a clash between Dan Zara and Anguwan Rimi communities in Bogoro Local Government Area of the state. Property destroyed, no life lost. The reason for the clash was not articulated.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A sustained, several day-long attack (3-4 days) of residents by Boko Haram of the held town of Baga. Early estimates have 2,000 dead throughout the week, though this figure may be a total count in the entire area throughout the week. A witness claimed the majority of the dead were the old, women and children. The town was destroyed following the several attacks through out the week. 3,200 displaced. Conflicting report: Despite the high casualties government officials claim no more that 150 dead.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents launched attacks on residents in Katarko village of Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State killing over 25 people, abducted women, children and burnt several buildings.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Following the heavy assault and territorial gain of Baga on 03/01, Boko Haram attacks and destroys 16 villages throughout the LGA including, Doron Baga, Zundur, Kwatar Gumin Masara, Gadar Gajere, Tudun, Mile 4, Mile 3, Dunga, Kish Gam and Kukawa.. The source(s) did not include the entire list of villages. It is believed the attacks occurred on 07/01. Casualties not known, though many sources report the fatality number of 2,000 recorded in Baga on 07/01 may be a total count in the are throughout the week.
Unknown assailants kill a farmer in Akure North LGA. Motive of the attack not known; investigators discovered nothing stolen from the victim.
PDP youth protest in Abuja in what they described as injustice and lack of fairness in the party. The group represented Yobe State.
Ondo state students hold a protest in Akure over non-payment of their bursary.
Students of the University of Benin (UNIBEN) on Thursday continued their protest against the Edo State government over the demolition of the institutions staff quarters.
Students of the University of Benin (UNIBEN) on Friday continued their protest against the Edo State government over the demolition of the institutions staff quarters.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram gunmen fought running battles with Nigerian troops on the streets of the northeastern city of Damaturu on Friday, in an apparent reprisal attack after a recent raid on a militant stronghold. Causalities not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces launch an offensive on Boko Haram positions in Damaturu. A total of 14 soldiers were killed in action during the attack, while over 30 who were wounded are now receiving medical attention. The attack comes a day after several running battles in the city.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attempts to overrun Uba town, but are encountered with resistance from military forces and other local militia. The attack, which began during the early morning hours, lasted for several hours. Some witness reported seeing dead bodies and burnt cars, unknown number - "dozens" later reported.
A suicide-car bomber detonates at a police checkpoint in Potiskum. Two dead, plus bomber. Other causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Twenty have been killed and 18 others injured in a suicide bomb blast in Maiduguri, Borno State. The source indicated the bomber was a 10-year old girl under the direction of Boko Haram.
1000+ Fulani herdsmen attack and burn Miza location, outside Lokoja. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two female suicide bombers (suspected Boko Haram) detonated themselves up at a Yobe market (along Muhammed Idriss Way in Potiskum) after detonating bombs wired to their bodies, killing 39. The girls were said to be between 15 and 17-years-old.
An unknown group throws dynamite at the APC headquarters in Abam Ama during the overnight hours. Property damage reported, no injuries.

Members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) from Obio/Akpor Local government Area of Rivers State staged a peaceful protest at the state headquarters of Nigeria Police and the Department of State Security (DSS) in Port Harcourt over incessant attacks on members of the party. The group called on police for greater protection.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Security sources and youth vigilantes (unknown group) confirmed that "dozens" of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by Nigerian soldiers in Konduga town of Borno State in a fight that started Sunday night and lasted until dawn the following day. Security forces additionally confirmed losses, numbers unknown.

PDP members attack and severely beat (possibly to death) an APC supporter when they discover him removing their political posters from a public area. Soon after members of the APC launch a reprisal attack on the PDP, injuring five.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Askira, burn down a school and causes residents to flee. Witnesses report casualties, but do not provide numbers.

PDP members attack and severely beat (possibly to death) an APC supporter when they discover him removing their political posters from a public area. Soon after members of the APC launch a reprisal attack on the PDP, injuring five.

An attempt by unknown persons to bomb the All Progressives Congress (APC) office in Ohaukwu Local Government Area of Ebonyi State failed as the Improvised Explosive Device allegedly thrown into the premises failed to explode.
Members of the PDP protest at their party headquarters over perceived marginalization in a recent primary election.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Security sources and youth vigilantes (unknown group) confirmed that "dozens" of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by Nigerian soldiers in Konduga town of Borno State in a fight that started Sunday night and lasted until dawn the following day. Security forces additionally confirmed losses, numbers unknown.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: "Insurgents" attack several areas in Zurmi LGA, targeting pro-government militia groups. 100 reported deaths.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: "Insurgents" attack several areas in Zurmi LGA, targeting pro-government militia groups. 100 reported deaths.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: "Insurgents" attack several areas in Zurmi LGA, targeting pro-government militia groups. 100 reported deaths.

A female suicide bomber detonates in the Kasuwan Mata area of Gombe, killing three and injuring 21. The explosion may have targeted a military office in the area. The source makes no mention of possible perpetrator organizations.
Residents under the aegis IPC protest disillusionment toward their traditional ruler, who they accuse of complicity in murder, arson.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram launches an attack on Biu, but are repelled by military forces. 78 Boko Haram casualites reported, military casualties not known. Military forces reported the capture of two heavy guns and five perpetrators. Fifteen of the Boko Haram dead are believed to be Chadian.

APC lawyers march in Lagos in an effort to put Muhammadu Buhari and Prof. Yemi Osinbajo on the partys presidential ticket. Members of the Area Boys street gangs inturrupted the rally, stealing several personal items from the APC supporters.
No fewer than five persons were feared dead and several others injured in a renewed fight between unidentified political "thugs" in Ijora area of Lagos.
Police discover and dismantle a bomb targeting the Owerri Capital Development Authority (OCDA) office in Owerri.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NAPPS: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools
NOTES: Teachers and proprietors of private primary and secondary schools in Cross River State under the aegis of National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools (NAPPS) marched through Calabar to protest what they called the heavy tax imposed on them by the state government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CCESSA: Construction and Civil Engineering Senior Staff Association
NOTES: Construction workers under aegis of Construction and Civil Engineering Senior Staff Association (CCESSA) protest a merger of two construction companies.
PDP and APC members clash in Sokoto, police arrest nine. One reported death.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A month after being liberated by join Chadian and Nigerian forces, authorities discover 400 or more of bodies buried in mass graves, ostensibly at the hand of Boko Haram. Dates of the atrocities are not clear. Source dated 27/04.

Over 20 LP supporters had been injured by suspected PDP members in Ebonyi State over the course of "the last one month." The number is believed to include the attacks on 22/01 in Ohaozara and Abakaliki, though other locations and specific dates are not known.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a PDP campaign team in Abua, injuries not known. Policemen accompanying the team responded and chased away the gunmen.
A group of 227 soldiers protested "unlawful dismissal" after refusing to fight against Boko Haram.

A major communal clash over control of land erupted between the people of Ipetumodu and Asipa, two of the six principal towns in Ife North local government area of Osun State. No reported casualites, though several buildings were destroyed in Origbo. Police later made several arrests.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates at a evening market in Gombe, killing scores and injuring others.
A local party office of the APC is destroyed with dynamite during the early hours of the day. It is not believed that anyone was inside or harmed.
An angered group near Kano mosque attacked and lynched a person they suspected of being Boko Haram.
Striking Ogun teachers protest the government over a payment issue.

Gunmen have attacked a Military Check Point along Bauchi-Jos Federal highway at Takanda-Giwa killing a soldier and a civilian, leaving another civilian injured. Perpatrators remain unidentified. Exact location along the highway not known or reported.
A pregnant woman and two others were reportedly killed in the early hours of the day when unknown gunmen attacked Igoh village in Donga local government area of Taraba State.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect have overrun Dzagula village near Gombi. Aware of the imminent attack, villagers fled their homes causing no loss of life from the attackers.
A suicide bomber struck at a motor park in Potiskum, killing at least seven people and injured 45 others. Perpetrators were not speculated upon by the source.
An civilian anti-crime group attacks and kills two suspected robbers.
Youths severely beat a commercial motorcyclist (popularly called okada) in Gboko over suspected theft of a motorcycle.
Some retired workers of an defunct electricty company protested over non-payment of their entitlements and allowances.

Several APC groups protest against President Jonathan ahead of a visit. During the visit several protesters attacked the Presidents motorcade - the extent of the damage not known. Reports of PDP property destruction, including several of the Presidents political billboards. Police later reported 24 arrests.
JOHESU health workers at the Lagos University Teaching Hospital (LUTH), Idi-Araba, protested against delay in the implementation of their agreement with the Federal Government.

No fewer than three students of The Federal Polytechnic, Ado-Ekiti were arrested by the police and detained for participating in a protest staged against the dispute between the Rector and the trade unions.
Nine dead and eight missing following an attack on Kente village by suspected Fulani heardmen. The perpatrators also attacked nearby Sontyo.
Eleven people were killed as gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked Sontyo village in Wukari local government area of Taraba state. The attack occurred during the early hours of the day.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NAPPS: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools
NOTES: At least 3,000 teachers and proprietors of private primary and secondary schools in Cross River State under the aegis of National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools (NAPPS) marched in Calabar to protest the heavy taxations imposed on them by the state government.
Health workers protest in Ibadan over an apperent labour dispute.

Health workers at the Federal Medical Centre, FMC, in Bayelsa State, staged a peaceful protest over the alleged continued refusal of the Federal Government to discuss and approve the demands of their union.

Supporters of the PDP and APC clash in Kano after it was discovered PDP campaign posters were removed by APC supporters, causing retaliation. One death repored. Further, a car was set ablaze before security agents mobilised to halt further damage.
Two warring militia groups hold a peace meeting in Ife-North Local Government Area.
A group of contractors protest in Abuja over non-payment by of over N30 billion debt owed them by the government.
Health workers protest in Ibadan for a second consecutive day.
Former workers of the I-Cocoa Research Institute of Nigeria (CRIN), Idi-Ayunre, Ibadan hold a peaceful protest to mark a year they were relieved of their duties and to demand their reinstatement.

Forty arrested when police disperse a group of youths violently protesting against a planned Presidential visit. One police officer reported severe injuries. Meanwhile, elsewhere in the city, youths suspected to be supporters of the PDP have torched the campaign office of the All Progressives Congress (APC) gubernatorial candidate.

Following the killing a pharmacist over a suspected business deal gone bad, thousands of youths took to the streets in protest of the killing. As at the time policemen arrive the area, some angry youths were said to have molested the them and made attempt to set the police station ablaze.
Youths suspected to be supporters of the PDP have torched the campaign office of the All Progressives Congress (APC) gubernatorial candidate following the removal of several of their posters.

Suspected PDP members attacked several members of the Labour Party in Ikwo and Ohaozara LGAs (exacted locations not reported), including at least one candidate in Ohaozara West. One death reported between the two LGAs, as well as property destroyed.

Suspected PDP members attacked several members of the Labour Party in Ikwo and Ohaozara LGAs (exacted locations not reported), including at least one candidate in Ohaozara West. One death reported between the two LGAs, as well as property destroyed.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Days before a presidential visit, Boko Haram attacks Kambari village, near Maiduguri, killing 15. The attack occurred during the early morning hours.
Members of the Labour Party held a protest at the office of the State Security Service to demonstrate against the alleged kidnapping of a member of the party.
Employers of a paper mill protest over pay.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several locations in Michika LGA, killing people and abducting women and children. The villages included: Mbororo, Shahu, Liddle, Garta, Kamale and Ghumci. The victims were mainly Kilba-Higgi. Specific causality numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several locations in Michika LGA, killing people, and abducting women and children. The villages included: Mbororo, Shahu, Liddle, Garta, Kamale and Ghumci. The victims were mainly Kilba-Higgi. Specific causality numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several locations in Michika LGA, killing people, and abducting women and children. The villages included: Mbororo, Shahu, Liddle, Garta, Kamale and Ghumci. The victims were mainly Kilba-Higgi. Specific causality numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack several locations in Michika LGA, killing people, and abducting women and children. The villages included: Mbororo, Shahu, Liddle, Garta, Kamale and Ghumci. The victims were mainly Kilba-Higgi. Specific causality numbers not provided.

Unknown gunmen stormed and bombed the site of a planned opposition APC rally at Port Harcourt on 24/01. The attackers invaded the venue with an explosive device and drove away workers preparing for the event, although no lives were lost or injuries reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: An estimated 53 dead as military forces repelled a massive attack by Boko Haram over two days in an area outside of Maiduguri.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram continued their assault on Michika, engaging in battles with military forces. The military reports several dead, including Boko Haram - specific numbers not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Monguno, which houses a military barracks, is attacked and taken over by Boko Haram. Despite the gain in territory, Boko Haram reported 56 causalities. Military casualties not reported. The fighting lasted several hours. An estimated 5,000 displaced due to the attack.
Members of the PDP and APC clash in the Egba and Mushin areas of Lagos causing extensive property damage. 44 reported arrested. The reasons for the clash are not known.

A commissioner in the Imo State House of Assembly Commission, Mr. Tony Onyelere is shot dead by suspected assassins at Orji in Owerri North Local Government Area of the state. Motive unknown - nothing is believed to have been stolen from the victim.
Fulanis attack Aeuede village of Agatu LGA on 25/01, 17 deaths reported.
University students protest a fee increase, block a heavily used road with barricades.
The Nigeria Union of Pensioners, NUP, Nasarawa state chapter on 26/01 staged a peaceful demonstration over the non-payment of their 15-month entitlements.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: An estimated 53 dead as military forces repelled a massive attack my Boko Haram over two days outside of Maiduguri. By the end of the second day military forces reported they were in full control of Kondura.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram continued their assault on Michika for a third day, engaging in battles with military forces. The military reports several dead, including Boko Haram - specific numbers not known.

Fulanis attack six Agatu LGA villages on 26/01. [The Fulani] had attacked Abugbe village, where they killed eight persons; killed two in Okoklo; murdered four in Ogwule; one in Ocholoyan and two others in adjoining villages. Fulani herdsmen had attacked Aeuede village the previous day.

Fulanis attack six Agatu LGA villages on 26/01. [The Fulani] had attacked Abugbe village, where they killed eight persons; killed two in Okoklo; murdered four in Ogwule; one in Ocholoyan and two others in adjoining villages. Fulani herdsmen had attacked Aeuede village the previous day.

Fulanis attack six Agatu LGA villages on 26/01. [The Fulani] had attacked Abugbe village, where they killed eight persons; killed two in Okoklo; murdered four in Ogwule; one in Ocholoyan and two others in adjoining villages. Fulani herdsmen had attacked Aeuede village the previous day.
Ten Micheal Otedola College of Primary Education students are injured during a unruly protest against alleged school corruption.
Striking health workers under the Joint Health Sector Unions (JOHESU) staged a peaceful protest over neglect by the federal government.

An explosion on 27/01 night rocked the Akanu Ibiam Auditorium of Ohanaeze National Secretariat at Park Avenue G.R.A. Enugu . The blast ripped off the ceiling of the building. The motive for the arson is not known. No reported injuries.
A community leader is shot and beheaded over a land tussle in suburban Benin City. Perpetrators not known. Date of the attack is vague - source dated 27/01.
Fulani gunmen opened fire on a funeral crowd in Yangal, killing seven and injuring 14.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Nigerian and Chadian forces launch an aerial bombardment on the Boko Haram controlled Malam Fatori location. The raids began early on 28/01 and lasted several hours. There was no initial word on casualties or whether Boko Haram fighters had fled the area.
Unidentified armed men stormed the home of Cross River Assembly Speaker Larry Odey, battling his security aids, one of whom was shot. The extent of the security members injuries are not known.
A police orderly attached to an APC government official shoots and kills a woman for unknown reason.
Hoodlums suspected to be working for the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) set ablaze two cars belonging to the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Oron. No reported injuries.
Officials of an advertisement agency, and others, protested heavy use of outdoor political signs in Lagos. The protesters believed the overabundance of billboards was harming their industry.

Youths angry at the Nigerian governments failure to fight [Boko Haram] threw stones at President Goodluck Jonathans electioneering convoy in the eastern town of Jalingo, breaking windshields and windows on several vehicles. It is not clear if anyone was injured. Police used tear gas and whips to disperse the mob.
Fulani gunmen attack Nwonko village in Wukari LGA, killing 30.
Disabled APC supporters protested the removal APC billboards in Calabar ahead of a visit by President Jonathan (PDP).
Odumegwu-Ojukwu university students protest a tuition hike. The protesters blocked a highway and demanded to see the Governor. Date unknown, source dated 30/01.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces expel Boko Haram from Michika following several days of fighting and attacks on civilians. Boko Haram had controlled the town several months ago, and were attempting to retake the ground. Casualties not known.
Fulani herdsmen and Tiv militia clash in five towns of Logo a LGA, nine initial causalities. In the following days and weeks authorities would discover additional victims totalling 35 dead.
Fulani herdsmen and Tiv militia clash in five towns of Logo a LGA, nine initial causalities. In the following days and weeks authorities would discover additional victims totalling 35 dead.
Tiv and Fulani militias clash in several locations within Logo LGA, including Chembe, Tsemue, Ifer, Mgbakpa and Oragbai. Nine causalities reported.
Fulani herdsmen and Tiv militia clash in five towns of Logo a LGA, nine initial causalities. In the following days and weeks authorities would discover additional victims totalling 35 dead.
Fulani herdsmen and Tiv militia clash in five towns of Logo a LGA, nine initial causalities. In the following days and weeks authorities would discover additional victims totalling 35 dead.
Tiv and Fulani militias clash in several locations within Logo LGA, including Chembe, Tsemue, Ifer, Mgbakpa and Oragbai. Nine causalities reported.
Fulani herdsmen and Tiv militia clash in five towns of Logo a LGA, nine initial causalities. In the following days and weeks authorities would discover additional victims totalling 35 dead.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attack Kambari during the evening hours, killing 30 and destroying the town.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Chadian aircraft bombed the Nigerian town of Gamboru in a raid targeting Boko Haram. Details on damage or casualties were not immediately clear.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Molai village during a large coordinated attack on Maiduguri. Military forces responded with gunfire. "Most" of the [attackers] were killed, others injured. Civilians reported injured or killed. Numbers not known. Molai is a suburb, 10km south of the city situated along the Damboa road.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks the Mafa-Ngom area as part of their coordinated attack on Maiduguri. There were two separate attacks in a short amount of time - 30 insurgents were killed by military and Civilian JTF forces in the first attack, an air force bomber was involved in the second.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram, as well as a Chadian mercenary group, attempts to over take Maiduguri in a early morning four front attack. Despite the enormity of the attack, military forces and the Civilian JTF were able to repel the attackers. At least 500 dead, - most were Boko Haram, plus civilians. Many of the dead were the result of air strikes near Giwa barracks and Zannari. Injuries not known. A large cache of weaponry was recovered by military forces following the attack.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram captures the village of Tasha Mbaga, 20km from Maiduguri, after military forces flee. No violence reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Chadian aircraft bombed the Nigerian town of Gamboru for a second day in a raid targeting Boko Haram. Details on damage or casualties were not immediately clear.

Nine houses belonging to All Progressives Congress (APC) members and a campaign vehicle belonging to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) was burnt down at Giwa (Giya) village in Birnin-Kudu local government area of Jigawa State when PDP youth on the campaign train of Ali Tukur Gantsa and APC youth clashed in the village. Police later ended the clash. Injuries not known.
Six killed, others injured when rival political protests become violent. Actors not identified.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram lays siege to Dalwa as part of a larger attack on Maiduguri. Unknown military response. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram kills a man and his granddaughter in the Maiduguri suburb of Abujantalakawa, along the Damboa road. The killing comes during a large, coordinated assault on Maiduguri.
A suicide bomber of unknown origin attacked the home of a PDP legislator in Potiskum killing 10 persons. It is not clear if the legislator is among the dead.

At least two dead the 18 injured after a pair suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a PDP campaign rally shortly following the exit of President Jonathan. The source notes both bombers were female.

In what appeared to be a synchronised attack, the High Courts in Port Harcourt, Isiokpo and Degema, were bombed with explosives suspected to be dynamite in the early hours of 02/02. It is not believed any of the buildings were populated. There was also an unconfirmed report that perpetrators also broke into Omoku High Court. Perpetrators unknown described only as "unpatriotic hoodlums."

In what appeared to be a synchronised attack, the High Courts in Port Harcourt, Isiokpo and Degema, were bombed with explosives suspected to be dynamite in the early hours of 02/02. It is not believed any of the buildings were populated. There was also an unconfirmed report that perpetrators also broke into Omoku High Court. Perpetrators unknown described only as "unpatriotic hoodlums."

APC members attack PDP supporters travelling in a campaign vehicle. [The source] gathered that following the encounter, PDP youths retreated to their ward (Angwuan Jibawa, same LGA) and also attacked a campaign vehicle belonging to the APC, though it is not clear if the car had any passengers.

Chanting APC members throw stones at the convoy of Governor Mukhtar Yero as it travelled through Birnin-Gwari and Udawa for campaign events. No reported injuries. Upon the governors return to Kaduna City a group of APC supporters protested his arrival.

APC members attack PDP supporters travelling in a campaign vehicle. [The source] gathered that following the encounter, PDP youths retreated to their ward (Angwuan Jibawa, same LGA) and also attacked a campaign vehicle belonging to the APC, though it is not clear if the car had any passengers.

Chanting APC members throw stones at the convoy of Governor Mukhtar Yero as it travelled through Birnin-Gwari and Udawa for campaign events. No reported injuries. Upon the governors return to Kaduna City a group of APC supporters protested his arrival.
A group of youths protest at the headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission for a postponement of an upcoming election on the basis of a lack of election materials.
Lawyers employed by the Federal Ministry of Justice on shut down the ministry to press home their demands for improved welfare.
Hundreds of NUP pensioners marched to the Government House, Port Harcourt, Rivers State to register their grievance over non-payment of monthly allowance.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces re-capture several towns and villages in Adamawa State, including: Hong, Mubi North, Mubi South, Michika, Shuwa, Wuro Gyambi, Gombi, Vimtim (near Bazza), Uba and Bazza. Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces re-capture two towns, Gujba and Gulani, both of Yobe State. Date(s) and casualties unknown. Military forces announced the recapture the town on 02/02.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces re-capture two towns, Gujba and Gulani, both of Yobe State. Date(s) and casualties unknown. Military forces announced the recapture the town on 02/02.

Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces re-capture several towns and villages in Adamawa State, including: Hong, Mubi North, Mubi South, Michika, Shuwa, Wuro Gyambi, Gombi, Vimtim (near Bazza), Uba and Bazza. Date(s) unknown - military sources made the announcement regarding all locations on 02/02. Causalities not reported.
A police van is attacked by suspected "militants" - no specific identification - during the early evening hours. Three dead: One officer, two attackers.

APC members protest the arrival of Governor Mukhtar Yero in Kaduna around the Panteka and Bakin Ruwa areas of the city following a series of campaign stops throughout the state. In Bakin Ruwa, PDP supporters witnessed the protest and reacted by attacking the APC members, destroying their vehicles and posters. The melee caused eight deaths and several injuries.

In what appeared to be a synchronised attack, the High Courts in Port Harcourt, Isiokpo and Degema, were bombed with explosives suspected to be dynamite in the early hours of 02/02. It is not believed any of the buildings were populated. There was also an unconfirmed report that perpetrators also broke into Omoku High Court. Perpetrators unknown described only as "unpatriotic hoodlums."

Over 500 youths blocked the Enugu-Onitsha Expressway in Awka, protesting the multiple candidates of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), believing the practice would lead to fraud. The protest caused a gridlock. Motorists and passengers were stranded for hours. No reported police involvement.
Delta Women Empowerment Initiative (DWEI) protested on major streets of Asaba, Delta State capital, over alleged inadequate representation in government and campaign organisations.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
NOTES: The convoy of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) governorship candidate in Nasarawa state, Labaran Maku was attacked by suspected APC supporters who barricaded a major road through Kwandere, an outskirt of Lafia, to stop the campaign train. Six people were injured in the attack, although the candidate was unharmed.

Demonstrators gather at the headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to demand a shift in the dates of the polls by two months due to a lack of voter materials. Elsewhere in Abuja residents protest against an alleged plan by the government to postpone an upcoming election

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces believe they have killed Boko Haram commander Muhammed Yusuf, among others, in an air strike in the north east. Specific location, date and causality number not known.

Some aggrieved workers, who subscribed to a mass housing project by the Nigerian Labour Congress (NLC) disrupted a political debate session of the congress. The protesters alleged that they had been defrauded by the NLC and its ally, adding that they can only be placated if they got full refund of the monies they subscribed with.
Members of several academic unions protest unapproved deductions from their salaries.
Hundreds of youths of the All Progressives Congress (APC) staged a protest in Maiduguri, Borno State, calling on the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) not to shift upcoming elections.

Suburban Abuja residents protest against alleged plans by the Nigerian government to postpone upcoming elections. Some southern-based groups have recently been pushing for a new date because of a lack of voter materials. The protesters were blocked by police. A similar protest took place in Abuja proper.
Gunmen shoot and kill a Bauchi state lawmaker during the early morning hours. The perpetrators may have been kidnappers.
A prominent cleric is shot and killed by unidentified assailants as he exited his automobile on the morning of 05/02.

Two persons were reportedly shot dead and scores wounded when unidentified gunmen fired at a youth gathering in Onne. The source revealed that the attack was linked to a proposed youth leadership election in the area. At least one of the victims was an APC member.

Three persons were reportedly shot when hoodlums attacked the campaign trail of the Social Democratic Party (SDP) gubernatorial candidate in Taraba state, at Donga Local Government Area (LGA). There were not believed to be any fatalities.
Coalition of Concerned Nigerians, a social-human rights group based in Jos staged protest at INEC headquarters Abuja demanding that the elections be held as scheduled.

At least 10 persons were seriously injured and properties worth millions of naira were destroyed when soldiers from Orerokpe Community in Okpe Local Government Area, Delta State invaded neighbouring Omoise-Ovu Community in Ethiope East Local Government Area of Delta State on 07/02. Several injuries reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
NOTES: Suspected PDP youth attack APGA supporters at a rally in Agulu. At least one APGA supporter was seriously injured.
Suspected Fulanis attack, raped and killed a woman on her farm in Asa.
Fulani gunmen abduct the father of the former governor in Bokkos LGA. He was later rescued.

Pensioners in Abia State protested non-payment of arrears of their pensions and gratuities The protesters, who marched peacefully from the Sub-Treasury Office on School Road through Bende Road and Aba Road, took their protest to Government House, Umuahia.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: 82 Boko Haram insurgents were reportedly killed by troops of the Nigerian Army and Civilian JTF (BVYG) in an attempt to attack Damboa town, the headquarters of Damaboa Local Government of Borno State. Boko Haram attacked the city from Kalla village at noon.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a military barracks in Geidam (Gaida) on 08/02. Heavy fighting reported. Casualties not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram stops a bus near Akada-Banga village of Bama district and abducted about 20 people, including women and children.
Pro-Jonathan protesters gather at the office at the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to protest for greater distribution of voter cards.
Pensioners protest over non-payment of pension and gratuity near the state secretariat. The demonstration was peaceful.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram attacked a police station in Kanamma, overran the station, abducted and killed a district officer. The station was bombed and destroyed in the attack.
Placard carrying secondary school teachers stormed Government House, Bauchi State to protest unpaid salaries.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces discover and demobilize 147 Boko Haram bombs in Auno, on the outskirts of Maiduguri.
Members of the BVYG, or civilian JTF, clash with police in Maiduguri over payment for hired protection of a political group. Injuries not known.

Christian and Muslims clash in Babale, Jos North after a Muslim group attempted to fill in a large automobile accident causing ditch in a road - deeper reasons not known. Four killed, property destroyed.

A group of militants attacked a group of protesting widows, seriously injuring five. The group was protesting Minister of State for Education who they believe was instrumental to the death of her husband.
Fulani attackers lay siege to two Benue State locations, killing five in each location and destroying property.
Fulani attackers lay siege to two Benue State locations, killing five in each location and destroying property.
A group of seven suspected murderers are captured and burned alive by a vigilante group in Naka.

About 500 supporters of All Progressives Congress, APC, in Idemili North and South federal constituency of Anambra State besieged the Federal High Court in Awka to protest alleged manipulation of the ticket for the constituency by the leadership of the party.
Industrialists in Onitsha took to the streets to protest an increase in electricity charges.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacked Chadian Army positions in Gamburu on 11/02. Boko Haram fled soon after the initial attack. The source reported eight Chadian soldiers were wounded, three out of 14 Boko Haram vehicles were destroyed, and one was seized. There was no word on whether any Boko Haram fighters had been killed or wounded.

One person was feared dead while two were abducted in a clash between Ijaw community of Ezebiri and their Urhobo counterpart at Furukama in Bomadi and Ughelli South Local Government Areas of Delta State.
One person died while two were abducted in a clash between Ijaw community of Ezebiri and their Urhobo counterpart at Furukama in Bomadi and Ughelli South Local Government Areas of Delta State.

ACTOR1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: A group suspected to be members of the Movement for the Actualization of Sovereign State of Biafra, MASSOB, invaded Onitsha main market, beating up traders who were protesting against a market levy.
A police officer shot and killed a 10-year old girl and injured a woman at Kwani Mani police checkpoint in Bichi LGA for unknown reason. Date not known. Source dated 11/02.
A church pastor is found decapitated in Mkpani area of Yakurr LGA. Perpetrators not known.
Members of the Agatu community attack a group of Fulanis in Odagbo. No reported causalities.

Ijaw youths attack a Udo palm oil plantation, killed seven workers and injured five others. Additionally, much of the plantation was burned during the attack. The attack was suspected to have been spurred over land rights.
Students of a technical college protest, destroy property. The reason for the protest was not reported. Following the disturbances the school was closed indefinitely.
Members of the Ekrokpe community peacefully protest PDP-government neglect of bad roads. Exact date unknown - source dated 12/02.
A group of five unidentified gunmen attack a police station, killing two officers.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: At least five people were killed and 20 injured when a female suicide bomber attacked a market in Biu. The affiliation of the bomber was not known, though suspected to Boko Haram.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram group have reportedly killed seven people after invading Gajiganna market in Magumeri local government area of Borno State.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attack and kill 12 people in Akida village and nine others in Mbuta, both of Mafa LGA. The attack occurred shortly before the attack on Biu.

Hundreds of protesters in Abuja demonstrated against the planned removal of the Chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) Prof. Attahiru Jega and further shift in new dates of the 2015 elections.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Gombe, clash with military forces stationed in the city. The fiercest fighting was about three kilometres (two miles) outside the town. Military forces eventually expelled the attackers from the city. At least 50 causalities reported. Following the attack the Gombe state government imposed a curfew on the city.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a police station in Kibiya, two dead. A similar attack occurred in nearby Sumaila earlier in the day.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack a police station in Kibiya, one attacker killed during a gun duel. Following the attack a group of armed villagers attacked the fleeing suspects, killing one.

APC supporters block a road during the early hours of the day in protest of a theft at a leaders office, accusing the PDP of the crime. In reaction, PDP supporters mobilise a counter protest. Violence is narrowly avoided, police separated the two groups.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram burns Dakin Kowa. No causalities or injuries reported - the residents had fled the scene when they saw the attackers coming from a distance.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram insurgents on the morning of 14/02 attacked Dadin Kowa and Hinna towns of Yamaltu/Deba Local Government Area of Gombe State. The attacks began at 6am. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram insurgents on the morning of 14/02 attacked Dadin Kowa and Hinna towns of Yamaltu/Deba Local Government Area of Gombe State. The attacks began at 6am. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a Ogoni student unionist in Bori. Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People (MOSOP) condemned the attack.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces report killing 300 members of Boko Haram over two days of fighting in several Borno locations, including: Monguno, Gabchari, Abba Jabari, Zuntur, Gajigana, Gajiram, Damakar, Kumaliwa, Bosso Wanti, Jeram and Kabrisungul. Additionally, the military reports two soldier deaths, plus ten wounded. Later reported indicate that military forces regained control of the effected areas. Dates vary from report to report; battles are believed to have occurred 15/02-16/02.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces report killing 300 members of Boko Haram over two days of fighting in several Borno locations, including: Monguno, Gabchari, Abba Jabari, Zuntur, Gajigana, Gajiram, Damakar, Kumaliwa, Bosso Wanti, Jeram and Kabrisungul. Additionally, the military reports two soldier deaths, plus ten wounded. Later reported indicate that military forces regained control of the effected areas. Dates vary from report to report; battles are believed to have occurred 15/02-16/02.
