NOTES: Security forces kill "dozens" of Boko Haram in Alagarno, while routing them from several villages (Yajiwa, Afa, Kafa and Maudori) in Damboa LGA. The numbers of wounded and dead from the smaller, surrounding villages are not known. Included in the operation were aircraft strikes and heavy artillery.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four fishermen are beheaded and dumped inside the river Alau (in Konduga) by suspected Boko Haram on 03/03. A group of Civilian JTF chased the attackers to a nearby Balle village (not named), where they killed at least one perpetrator.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four fishermen were beheaded and dumped inside the river Alau by suspected Boko Haram on 03/03. After - and separate even- a group of Civilian JTF chased the attackers to a nearby Balle village (not named), where they killed at least one perpetrator.

Unidentified gunmen attack supporters of APC, including the home of a candidate for the local government area in Obrikom and Obior, killing six (one source counts seven). The politicians home was believe to be Obrikom.
Unidentified gunmen stormed two communities of Rivers State, Obrikom and Obor, killing at least nine people and injuring two others.

Unidentified gunmen attack supporters of APC, including the home of a candidate for the local government area in Obrikom and Obior, killing six (one source counts seven, though police later confirm nine). The politicians home was believe to be Obrikom.
Unidentified gunmen stormed two communities of Rivers State, Obrikom and Obor, killing at least nine people and injuring two others.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Four traders are dead when "scores" of Boko Haram attacked a market in Kayamla village (near Konduga) during the mid-afternoon. Following the attack a group of vigilantes from Konduga mobilised, but the attackers had fled before they had arrived. A similar attack occurred the previous day in nearby Alau.
Unknown gunmen on the night of 04/04 reportedly assassinated a prominent chief in Egbada in Ogba Egbema Ndoni local government area of Rivers State.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Residents intercept and stop a suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber attempting to enter a mosque, killing him. Elsewhere in the city a second group assaulted another suspected bomber.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Numbering 20, Boko Haram, disguised as preachers, attack and killed 24 who were observing sunset prayers in Kwajaffa Babur.

A mob attacked the residence of Katsina State Governorship candidate of All Progressive Congress (APC) and vandalised parts of the buildings and five vehicles parked at the premises. An eyewitness told our reporter that the mob stormed the area with sticks and cutlasses which they used in the act. The exact location of the attack is not known, though the politician represents Malumfashi. No reported injuries.
Ten believed killed in a clash between groups of hunters and cattle rustlers (both unidentified) over a land issue in Shimfida. Date not known - source dated 06/04.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of traders in Sabon Birnin during the afternoon hours, killing 14 and injuring several others.
Protesters from Rivers State have demonstrators at the INEC headquarters in Abuja, demanding the removal of the states Resident Electoral Commissioner, alleging vote rigging and fraud.

Igbo youth groups demonstrated in "Anambra State" (location not reported) to protest the alleged rigging of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in collaboration with the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), during the presidential and national assembly elections in the state.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
NOTES: Women of the All Progressives Grand Alliance, APGA staged a peaceful protest against alleged voter fraud by the PDP.

A middle-aged man was killed in Efon Alaaye Ekiti, headquarters as members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) staged violent protests against the plot by 19 All Progressives Congress (APC) lawmakers to impeach Governor Ayodele Fayose. Police fire live ammo to disperse the rioters. It is not clear if the victim was a target, or overcome by the melee. The protest became violent when a convoy of APC lawmakers rammed a barricade mounted by PDP protesters at Ita Ore, a border town between Ekiti and Osun states.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces recapture Boko Haram camps in Alagarno following a raid. Military forces report "huge" Boko Haram losses - no numbers provided.

A group of APC lawmakers and supporters ram a barricade erected by the PDP at Ita Ore in protest of a move to impeach the governor. The riot caused one death in nearby Efon-Alaiye. The lawmakers were on their way to Ado-Ekiti to vote on the measure, but were eventually stopped by soldiers.
A group of Igbo youths protest the outcome of the 28/03 election in Awka, Onitsha, Ekwolobia, Agulu and Nnewi. The protesters blamed the PDP for vote-rigging.
A group of Igbo youths protest the outcome of the 28/03 election in Awka, Onitsha, Ekwolobia, Agulu and Nnewi. The protesters blamed the PDP for vote-rigging.
A group of Igbo youths protest the outcome of the 28/03 election in Awka, Onitsha, Ekwolobia, Agulu and Nnewi. The protesters blamed the PDP for vote-rigging.
A group of Igbo youths protest the outcome of the 28/03 election in Awka, Onitsha, Ekwolobia, Agulu and Nnewi. The protesters blamed the PDP for vote-rigging.
A group of Igbo youths protest the outcome of the 28/03 election in Awka, Onitsha, Ekwolobia, Agulu and Nnewi. The protesters blamed the PDP for vote-rigging.

PDP supporters protest alleged plots by the All Progressives Congress, APC, to use the Independent National Electoral Commission, INEC, to manipulate the forthcoming governorship and state House of Assembly elections in the state.
Traders protest a shop-sharing proposal at the Sapele Local Government Council and Sapele Police Station.
Two are killed when a group of 20 unidentified gunmen attacked Eku village, Ethiope East. Additionally, a unnumbered group of NYSC were abducted by the gunmen. Perpetrators not known.
Unidentified, mask-wearing gunmen attack and kill 9 Fulani men Rigacikun. The attack occurred "last week."
Unidentified gunmen abduct 30 Fulani men at a market in Sabon Birni. The kidnapping occurred "last week."
Importers protest at a Apapa headquarters of a shipping company over their refusal to grant the proper bureaucratic materials that would allow their shipments. The protesters numbered 1,000.
Academic staff of the University of Calabar protest non-payment at the office of the Independent National Electoral Commission.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces begin an operation to rid Boko Haram from several location in the Sambisa forest region on 09/04, locations not provided. Military forces captured four locations on 10/04. "Scores" of Boko Haram killed, with at least one soldier KIA.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked Buratai village in Biu local government area of Borno State where they killed two people and injured three others.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks Dille village at 2am, killing 20 residents and burning houses.
Unidentified gunmen attack Fulanis, killing two and injuring one in Buruku.

Some serving members of the National Youth Corp Service (NYSC) stage a peaceful protest to demand of their allowances for the functions they carried out during the March 28th Presidential and National Assembly elections in Cross River State.
Youths protest the non-availability of election materials or results in Oko Ita.
Commercial tricycle, Keke NAPEP, operators protest the killing of one their colleagues, who have disappeared earlier in the week.
The River State governor is nearly attacked by "irate youths" when he stopped over at Omagwu, reason unknown. The governor was barricaded by his security personnel shortly afterward.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces have recaptured Bita, Izge Yamteke and Uba towns in Askira Uba and Damboa local council areas of Borno State following a battle that included the aid of air forces. An array of weapons were recovered from fleeing Boko Haram. Complete causality, fatality list not provided - at least one soldier dead, ten others injured.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces have recaptured Bita, Izge Yamteke and Uba towns in Askira Uba and Damboa local council areas of Borno State following a battle that included the aid of air forces. An array of weapons were recovered from fleeing Boko Haram. Casualties, fatalities not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces recapture four towns (not named) from Boko Haram in the Sambisa forest region. Two are killed when a group of 20 unidentified gunmen attacked Eku village, Ethiope East. Additionally, a unnumbered group of NYSC were abducted by the gunmen. Perpetrators not known. "Scores" of Boko Haram reportedly killed, and at least one soldier. The operation is believed to have begun on 09/04, possibly before.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces have recaptured Bita, Izge Yamteke and Uba towns in Askira Uba and Damboa local council areas of Borno State following a battle that included the aid of air forces. An array of weapons were recovered from fleeing Boko Haram. Casualties, fatalities not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces have recaptured Bita, Izge Yamteke and Uba towns in Askira Uba and Damboa local council areas of Borno State following a battle that included the aid of air forces. An array of weapons were recovered from fleeing Boko Haram. Casualties, fatalities not known.
A group of heavily armed men attack Ilase (Ilashe) the morning of 10/04, but were repelled by police forces. One civilian is believed to have been shot, fate unknown.
A close ally of the PDP deputy governorship candidate was shot dead in his in Ikwo local council area by suspected Labour Party gunmen on 10/04.

An APC supporter is killed in Garki, Jigawa state allegedly by supporters of the People Democratic Party (PDP). The police spokesperson in the state DSP Abdul Jinjiri Confirmed the incident to news men adding that three people were arrested in connection. The attack occurred on the "eve of [the states] gubernatorial election," or 10/04.

Five members of the PDP were abducted by suspected pirates along the Brass waterway in Brass, Brass LGA. The PDP members were travelling to Twon-Brass to participate in the election the following day.

Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two Lokoja-based missionaries at Emiguni emidojo village in Bassa Local Government Areas. The reason for the attack is not known. Date not known - source dated 10/04.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill five persons, steal election material in Buguma. A government officials home was also torched.

"Political thugs" hijacked ballot boxes, ballot papers and other sensitive materials in Ago-Ilaje meant for three units in Ilaje. The theft occurred during the day of a local election. The political attitudes of the attackers are not known.

"Political thugs" forcefully take over polling booths in Ondo South and Central Senatorial districts (exact locations not known), forcing voters to vote for the perpetrators candidate of choice. The political affiliations of the attackers are not known.
"Political thugs" open fire, shooting sporadically before stealing ballot boxes in Akure.
Unidentified youths hijack ballot boxes and other election material in Alese.
In Emohua it was alleged election materials were stolen. No violence reported.
"Political thugs" forcefully take over polling booths in Idanre.
"Political thugs" open fire, shooting sporadically before stealing ballot boxes in Igbara-Oke.
"Political thugs" open fire, shooting sporadically before stealing ballot boxes in Ilara.
"Political thugs" steal election materials in Osisioma, Abia State.
"Political thugs" steal election materials in Umu Akpara, Abia State.
Witnesses reported "heavy shootings" in Buguma, preceding the election. The violence spilled over into the following day with supporters of several parties blocking roads with burning tyres.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.
Voters in Garaku protest the late arrival of election materials to their area.
A crowd of some 2,000 protesters delayed distribution of materials in the state capital Port Harcourt, causing the ballots to open hours later than planned. The cause of the protest is not known.
Youths protest a faulty voter card reader in Somolu.
A group of voters attacked soldiers at a polling area in Tukurwa with stones. The soldiers responded in kind. Several reported arrests.

The Directorate of State Security operatives and police personnel have clashed at the Independent National Electoral Commissions headquarters in Owerri, Imo State. The reason for the clash was not reported by the source. Unknown injuries, fatalities.

Fracas broke out at State Primary School, Olanada Rumuola, where some persons had attempted to snatch sensitive electoral materials. This was followed by a prolonged altercation which resulted in the destruction of electoral materials and manhandling of a police officer.
Soldiers allegedly shot dead three people in Suru local government of Kebbi State (exact location not know) after pandemonium broke out during the polls.
APC and PDP members clash during state elections. Several machete cuts reported.
PDP and APC clash with weapons in election day related violence. Sporadic violence resurfaced the following day in several areas around the city. Three reported dead over the two days.
At least two youths dead and many others severely injured in Warri during the governorship and House of Assembly polls as PDP factions clashed with the opposition All Progressives Congress, APC.
Police shoot and kill a man wielding a knife in an effort to break up a election-related scuffle in Jos North.
A police officer is "hacked to death" in the Borokiri area of Port Harcourt, reasons unknown.
Two youths area shot and killed as they engaged "thugs" who had invaded their polling units on Ikot Ekpene road.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.
An attempt to snatch election materials in Rumu-Osi (Rumuomasi) resulted in a clash between party agents (not identified).
Military forces kill four voters (likely APC) in Bayan Dutse. Witness claim: "The soldiers opened fire on the voters who challenged them from arresting the elders."
PDP "thugs" attack election officials and steal election materials in Dan Musa. Two reportedly shot - fatalities, injuries not known.

"Thugs", suspected to be sympathetic to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in the early hours of 11/04 attacked some supporters of the All Progressive Congress(APC) at Itchi polling unit in Igbo Eze South Local Government Area. The attackers may have been "supervised" by police.
Election related violence from a PDP supporter leaves a Psychology student dead in Makurdi.
A PDP councillor on election duty is beaten to death in Bogoro. Perpetrators not identified.
A PDP chairman is assassinated by unknown gunmen in Ezza-Agu.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an APC youth leader in Idu community.

Five are reportedly killed in election violence in several Akwa Ibom locations, including Mbiabong Etoi, Shelter Afrique in Uyo; Ndiya in Nsit Ubium; Etim Ekpo, and Ini Local Government Areas of the state. The number and location of each death is not known, with the exception of Uyo, where two are dead following a clash. It is not clear if the nature of the violence in the remaining areas were a clash or VOC - details limited.

Five are reportedly killed in election violence in several Akwa Ibom locations, including Mbiabong Etoi, Shelter Afrique in Uyo; Ndiya in Nsit Ubium; Etim Ekpo, and Ini Local Government Areas of the state. The number and location of each death is not known, with the exception of Uyo, where two are dead following a clash. It is not clear if the nature of the violence in the remaining areas were a clash or VOC - details limited.
Political violence reported in Ode-Aye. Details scarce: Reported - "political thugs" had a "free day."

Five are reportedly killed in election violence in several Akwa Ibom locations (coded in other events), including Mbiabong Etoi, Shelter Afrique in Uyo; Ndiya in Nsit Ubium; Etim Ekpo, and Ini Local Government Areas of the state. The number and location of each death is not known, with the exception of Uyo, where two are dead following a clash. It is not clear if the nature of the violence in the remaining areas were a clash or VOC - details limited.
Political violence reported in Okitipupa. Details scarce: Reported - "political thugs" had a "free day."

In Ore, Odigbo local government area, "hoodlums" took over the major streets, shooting harassing and intimidating voters and INEC staff. The thugs stormed the house of a prominent politician in the town, manhandled him and set ablaze his car, while his family members fled.
"Political thugs" fired sporadically, ambushing INEC staff in Ugbo on the day of a state election.

Five are reportedly killed in election violence in several Akwa Ibom locations, including Mbiabong Etoi, Shelter Afrique in Uyo; Ndiya in Nsit Ubium; Etim Ekpo, and Ini Local Government Areas of the state. The number and location of each death is not known, with the exception of Uyo, where two are dead following a clash. It is not clear if the nature of the violence in the remaining areas were a clash or VOC - details limited.
A reporter and his photographer were attacked and beaten by angry youths in Rumu-Osi. The details of the attack were not clear.
Armed PDP supporters intimidated residents in Ilorin over election results. No reported violence. Eight of the group was later arrested.

Suspected Ombatse militia (Eggon group) attack the Nasarawa State presidential lodge, shooting sporadically. Although the mission of the suspected gunmen is unknown, it is believed that the target may be the state governor, Tanko Al-Makura, who usually held unofficial engagements at the lodge, especially during the electioneering period - though it is not clear if he, or anyone else was present at the time of the attack. One of the suspects was beaten by youth after he was caught by security operatives who arrived the scene of the incident.
Election related violence reported in several Rivers State areas, including Gokana, Kana, Asari Toru, Ikwere, Obio Akpor, Ozuoba, Bomu, Norwa, among others (not listed). Details of events not known.

Over 200 supporters of Labour Party, 12/04 protested around the office of the Independent National Electoral Commission, INEC, in Asaba over what they described as the malpractices that trailed the result of last Saturday gubernatorial and House of Assembly elections.
PDP and APC clash with weapons in election day related violence. Sporadic violence resurfaced the following day in several areas around the city. Three reported dead over the two days.
Supporters of the PDP protest alleged voting irregularities from Saturdays election. The protesters reportedly blocked roads in the capital city.

Ijaw and Itsekiri militia clash late 13/04 and early 14/03 in Ugborodo. What sparked off the fighting was not immediately clear, but it was learnt that armed Ijaw youths burnt no fewer than three houses in the Madangho area. Several injuries reported, including machete cuts.

No fewer than two persons have been reportedly killed and property destroyed following a communal clash between Bororo-Fulani traders and Yoruba ethnic group in Aro-Ago town in Kwara state. The clash is likely related to land use.

Ondo State Government House, Alagbaka, Akure turned to a battle field as supporters of the state Governor, and his deputy, engaged themselves in free for all over a contested defection to the All Progressives Congress (APC). Police dispersed the rioters. The clash began as a protest. Injuries not known.

A group of armed youths allegedly attacked the Returning Officer for Sadauna Local Government area of Taraba and the Electoral Officer of the area, on their way from Gyembu the headquarters of the local government area to Jalingo the Taraba state capital to submit the local government results. The E O and the Returning Officer were reported to have been abducted by the youths on their way to Jalingo.
APC supporters blocked roads in Owerri in protest of delayed election results. The group called on the APC gubernatorial candidate as winner.
Protesters mark the first anniversary of the Chibok abduction in Abuja.

Ijaw and Itsekiri militia clash late 13/04 and early 14/03 in Ugborodo. What sparked off the fighting was not immediately clear, but it was learnt that armed Ijaw youths burnt no fewer than three houses in the Madangho area. Several injuries reported, including machete cuts.
A group of students protest in Akure, call for the impeachment of the state Deputy Governor, who had recently switched political parties to the APC.
Imo State lawmakers protest non-payment of salaries at the officer of the Accountant General.
Students of Rivers College of Health and Science hold a protest to demand cleaner drinking water.
Youth protest against a series of attacks against attacks against Nigerian and other foreigners in South Africa. The protest took place at the South African embassy in Lagos.

There was a bloody clash between Igbo traders and cemetery workers on 16/04 and early 17/04 at Ladipo Market in Mushin, Lagos after the cemetery attendants formed a parallel executive and took over the leadership of the market. Machetes and other knives were used. Police arrived and restored peace. Injuries, causalities not known.
Armed assassins shoot and kill the Ughelli branch chairman of the Nigeria Bar Association at his home.
NLC labour leaders staged a protest against an alleged plot by 19 All Progressive Congress (APC) lawmakers to impeach Governor Ayodele Fayose.

There was a bloody clash between Igbo traders and cemetery workers on 16/04 and early 17/04 at Ladipo Market in Mushin, Lagos after the cemetery attendants formed a parallel executive and took over the leadership of the market. Machetes and other knives were used. Police arrived and restored peace. Injuries, causalities not known.

Clash between Egba clan (Yoruba) and those of Ologba community over clan revenge as well as fishing rights to a pond. Egbas had accused the people of Ologba of orchestrating a Fulani led attack against them at an earlier date. The clash took place in an unnamed location in Agatu LGA. 45 dead.
Air travellers protest prolonged delays at Lagos airport.

Gunmen abduct the chairman of Ahoada East local government area in Yiboko area. The chairmans party, the All Progressives Congress, boycotted the polls, which took place in six constituencies of the state.
Unidentified gunmen allegedly target APC members "at the weekend," killing two in Eleme and two in Okrika.
Unidentified gunmen allegedly target APC members "at the weekend," killing two in Eleme and two in Okrika.
Students of the University of Lagos (UNILAG) take to the streets to express dissatisfaction over the current epileptic power supply on Campus.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Six soldiers and a civilian vigilante were injured when their vehicle hit a mine planted by Boko Haram just outside the town of Baga.
An explosive detonates at a police station in the Dogo Tebo area of Potiskum, killing two. Boko Haram suspected. It is believed the bomber may have been targeting a Shiite Mosque.
A group of housing contractors block the gate of the Federal Ministry of Lands, Housing and Urban Development to demand unpaid allowances.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students; NYCN: National Youth Council of Nigeria
NOTES: Protesters demonstrate against South African xenophobic attacks in Abujas SA embassy. Groups included were the National Youth Council of Nigeria (NYCN) and the National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS). The protest forced a closure of the consulate.

Human rights activists in Benin City on 20/04 protested at the offices of telecommunications providers, protesting the xenophobic attacks in South Africa. The activists appealed to the Federal Government to commence evacuation of Nigerians living in South Africa without further delay.

ACTOR1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Several people are feared (numbers not known) killed as twin suicide blasts from suspected Boko Haram hit the Global System Communication (GSM) market in Potiskum. Another unsuccessful blast occurred in the Dogo Tebo, which killed only the bomber.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen early in the day attacked some villages in Donga LGA of Taraba State, killing at least seven persons (a number later heightened to 15) while many others are missing. The villages attacked were Ayiase, Tse-Gbaun and Gaza.
Aggrieved workers of the Nigerian Investment Promotion Commission barricade their office gate in protest of mismanagement.
Demonstrators gather at the Nigerian Investment Promotion Commission to call for the removal of the Executive Secretary of the commission, who they accuse of "gross incompetence."
The adhoc staff engaged by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) during the just concluded elections in Bauchi State staged a peaceful protest to demand payment of their allowances.
Youths protest in Enugu against xenophobic attacks in South Africa.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Military forces engage in an gun battle with Boko Haram in Alagarno, causing several causalities, including a commander known as Abu Mojahid. Exact causality figures not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: Two soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram rocket attack on a military vehicle in the northeast Nigerian town of Baga.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the campaign coordinator of the Kaduna State governor-elect at Atuku Kasa, Atuku Ward, Jemaa LGA.
Following persistent blackouts in parts of Kwara State, angry residents attacked an electricity official distributing bills in Ilorin.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
NOTES: APGA supporters protest in Abuja to demand their candidate be declared winner in the Abia State governorship election.
A womens group protests against an alleged impeachment plot against the governor.

A group of youths, under the auspices of the Nigerian (National) Youth Congress (NYC), Niger State chapter hold a peaceful protest at the headquarters of the examination body and demanded the appointment of an indigene of the state as the chief executive of the council.
Youths protest an oil spill in Akwa lbom State after the company and local governments left the spill unattended for several days.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: A Boko Haram landmine kills a soldier and three unidentified vigilantes in Sambisa Forest, causing the soldiers to retreat.
Unidentified gunmen attack and killed the Assistant Superintendent of Police while on duty and wound three others in Katsina-Ala. The gunmen were later suspected to be hired assassins.
Unidentified gunmen abduct the chairman of Ogbia LGA along the Otuasega-Okaki. Several gunshot reported fired by the gunmen, causing police in the area to flee.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
NOTES: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.
A group of vigilantes attack and attempt to lynch a robbery suspect before he was saved by police in the area.

NOTES: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.

NOTES: 2,000+ Boko Haram attack military forces in Marte and nearby Kirinowa, riding the soldiers in both areas. The fighting lasted over two days, ending on 24/04. "Several" dead, specific numbers not known.
A vigilante mob set a suspected robber alight in the Ogbor Hill area of Aba.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked Shonong village in Riyom local government of Plateau State on Saturday afternoon, killing two operatives of the state security outfit "Operation Rainbow" and two villagers.

Ten are dead following a clash between Fulani and Tiv in three villages in Guma LGA, including Tse Uosu, Gbudu and Branch Umenger. The tension began following a robbery incident involving the two groups several days prior.

Ten are dead following a clash between Fulani and Tiv in three villages in Guma LGA, including Tse Uosu, Gbudu and Branch Umenger. The tension began following a robbery incident involving the two groups several days prior.
Herdsmen attack a Fulani man in Kundu, killing him and injuring two others.
Unidentified assassins kill a newly elected member of a community trust in Ekpan, Uvwie LGA for unclear reasons. In reaction, a group of youths barricaded a road in protest of the incident.
Pensioners protest in Abuja for unknown reason.
Youths in Badagry protest frequent power outages.
Suspected Boko Haram attack and kill 21 civilians in Bultram.
Unidentified assassins kill a newly elected member of a community trust in Ekpan, Uvwie LGA for unclear reasons. In reaction, a group of youths barricaded a road in protest of the incident.

Unidentified gunmen bomb a FM radio station the evening of 27/04 in Okene, killing no fewer than five people. The gunmen gained entry into the station through the hilly rear, gunned down the two security men before throwing an explosive into the building housing the station.
Military reportedly rescues 160 Boko Haram hostages in Sambisa Forest on 28/04, many of whom may have been a part of the Chibok abduction of 2014.
Violent clashes between members of the rival Eiye and Makfite confraternities in Benin City, Edo State resulted in the death of at least five persons.
Protesters block the entrance of the Office of the Secretary to the Government of the Federation (OSGF) over unpaid allowances.
Irate youths set ablaze the FRSC (Federal Road Safety Corps) office in Argungu, Kebbi State after four persons were feared dead as a result of a pursuit by FRSC officials.

About 30 people recruited by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) for the elections in Cross River State protested non-payment of their allowances. The location of the protest in Cross River was not reported.
Military forces report they have killed "several" Boko Haram commanders in an operation in Sambisa. The raid came nearly 24 hours after an operation that rescued several hostages in the area.
Residents of Irewolede Estate, Idi Omo, Ibadan protest a plan to privatize an electricity distribution centre.
Students at Lagos State University, Ojo protest the closure of the school.

Military forces rescues an additional 234 women and girls from a Boko Haram stronghold in Sambisa Forest. The operations against Boko Haram included overrunning their controlled areas of Tokumbere, Wulari Bukar, Gangala, Anguwar Bakwai, Jigide, Kotorima, Lagura Bello and Lagina Fulani. The nature of any violence is not clear, though military command reports the death of at least one soldier.

Military forces rescues an additional 234 women and girls from a Boko Haram stronghold in Sambisa Forest. The operations against Boko Haram included overrunning their controlled areas of Tokumbere, Wulari Bukar, Gangala, Anguwar Bakwai, Jigide, Kotorima, Lagura Bello and Lagina Fulani. The nature of any violence is not clear, though military command reports the death of at least one soldier.
Military reportedly rescues 298 Boko Haram hostages on 30/04 in Sambisa Forest, many of whom may have been a part of the Chibok abduction of 2014.
Fulani gunmen attack and kill six soldiers near Kambari. The soldiers later sought revenge on a nearby village killed 25 residents.
Hotel workers protest a labour dispute in Calabar.
Members of organized labour groups protest non-payment of benefits.

Thirteen are killed along Takum-Katsina-Ala road and Takum-Kashinbilla road between Friday (01/05) and Saturday (02/05) by unidentified gunmen. The attacks prompted an response by Kuteb youths early the following week.

Protesting pipeline vandals went on a rampage in Arepo area of Ogun State, shooting a pregnant woman dead. The vandals, as gathered, were protesting the arrest of one of theirs by security men from Donyx Global Concepts Limited, one of the companies contracted by the Federal Government to secure pipelines in the South-West region. The company is owned by the Odua Peoples Congress, OPC. The rioters were shooting indiscriminately at the crowd when the woman was killed.

Youths set ablaze a section of the Ter Makurdi, Chief Sule Abengas palace over an alleged involvement of one of his sons in cult activities in Kanshio, a suburb of Makurdi in Benue State. The rioters also blocked traffic, burning several cars. Police dispersed the group, arrested several. No reported injuries.

Military forces launch a weekend (02/05) offensive against "insurgent militias" in Wase and Langtang areas, killed 28. The effected areas of Wase included Kadarko, Kurmi and Wadata. One soldier was reported missing. Though the insurgents are not identified they are not believed to be affiliated with Boko Haram. Some of the deaths may have been civilian; other reports claim the soldiers shot "anyone in sight." Fatality numbers vary.

Military forces launch a weekend (02/05) offensive against "insurgent militias" in Wase and Langtang areas, killed 28. The effected areas of Wase included Kadarko, Kurmi and Wadata. One soldier was reported missing. Though the insurgents are not identified they are not believed to be affiliated with Boko Haram. Some of the deaths may have been civilian; other reports claim the soldiers shot "anyone in sight." Fatality numbers vary.

Military forces launch a weekend (02/05) offensive against "insurgent militias" in Wase and Langtang areas, killed 28. The effected areas of Wase included Kadarko, Kurmi and Wadata. One soldier was reported missing. Though the insurgents are not identified they are not believed to be affiliated with Boko Haram. Some of the deaths may have been civilian; other reports claim the soldiers shot "anyone in sight." Fatality numbers vary.
A former PDP officer holder and leader is murdered in his home. The motive had yet to be officially established.

Thirteen are killed along Takum-Katsina-Ala road and Takum-Kashinbilla road between Friday and Saturday by unidentified gunmen. The attacks prompted an response by Kuteb youths early the following week.

Suspected Fulanis attack an Egbas village in Agatu LGA, killing at least 23, possibly 45. The Fulanis may have been working at the behest of Ologba leaders, a group that the Egbas have recently clashed.

Military forces attack a Karin-Lamido village in retaliation for an earlier Fulani attack against them. It is not clear if the attacked village in question was inhabited by Fulani. 25 deaths reported.
Fulani attackers kill 30 in four villages on Foron, Barikin Ladi. The areas included Vat, Pandadi, Zakukpang and Dorong over two days. The victims are believed to be primarily Berom.
A robbery suspect is killed by a vigilante mob at Umuagama Enugu Ezike in Igboeze North local government area of Enugu State.
Hundreds of ad-hoc staff of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) protest non-payment of allowances at a headquarters of a Kwande local council area.
Workers of a government bureaucracy protest non-payment of salaries in Lagos.
Students of the Federal University, Otuaka protest eviction by their landlords.

Kuteb youths attack Takum village in a revenge mission. The clash between Kuteb and Tiv youths results in 9 fatalities.. The attack is believed to be in response to an attack outside Takum by unidentified gunmen over 01/05 and 02/05.
Fulani attackers kill 30 in four villages on Foron, Barikin Ladi. The areas included Vat, Pandadi, Zakukpang and Dorong over two days. The victims are believed to be primarily Berom.

Residents of Ekeremor and Agge LGAs protest against abandonment of a N4 billion shore protection project awarded by the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC). The protest was led by the local monarch. The exact location(s) of each protest were not reported.

Residents of Ekeremor and Agge LGAs protest against abandonment of a N4 billion shore protection project awarded by the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC). The protest was led by the local monarch. The exact location(s) of each protest were not reported.
More than 1,000 Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) supporters in Enugu State stormed the Government House on 05/05, protesting against the purported impeachment plan against the Governor.
A pair of assassins target and kill a 72-year-old retired church leader, reasons unknown.
Two Berom persons were killed by suspected Fulanis on the night of 05/05 in two attacks in Kakpwis and Rim Villages Of Barkin-Ladi LGA of Plateau State. A similar attack occurred Foron days earlier.
Employees of a Chinese construction company protest compensation they believe unfair.
Workers of a Chinese construction firm protest employment termination.
Residents of Nnono community, Oboro in Ikwuano Local Government Area of Abia State "last week" (source dated 13/05) protest a lack on government compensation for destroyed crops.

Hundreds of supporters of All Progressive Congress (APC) in four Local Government Areas of Rivers State stormed the state headquarters of the party along Forces Avenue in Port Harcourt, in protest against what they described as fraudulent council primaries.
Scrap metal dealers and police clash when the dealers protest arbitrary arrest of their colleagues and the death of another in Mpape. One reported shot, fatality unknown.

Nigerian forces rescue 25 additional captives of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest during a security operation in which "many militants" were killed in "a fierce encounter" that cost the life of one soldier and wounded five. Military forces also report they destroyed seven Boko Haram camps including four in Alafa, Rogo Fulani, Laraga and others used as training camps. Exact causality figures not known.

Nigerian forces rescue 25 additional captives of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest during a security operation in which "many militants" were killed in "a fierce encounter" that cost the life of one soldier and wounded five. Military forces also report they destroyed seven Boko Haram camps including four in Alafa, Rogo Fulani, Laraga and others used as training camps. Exact causality figures not known.

Okada riders who were protesting the death of a colleague clash with a group of "hoodlums" they believed responsible. While the clash lasted, the warring factions blocked the road, making it impassable for both motorists and pedestrians alike. Injuries not known.

Community youths of Ido Ekiti attack a hospital complex to demand greater employment for indigenes. They pelted the traditional ruler, the Olojudo, Oba Ayorinde Ilori Faboro with sachets of water, abducted a nurse and killed a unidentified man. The rioters also created a barricade around the hospital.
Federal retirees under the aegis of Nigeria Union of Pensioners protested non payment of their 10 months contributory pension in Abeokuta.
Students of the University of Ibadan (UI) on Thursday May 7, 2015 morning staged a protest over the alleged death of a colleague from a lack of medical attention.
About five persons reportedly lost their lives in a clash between two communities in Tai Local Government Area in the early hours of 07/05.
Students of Ebonyi State University block a road in protest of the disqualification of a canidate of the student government.
Medical workers in Ijebu-Ode protest after a patient dies after he is refused treatment for lack of payment.
Residents protest high electricity bills outside a court hearing arguments on the issue.

A gunman/suicide bomber suspected to be Boko Haram opened fire on Friday (08/05) outside a school in northeast city of Potiskum, seriously wounding 12 students. Only the bomber was confirmed killed. Later reports confirmed a total of three deaths, plus the bomber (Leadership).
Suspected Fulani attack Berom people of Kakpwis village of Foron District, killing two.
"Thousands" of Ovwain youths protest after a robbery suspect escapes police custody and commits a murder. Date unknown, protest occurred "at the weekend."

Four are dead in a communal clash between two groups fighting over a fish pond in Iyamu, a remote community in Ibaji Local Government Area of Kogi State. The identities of the perpetrators are not known.
Two persons were killed in Bangai village on 09/05, assailants unknown.
One person has been confirmed dead and 10 others injured at Ikyoawens Moon Ward in Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State when suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked the village.
Fulani herdsmen attack Ropp village, kill two.
Election workers protest non/under payment of compensation in Benin.

Members of the Tarok community in Jos North LGA of Plateau State staged a peaceful protest to the state House of Assembly over alleged extra judicial killing of Tarok civilians in Wase LGA on May 2 by the military.
Staff of a shoe company protest non-payment of salaries in Kano.
The National Identity Management Commission (NIMC) workers under the Association of Senior Civil Servants of Nigeria (ASCSN) protested against impending sack of 1000 of its members.

Resident doctors at Ladoke Akintola University, Teaching Hospital, Osogbo, staged a peaceful protest at the premises of State Assembly, Gbongan Road, Osogbo against non-payment of their six months salary by Osun state government.
Fulani attackers kill one, steal cattle in or near Wase.
Abuja bomb blast victims (of an attack ten months prior) protest at the National Assembly to urge the government to fulfil compensation promises made to them.
Thousands of local fabric dyers staged a peaceful demonstration against the importation of Chinese textile and engagement of the expatriates in retail sale of fabrics in Kano Market.
A group of civil servants protest non-payment of salary in Port Harcourt.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.

Boko Haram launches an attack on Giwa Barracks in Maiduguri, in an attack that included heavy artillery fire and suicide bombers. Military forces repelled the attackers, many residents fled the area. 55 villagers were killed in raids in Kayamla and Bale areas. "Many" Boko Haram fighters killed - exact figures not known (at least six "vigilantes" were killed by a pair of female sucide bombers who pretended to be in distress, three other soldiers killed). Later estimates believe the total was no less than 12.
Students of the University of Abuja barricaded the entrance and exit gates of the FCT Administration secretariat for about two hours over various demands.
Organized labourers protest at the Plateau House assembly over non-payment of saleries. Many of the protesters scaled the walls of the complex, occupying the area.
Graduate interns protest the non-payment of their stipends.
A group of civil servants protest their management in Lagos.
At least eight people were killed in Gur village of Biu local government area of Borno State as a group of Boko Haram insurgents invaded the community at about 12 midnight.
A mob of vigilantes set four suspected thieves alight in Okuku.
Boko Haram attack Mule location outside of Maiduguri, causalities not known.

A group of unknown gunmen has kidnapped the member representing Toungo Counstituency in the Adamawa House of Assembly. The reason for the abduction is not known, though the politician had recently defected from the PDP to the APC.
Fulani herdmen attack the communities of Tse-Agbulu, Tse-Atakpa and Tse-Abichi in Shengev district of Gwer West, killing eight.
Awka residents protest the acquisition of land by the state government.
Boko Haram overtakes Marte, casualties not known.
A twelve year-old girl detonates a suicide pack at a Damaturu bus depot killing seven (some sources 8) in injuring 31. Boko Haram is believed to be involved.
Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari Hyembula of Madagali, kills three and abducts seven.
Youths (not identified) clash with a private security militia attached to a sand dredging site over royalty fees. Injuries not known. Date unknown, occurred "at the weekend."

Security forces guarding a petroleum pipeline clash with police forces, one dead. The clash began after the security forces began impounding illegally parked vehicles around the facility, which led to a confrontation with police.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
NOTES: The Academic Staff Union of Universities, Ekiti State University chapter, protested in Ado Ekiti over incessant kidnapping of its members in the state. The union also gave the state government till May 22 to rescue the victims or force its members to commence indefinite strike.
Traders at the Idi-Ose Market in Apapa area of Lagos protest against the alleged planned demolition of the market by a local royal.
Ilorin residents protests the return the "Area Boys" criminal gang to the area.
A group of pet shop owners protest a forced eviction in Lagos.
Councillors protest against the non-payment of pension arrears by the Niger State government.

Boko Haram members on May 18, 2015 evening reportedly attacked Madagali community in Adamawa State, and killed about 24 people. They also abducted women and children, even as they reportedly destroyed houses and other properties during the attack on the community.

"Scores" of women protest in Obiangwu over last months murder of Labour candidate in the days following the election. The women, carrying placards and banners, marched through the streets causing vehicular and human traffic gridlock for road users.
Soldiers clash with Hausa traders when they resist clearing the street near the Mile 12 area of Ikeja. No injuries reported.
Eight are dead following a Boko Haram suicide attack at a market in Garkida, Adamawa.
A suicide bomber strikes a cattle marker in Garkida, Gombi LGA, ten dead plus injuries. Boko Haram suspected.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack Madagail, kill 12 and injure others.

No fewer than 27 people were killed in the Barakin Ladi Local Government Area of Plateau State on Tuesday [19 May] following invasion of the council by people suspected to be Fulani mercenaries from Niger and Chad Republics. The attacks took place at Jong, Lobirin, Rabuk, and Zim villages. At least one source reports the attacks took place late in the night of 18/05 (Daily Trust, Abuja).
Staff of the Federal Medical Centre (FMC) Birnin Kudu protest over poor welfare and deteriorating services in the hospital.
Residents of Sapele protest a prolonged electricity blackout in their area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: Members of NURTW clash with a group of traders, one dead. The clash is believed to have stemmed from the alleged harassment of women by the traders.
Airforce personnel allegedly assault aviation workers at at Murtala International Airport.

Days following a Fulani attack on Barikin Ladi LGA, members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Ropp (on 20/05) and Inding (on 21/05). Nine dead in Ropp, seven in Inding, many structures burnt and destroyed. Despite the itemised number of dead in each town the source reported a total of 27 dead. This could be interpreted as a count in the larger area throughout the week.
Unidentified gunmen kill 13 at Kyado market in Ukum Local Government Area of Benue State.
Traders protest in Abuja when the local government refused to buy business premises in Wase. Simultaneously teachers protest in Abuja over the failure of the city to regulate their contracts.
Ikeja traders protest a planned relocation of their market.
Scores of workers of Kwara State Transport Corporation, popularly known as Kwara Express protested over alleged move to privatize the corporation in Ilorin.

Days following a Fulani attack on Barikin Ladi LGA, members of Boko Haram attack the villages of Ropp (on 20/05) and Inding (on 21/05). Nine dead in Ropp, seven in Inding, many structures burnt and destroyed. Despite the itemised number of dead in each town the source reported a total of 27 dead. This could be interpreted as a count in the larger area throughout the week.
Twenty are dead after unidentified gunmen opened fire indiscriminately at a market. It is suspected the gunmen were looking to target one specific individual.
Hundreds of rioting Muslims set a Shariah court ablaze Friday (22/05) in Nigerias northern Kano city, protesting its decision to free a cleric accused of insulting the prophet Mohammed.

Tension heightened in Nembe, as aggrieved youths and women forcibly shut down two flow stations belonging to the Shell Petroleum. The group was protesting an unfulfilled promise that electricity and other amenities would be provided to their community.
Military forces kill "scores" of Boko Haram fighters and rescued 20 of their hostages in a raid in Sambisa Forest. One soldier died while 10 others were wounded in the assault on rebel bases.
Boko Haram attacks the village of Jwamda-Kobla in Madagali the early morning of 22/05. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a woman in Aba, Abia State. The date and the motive for the kidnapping are not known - source dated 22/05.
Employees of an electric provider protest non-payment of salaries "at the weekend."
Boko Haram attacks Kamburo Karaga, killing 10 residents. Date vague - the attack took place "at the weekend."

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Fulani herdsmen attack several Logo villages (Iorzaa, Ukura, Gusa, Per and Gafa) on 25/05 or 24/05 (sources conflict on dates) killing between 50 and 100. The attackers also burned homes and farmlands.

Pandemonium broke out in the early hours of 24/05, as medical students of the College of Medicine, Lagos University Teaching Hospital, CMUL/LUTH, Idi-Araba, Surulere, went on rampage to protest the recurrent incidences of robbery attacks and other malicious attacks on the premises. No reported injury.

Commercial motorcycle operators, popularly known as Okada riders, in Nnewi, Anambra State, embarked on protest against alleged plans by the state government to ban their operations in major cities of Awka, Onitsha and Nnewi.
A number of Boko Haram fighters aged between 12 and 16 attacked Gubio the evening of 24/05, killing 37 residents and destroying over 400 homes.

Aggrieved workers of the Akwa Ibom State Liaison office protest, demanding unpaid allowances and monies promised them for voting the Peoples Democratic Party in the recently concluded general elections.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: NURTU workers protest a fuel shortage in Akure.
Some residents of Benin City, Edo state, protested against what they described as "evil actions of the Benin Electricity Distribution Company," complaining of prolonged power outages.
University of Ibadan students protest poor electricity and water supplies on their campus.
Residents protest fuel scarcity and prolonged power outages in Ikeja.
Aviation workers protest against an alleged assault at the hands of Air Forces personnel on their colleagues.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram on Mafa, killing 30, including a foreign-born commander. The commander was discovered to have thousands of Euros on his person.
Special Task Force officers attack a rally organized by the Wase Women Development Association, leaving six injured. The reason for the attack is not known.
Unidentified gunmen slit the throat of a Fulani man shortly after the victim left Dafa village. Date of the crime unknown, the body of the man was discovered at 5:30 am on 26/05.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a Adavi LGA judge and kill his orderly.

Activists staged a peaceful protest to the National Judicial Council to register their grievances over the detention of Senator-elect, Senator Buruji Kashamu by the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) in his Lekki residence, Lagos.
Women in Biseni, Yenegoa protest an expired memorandum of understanding with an oil company.
Members of the National Association of Kaudna students protest over the non-payment of a scholarship allowance in Kaduna on 26/05.
University students protest against poor electricity supply in Nsukka on 26/05.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
NOTES: ASUU members force the shut down of a university of Ado Ekiti, blocking several entrances. The union was protesting the non-payment of several months of salaries.

PDP youth wing protests against "provocative embarrassment" of Senator-elect, Prince Buriji Kashamu by the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA). The Senator had been accused of drug trafficking abroad.
Hospital contractors gather to protest non-payment of salaries on 27/05.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Students from 13 tertiary institutions in Ogun state under the aegis of National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS/Joint Campus Committee (JCC), protested at the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA)s office, Abeokuta to protest the continued siege to the Lekki home of Ogun East senate-elect, Buruji Kashamu by the operatives of the agency despite a court order. The Senator had been accused of drug trafficking.
Police officers assault a group of protesting factory workers on 28/05. The demonstrators were protesting back pay.
Six are killed at Kpopie over a disagreement between residents of Deeken and Deeyor communities. The perpetrators are suspected to be Deeken while the victims were Deeyor.
Youths pelt dignitaries with stones during the inauguration of Gov. Nasir El-Rufai of Kaduna State. Police dispersed the crowd, no injuries reported.
Suspected Boko Haram target a wedding in Tashon Alade with a suicide blast. Six deaths reported.
About 20 shia worshippers were injured when a armed group attacked a mosque in Ruguji, Kafur LGA of Katsina State. The reason for the attack was not known.
An unidentified suicide bomber attacks a wedding in Tashon Alade on 29/05, killing six guests.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: Protest in Ajase-Ipo in Irepodun local government council of Kwara state after a police officer shot and killed a member of the NURTW following an unknown disagreement. The protesters blocked several roads.

Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Causalities not known.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: A policeman shoots and kills a regional chairman of NURTW during a heated argument.

Boko Haram attack Maiduguri with a series of RPGs, military forces retaliate, forcing the attackers into retreat. The fighting was most heavily concentrated in the Dala suburb to the south of the city. Between 7-15 causalities reported from the grenade attacks.

A Suicide bomber on 30/05 sneaked into a mosque along Ali Kotoko road, Maiduguri and detonated his vest, leaving 26 dead with 28 injured. The incident took place at about 3:45pm when people were performing their Laasar prayers. Unconfirmed report said that apart from the explosion in the mosque, another explosion rocked the Monday Market area.

The two campuses of the University of Nigeria Nsukka (UNN) in Nsukka and Enugu have been shutdown following protests by students of the university over poor services. The protests started at the Enugu Campus on Sunday night and spilled over to Nsukka on Monday.
Oil workers protest the Nigeria Petroleum Development Company over pay on 31/05.
The Kogi State Commissioner for Land and Housing is kidnapped by unidentified men on 31/05 in Osara, Adavi Local Council of the State.
Members of the NLC protest at the Morocco High Commission in Abuja on 01/06. The reason for the protest was the NLCs opposition to Moroccos colonization of Western Sahara.

The two campuses of the University of Nigeria Nsukka (UNN) in Nsukka and Enugu have been shutdown, following protests by students of the university over poor services. The protests started at the Enugu Campus on Sunday night and spilled over to Nsukka on Monday.

A youth volunteer group in Imo State under the aegis of Imo Youth Congress (IYC), protest at the state government house in Owerri over their non-inclusion in the Federal Governments Amnesty programme.
Unidentified gunmen early in the day killed a Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) youth leader in Ushongo LGA of Benue State.
A group of widows protest a forced eviction from their homes in Barnawa. Date unknown, source dated 02/06.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack at a market area in Maiduguri, killing 13, injuring 24. Some sources count the dead as many as 20.

Scores of students of the Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta, FUNAAB, trooped out to protest against what they termed as unlawful detention of a professor of the university. The protesters blocked the Abeokuta-Ibadan highway at Camp Junction of the school for three hours, the action which caused traffic gridlock on the road.
Artisans in Aba, Abia State have protest against high electricity bills and poor electricity supply along several major roads in Aba. Date of the protest not known, source dated 03/06.
Representatives of ex-Niger Delta militants protest the delay in payment of their allowances under an amnesty programme by the federal government on 03/06 in Abuja.

Supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Kontagora local government area of Niger state on 03/06 protested the appointment of the Secretary to the State Government (SSG), claiming that "due diligence" was not carried out before the appointment.
Staff of Imo Broadcasting Corporation protest over pay at the government house on Owerri.

A mob of youth, blaming police for the death of a man, attacked and burnt down a police patrol vehicle at Obehira area, in Okene Local Government Area of Kogi State. No reported injuries or causalities.
Explosives left near a garage along Baga road in Maiduguri cause 18 deaths when they detonated during the early evening on 03/06. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the blast.
Electricity customers protest at the headquarters of the Benin Electricity Distribution Company over prolonged outages.

A group of ex-militants protest along the Warri-Port Harcourt (W-2) at Mbiama over non-payment of allowances. The protesters blocked the road, chanting song. Military forces clashed with the protesters in an attempt to remove them. No reported injuries.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide blast kills four soldiers at a military checkpoint in Maiduguri on 04/06.
Three villagers are killed in Matokun village, Patigi Local Government in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and dwellers of the village.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers killed at least 31 people and injured 38 others in a crowded market in the northeast Nigeria city of Yola on 04/06.
Military forces shoot and kill two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers in Shettimari.
A bomb kills 16 in Musari, outside of Maiduguri. Boko Haram suspected. Most of the dead were traders.
Akwa Ibom State transporters protest a government lease with an automotive firm in Uyo.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Ungwan Keke-B village in Chikun local government area. One Boko Haram death reported.

No fewer than 17 villages of Gashish District (not named) of the Barkin Ladi Local Government area of Plateau State have been sacked by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. Also in Ngar village of Barkin Ladi, unidentified gunmen (may be Fulani, though unknown) were said have ambushed and attack personnel of the Special Task Force on Jos crisis, killing two. Date(s) not known, source dated 07/06.
An IED detonated at Tungushe village in Konduga Local Government Area, near a military check point. Two injuries reported. Perpetrators not known.
Suspected Boko Haram female suicide bomber detonated along Baga/Monguno (likely in Marte), killing herself and two others.

No fewer than 17 villages of Gashish District (not named) of the Barkin Ladi Local Government area of Plateau State have been sacked by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. Causalities not known. Also in Ngar village of Barkin Ladi, unidentified gunmen were said have ambushed and attack personnel of the Special Task Force on Jos crisis, killing two. Date(s) not known, source dated 07/06.
Suspected Fulani kill two farmers along Bululu and Yiplack villages of Kanam local government area while they returned from their farms. Date of the attack not known, source dated 07/06.
A group of local indigenes and market women in Akure staged a protest to call on the state government to reinstate the deposed Deji of Akure, after the elder was replaced by the local government.
A group of woman protest, accusing local politicians of taking bribes in return for appointing desired monarchs.
Fifteen are dead and several buildings destroyed when Boko Haram gunmen attacked Huyum village on 08/06.
Three female Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate themselves in Konduga. Only the bombers reported killed.
Bomb blast reported along the Baga/Monguno Highway at Tungushe Dogonwaya near Konduga on 09/06. Details limited or not reported.
A group of youths protest against the abduction of priest in Ado-Ekiti. The priests attackers may have been a criminal element.
Students of a polytechnic university go on strike on Bauchi, gather publicly and light fires. The students were protesting against actions of their Rector.
Edo workers protest unpaid salaries in Benin City.
Boko Haram attacks the Sambisa Forest villages of Matangale, Buraltima and Dirmanti of Borno on 09/06, opening fire on villagers before looting and burning homes. 43 reported dead.
Aggrieved drivers have on 10/06 blocked Kaduna-Kano expressway at Zaria to protest the arrest of their colleagues leaving a large number of motorists stranded.

An Ahmadu Bello University professor is mobbed and killed by a vigilante group near Fala village (believed to be Bauchi State) after he is mistaken for a member of Boko Haram. In a conflicting report, some members of the community blame the police for the killing.
Residents of Ado-Ogbadibu Federal Constituency, Benue State, barricaded the Makurdi-Enugu Expressway on 11/06 to protest the inauguration of Hassan Saleh as a member of the House of Representatives.
Students protest over the police detention of a classmate in Asaba.

Traders at the Byazhin market in Kubwa, Bwari Area Council, stage a peaceful protest at the premises of the High Court in Kubwa over the alleged plan by the Bwari Area Council to demolish their shops in the market.
Striking workers protest non-payment of salaries in Oshogbo.

About 2000 placards carrying youths protest in Port Harcourt the alleged plan by [the current governor] to dissolve the elected council executive in 22 local government areas. The group was sworn in by the former governor.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Basic Education Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Police teargas a group of protesting BASAN teachers at Nataco junction. Some reported injury. The teachers were gathering to protest public school funding.
Hawkers of sachet water in Aba have, "at the weekend," protested a hike in price of the product by the manufacturers.
Patients at the University of Calabar Teaching Hospital (UCTH) protest increased medical costs "at the weekend."

Staff of the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company, NPDC attached to the Eriemu oil field, Ughelli North Local Government Area, Delta State, embarked on a protest against the alleged non-payment of their six months salaries and bonuses.

"Several" Boko Haram were killed early in the day when Boko Haram attacked Babbangida, headquarters of Tarmowa (Tarmua) LGA of Yobe State. [Boko Haram] stormed the town around 6:00am, shooting, burning government buildings and burning several shops.
A commuter is shot and killed at a military checkpoint for not offering a bribe.

Scores of protesters from Urhobo and Isoko host communities in Delta State shut down flow stations and operations at the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company (NPDC) in their areas. The protests stem from a disagreement over pipeline contracts.

A group of commuters embark on a 14-hour protest over the killing of a fellow traveller at a military checkpoint outside of Kaduna. The protesters block the road with their vehicles, causing a traffic jam for several hours.

Scores of protesters from Urhobo and Isoko host communities in Delta State shut down flow stations and operations at the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company (NPDC) in their areas. The protests stem from a disagreement over pipeline contracts.

Eight are killed when a Boko Haram suicide bomber target the office of a Potiskum vigilante group known as "Alhaji Ardo" during mid-day in the Igwanda area. A second bomber killed two targeting a Dorawa area brothel.

Eight are killed when a Boko Haram suicide bomber target the office of a Potiskum vigilante group known as "Alhaji Ardo" during mid-day in the Igwanda area. A second bomber killed two targeting a Dorawa area brothel.
Members of the Nigeria Union of Pensioners (NUP), Ondo State chapter, yesterday (16/06) staged a protest, demanding payment of their three months pension.
Commercial motorbike operators protest a restriction on their movement in Awka on 16/05.
Members of JOHESU protest the poor state of a hospital in Ebute-Metta, giving management ultimatums before facing strike.

Scores of elders from Imufu Community in Enugu-Ezike, Igbo-Eze North Local Government Area of Enugu State, [16/06], protested at the office of the Permanent Secretary in Enugu, Rural Development in the state, protesting alleged plan to hijack the leadership of its Town Union.
Residents of Mushin area in Lagos protested the Lagos State House of Assembly in protest of incessant killings in the area. The protesters called on the state government for help.
Residents protest poor water supply in the Onitsha suburb of Awada and in Ogidi.
Residents protest poor water supply in the Onitsha suburb of Awada and in Ogidi.

Police and commercial motorbike operators clash in Onitsha. The clash was fallout of the commencement of enforcement of the ban on commercial motorbikes/tricycles operators in some restricted roads in Anambra State.

"Militants" attack the Police Marine Base in Calabar, Cross River State on 16/06, looting sensitive sections of the facility. Reports described the scene as a rain of bullets, as the suspected militants shot sporadically into the air as they broke into the base. Causalities unreported or unknown.

Several people are dead (including members of a vigilante group) when a Boko Haram bomb exploded during the early evening of 16/06. The death total was later raised to 71 as the week progressed (Daily Trust - Abuja).
A pair of suspected thieves are attacked and killed by mob justice in Nkpor.

Scores of members of Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities staged a peaceful protest at the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta over alleged plan to retrench over 2,000 workers in Universities Staff Schools .

A community leader is shot and killed by unknown assailants on 17/06 in the Ago-Oba area in Abeokuta North Local Government Area of the state. It is believed the chief was targeted over accusations of promiscuity.

Unidentified gunmen have killed 13 people in Katsak and Unguwar Danborno in Jemaa and Birnin Gwari local government areas of Kaduna State. [The] two attacks, which occurred in the early hours of 17/06, led to the death of 13 people, while 15 people sustained injuries.

Unidentified gunmen have killed 13 people in Katsak and Unguwar Danborno in Jemaa and Birnin Gwari local government areas of Kaduna State. [The] two attacks, which occurred in the early hours of 17/06, led to the death of 13 people, while 15 people sustained injuries.

Doctors at the Ladoke Akintola University of Technology Teaching Hospital (LAUTECHTH), under the aegis of Resident Doctors Association (ARD) Osogbo protested the non-payment of their eight-month salary arrears.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: JUSUN: Judiciary Staff Union of Nigeria
NOTES: Police avert a group of striking workers from attacking a group of labour scabs.

Four students are injured during a violent student-led protest against poor hostel accommodation in Onitsha. Their injuries, according to eye-witness, followed a stampede arising from the gunshots allegedly fired by some policemen to disperse the rampaging students who had already barricaded the busy Onitsha/Owerri dual carriageway in front of the NMTI main campus.
Air Forces bombed waterways outside Calabar on 18/06, targeting "militants and pirates." At least one bombardment was as far north as the Bakassi area. Casualties unknown.
Unknown gunmen killed an Anglican pastor and a nine year-old boy at Wakama community in Ogu/Bolo local government area of Rivers State. The attack is believed to be related to a land dispute.
Assailants suspected to be Fulani herdsmen hacked to death eight farmers in Sondi village in Wukari district of Taraba State on 18/06.

Patients suffering from Sickle Cell Anemia in Benin City weekend (19/06) disrupted the 2015 World Sickle Cell Day celebration organised by the state Ministry of Health as they protested alleged neglect by the state government.
Residents protest poor electricity supply in Onitsha "at the weekend."
Residents protest a private building development in Owerri "at the weekend."
A group of protesting "hoodlums" clash with police at Onipanu Toll Gate after an arrest of a member of their cult group. Several reported injuries.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CCSG: Coalition of Civil Society Groups
NOTES: The CCSG protests at Abujas UN office over a recently released Amnesty International report that indicted the Nigerian military of war crimes. The group thought the report to be vindictive and also having a political undertone.
Residents of Awada Obosi in Idemili North Local Government Area of Anambra State 22/06 took to streets to protest what they described as poor electricity supply and high bills.
Boko Haram fighters stormed Debiro Hawul in Nigerias north-eastern state of Borno on Monday (22/06), shooting sporadically and razing houses. An estimated 22 dead.

A pair of female suicide bombers attack Baga Market in Maiduguri on 22/06 killing at least 35 and injuring more than 50. It was gathered that one of the women in her early 20s hid explosives beneath a veil and attempted attacking a Jumaat mosque outside the fish market. A security official said the attack had the hallmark of the Boko Haram.

A pastor with a church in Ijesha, Lagos was on the evening of 22/06 shot dead by suspected assassins. Some of the churchs members dismissed suggestion that it was a robbery operation, saying that the killers fled after the incident without taking anything from the deceased.
Two suspected robbers are attacked and set alight by a vigilante militia in Nkpor on 22/06.
Protesters gather at the National Assembly over a proposed increase of lawmaker pay.
Pensioners, under the aegis of the Nigeria Union of Pensioners (NUP), protested at the Government House, Ibadan to protest unpaid pension arrears.
On 23/06, 20 people are dead in an assault on Debiro Biu. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrators. A similar attack occurred on the previous day.
Suspected assassins target and kill a leading doctor in Alakuko. The reason for the attack is not known.
A young girl carrying a suicide pack detonates at a crowded market in Wagur on 23/06, killing ten and injuring 30.
Protesters gather at Lagos State assembly to urge the newly elected governor to remove an area politician, accusing him of corruption.

Gunmen on (24/06) killed two policemen and abducted two Lebanese at Onuegbum community in Ogbia Local Government Area of Bayelsa State. The two Lebanese are workers attached to the Pache Construction Company, while the policemen were providing security for the company. The two police engaged the gunmen but were killed in exchange of fire. The reason for the attack is not known.
Taxi drivers barricade "Kaduna-Abuja flyover," Kaduna State in protest of alleged police harassment.
Some Ikorodu indigenes protested at the Lagos state secretariat protesting the selection of a political leader for their area on 25/06.

Police and army clash at Ngwa High School Forward Operation Base. The nature of the clash is believed to be related to the holding of military ID cards by police. Date unknown, source dated 25/06. A policeman sustained a serious gunshot injury during the battle and appears to be in a life-threatening condition.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: NURTW members protest in several areas of Ibadan over high union fees. The protest was characterised as violent in several areas of the city.
A violent taxi driver protest along Dei-Dei junction injures one. Date not known - source claims "at the weekend."
Youths block roads in Awka and Onitsha in protest of a plan to relocate Boko Haram prisoners to their area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
NOTES: SSANU stage a protest against federal governments intention to remove university staff schools from university pay roll in Makurdi. Date of the protest not known - source dated 27/06.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
NOTES: The Senior Staff Association of Nigeria Universities (SSANU) has staged a peaceful protest in Makurdi against federal governments intention to remove university staff schools from university pay roll. Date not clear, source dated 27/06.
Youths block roads in Awka and Onitsha in protest of a plan to relocate Boko Haram prisoners to their area. Police in Onitsha used tear gas to disperse the protesters.
Following the believed accidental killing of two civilians by police a group attempts to lynch the responsible officers. The police are saved by the intervention of the LGA Chairperson.

At least five people have been killed and 10 wounded after a suicide bomber blew himself up outside a leprosy hospital during the early evening hours on the outskirts of the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected.
Two female suicide bombers (affiliation not known) are killed at Jakana Town when their packs detonated prematurely. It is believed the two were attempting to target bus passengers.

Scores of students of the Olabisi Onabanjo University, Ago-Iwoye went on "rampage" and destroyed 11 trucks and products worth millions of Naira belonging to the alleged owner of the vehicle that crushed 12 of their colleagues during an automotive collision.
A group of taxi drivers protest for the removal of a government traffic bureaucracy after a string a alleged abuses.

Residents of Labora Owode in Ibeju-Lekki Local Government Area of Lagos State, on 29/06 took a peaceful protest to the state House of Assembly to complain the forceful invasion of the lands by "hoodlums".
The wife of the former governor is abducted by unidentified persons at Agbura in Yenagoa LGA on 29/06.
Traders in Ekwulobia on 30/06 protest a relocation of Boko Haram prisoners to their area.
Traders protest the destruction of their shops.
Four are dead in a clash between Fulani and Berom in Barikin Ladi on 30/06. Date disputed: some sources claim 29/06, others 30/06.
Taxi drivers in Abuja again protest a bureaucratic regulation that effects their business. On the same day, persons with disabilities protest against a bank they accuse of discriminatory practices.

Academic and administrative activities were on Wednesday (01/07) hampered at the University of Ibadan as a result of the protest by three of the workers unions on the campus over the non-payment of earned allowances for the month of June.
Aviation workers protest at Murtala Mohammed International Airport after a member of their union was dismissed.
