Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.
Unidentified gunmen stop a bus along the Ikorodu road, target a specific passenger, kill him, and drive away. The motive of the killing is not known.
11 dead, including civilians, over a three day communal clash in Inyima village between its towns militia and their Onyadama neighbours over land. Exact causalities not known.
11 dead, including civilians, over a three day communal clash in Inyima village between its towns militia and their Onyadama neighbours over land. Exact causalities not known.
Seven are killed in a farmland dispute between members of Rumu and Isgogo communities at Kubula village in Zuru local government area of Kebbi State on 17/04.

24 thatched shops were destroyed and seven houses razed following a communal clash between the Kudung people and Pwel people of Dawaki, both in Kanke local government areas of Plateau State. [] the genesis of the clash was the unmasking of a Kudung "masquerade" by the Pwel people who were on a reprisal mission following a similar action done to their masquerade by the Kudung people three months ago. The clash occurred over two days. No causalities reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees "invade" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees "invade" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees "invade" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
NOTES: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees "invade" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

Scores of protesters staged a protest at the Federal Ministry of Communications over the decision of the government to withdraw their appointment and cancel their recruitment by the National Information Technology Development Agency.
Electricity customers protest poor service in Ikeja, demand a recall of workers.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NUAHP: Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals
NOTES: Members of Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals (NUAHP), University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital (UITH) branch protested against managements plans to privatise a section of the hospital.
The Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) and civil society groups protest at the offices of the Ikeja Electricity Company in Lagos over the recent termination of 400 staff amidst epileptic supply of power.
Auto parts traders protest in Nkpor over management issues.
Boko Haram attacked a group of military forces in Damasak, near the border with Cameroon on 18/04. The source speculated there were heavy causalities from both sides.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at a Karetu (Kareto) military base on 18/04. 30 Boko Haram dead, 24 soldiers injured.

24 thatched shops were destroyed and seven houses razed following a communal clash between the Kudung people and Pwel people of Dawaki, both in Kanke local government areas of Plateau State. [] the genesis of the clash was the unmasking of a Kudung "masquerade" by the Pwel people who were on a reprisal mission following a similar action done to their masquerade by the Kudung people three months ago. The clash occurred over two days. No causalities reported.

Social and economic activities were on 19/04 disrupted for several hours in Asaba, the Delta State capital as thousands of people took to streets to protest the growing involvement of Fulani herdsmen in criminal activities in the state.
Boko Haram ambushes a Generals convoy in Bama on 19/04, resulting in a clash. One soldier was killed and others injured, "some" Boko Haram dead. The General escaped unhurt.
Army and Navy forces clash with oil pipeline vandals in Ibafo, killing five on 19/04.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen on horseback killed at least 11 people in Zango village, Gulani LGA on the evening of 19/04 and into the following morning.

Fulanis, along with "hoodlums" who, according to witnesses, spoke English and Yoruba, invaded a farm belonging to a former Secretary to the Oyo State Government (Accord Party) and forced settlers in the place to flee their residence.
Electricity customers protest in Asaba on 20/04 over cost of service.
Employees of a telecommunications company protest in Port Harcourt on 20/04 over the impending termination of several jobs.
Police disperse violent electricity distribution protesters in Enugu. The protesters had destroyed company property and manhandled staff.
Police of Bwari division (Tudun Wada) clash with a group of vigilantes over grazing rights to land. Several injuries reported. Date not clear - source dated 21/04.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a displacement camp in Banki on 20/04, seven dead. The bombers were guising as refugees.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen on horseback killed at least 11 people in Zango village, Gulani LGA on the evening of 19/04 and into the following morning.
Electricity customers protest in Warri on 21/04 over epileptic service.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village. At Bego village the forces kill nine Boko Haram and rescued 157 hostages.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military forces clear Bulari and Tori locations (unknown LGA) of Boko Haram. During the operation, 10 Boko Haram are killed and one was captured alive. Two Civilian JTF accompanying the troops lost their lives. The troops rescued 7 civilians and recovered a Volkswagen Golf car, 15 bicycles and various bags of foodstuffs.
Military forces encounter Boko Haram while on patrol toward Diema, Sigel and Kala area on 21/04. Eight Boko Haram dead.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village.
Unidentified persons invade a polling unit at Afon LCDA, Abeokuta North attack people and stealing ballot boxes.
Fulani men on 21/04 attacked Igo village in Donga LGA, killing seven Tiv. The attack may have be a reprisal for a recent robbery.

Military forces attest four Boko Haram "kingpins" at Rann, including Umara Mai Gyaran Rediyo (Radio Technician), Umaru Mai Nama, (who specializes in cattle rustling and sale), Alifa Makinta (a specialist on stealing foodstuff) and Balu Jugudum (in charge of stolen jewelleries).

At least 10 people have been killed and several houses burnt in fresh violence between the Wurkum and Shumo ethnic groups in Karin-Lamido LGA. The violence began when Wurkum militia attacked a Shumo village and civilians. In reprisal Shumo militia attacked a Wurkum area. Both attackers occurred near Balasa.

At least 10 people have been killed and several houses burnt in fresh violence between the Wurkum and Shumo ethnic groups in Karin-Lamido LGA. The violence began when Wurkum militia attacked a Shumo village and civilians. In reprisal Shumo militia attacked a Wurkum area. Both attackers occurred near Balasa.
Services at Lagos University Teaching Hospital, LUTH, Idi Araba, Lagos, were interrupted in 23/04 as dozens of protesters demonstrated at the hospitals main gates to protest the alleged negligence.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military forces stop a suicide bomber in Umarari area of Maiduguri. The suspect detonated his explosives after he was halted by security agents and members of the Civilian Joint Task Force, killing only himself.
Fulanis attack the Bali locations of Bornon Kurku, Anchogo and Tortondo, killing a suspected six. Date not known, source dated 23/04.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram near Alagarmo on 24/04, kill five.
A vigilante mob attacks and set two suspected thieves ablaze in Warri on 24/04.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Members of NANS protest against the "unjust" expulsion of a fellow student on 25/04. The protesters blocked several roads in and around the institution. The protest lasted over two days and caused the school to close indefinitely.
A Abuja civil service union protests a delay in pay on 25/04. Anti-Saraki (president of the Senate) demonstrators also assemble at the national assembly to protest.

Major health institutions in Ekiti State, including the Federal Teaching Hospital, Ido Ekiti(FETHI), the Ekiti State University Teaching Hospital (EKSUTH), Ido Ekiti, and other general hospitals were paralysed on 25/04 when their staffs protested after several doctors were recently killed in an auto accident.
Unidentified men murder a Osun Chief on Oshogbo on 25/04. The reason for the killing is not known.

Suspected Fulani herdsmen kidnapped eight persons in Obiaruku, Ukwuani Local Government Area of Delta State on 25/04 and held them hostage for several hours during which the victims were allegedly tortured.
Fulanis attack Ukpabi Nimbo on 25/04, 48 believed dead.
A vigilante mob attacks and sets three suspected thieves ablaze in Warri on 25/04. A similar attack took place the previous day.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Members of NANS protest against the "unjust" expulsion of a fellow student on 25/04. The protesters blocked several roads in and around the institution. The protest lasted over two days and caused the school to close indefinitely.
Ex-militants in Akwa Ibom State, who were granted amnesty since 2012, barricaded the entrance to Government House, Uyo, protesting their alleged neglect.

Protesters, under the aegis of Okigwe Zonal Development Association, Abuja (OZDA) on 26/04 staged a demonstration at the National Assembly, over the delay in conducting Imo North Senatorial rerun polls. Other protests, including the anti-Saraki and bringbackourgirls campaigns, took place at the Assembly the same day.
The owners of buildings demolished by Osun State government for road construction in some parts of Osogbo, capital of Osun State on 26/04 protested over non-payment of their compensation.

Troops of the 7 Brigade, 8 Task Force Division of the Nigerian Army who were on clearance operation around Gratte in Kukawa LGA of Borno State killed seven Boko Haram militants including a notorious kingpin popularly known as the Albani of Monguno.

Two groups of protesters clashed at the assembly complex in Abuja. The first group, identified as OccupyNASS, had taken over the main entrance of the national assembly before another group, identified as Save Our National Assembly, brought a counter-protest to the venue. One reported injury. The protest began as an anti-Saraki protest.
A vigilante group attacks church members and their Bishop over alleged infidelity by the pastor on 26/04.
The bring back our girls campaign protests at the National Assembly for three days.
Market traders in Nkpor protest a tax on 27/04.
A "recent" clash (source dated 27/04) between members of the APC and PDP over the visit of the National Chairman of PDP to Dutse results in the injury of five and the death of one.

No fewer than 20 persons were seriously injured and 13 houses torched when a rival youth group attacked another one in Obosi in Idemili North Local Government Area of Anambra State. It was gathered that members of Obosi Youths Movement, OYM, were allegedly protesting the introduction of another youth movement named Obiano Youth Vanguard, with OYM members saying they did not want another youth association in the area.

A former Minister of state for Education, Senator Iyabo Anisulowo was on 27/04 kidnapped by armed men alongside her security aide along Igbogila road in Yewa North (or Egbado North) local government area of Ogun state on 27/04.
The bring back our girls campaign protests at the National Assembly for three days.
Delta State pensioners took to the streets in Asaba to protest non-payment by the government of their pension and gratuity under the State Contributory Pension Scheme.
Soldiers protest unpaid salaries in Yola.
Military forces track and arrest six Boko Haram "kingpins" in Kala Balge on 29/04.
A violent tyre burning protest in Sanya area, Lagos after an official form a government agency was believed to have killed a tanker driver along an expressway.
Military forces destroy Boko Haram cells in the Sambisa Forest areas of Yerwa and Kaluketu, killing four and recovering weapons.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.

Two persons were reportedly feared killed and five others critically injured during a bloody clash between supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Bassambiri, Nembe Local Council of Bayelsa State. The clash occured "at the weekend" and was sparked when members of PDP supporters led by the newly appointed Caretaker Chairman, Mr. Walter Kuroekigha chanted the partys slogans, which allegedly provoked APC members at a ceremony.

Nineteen persons have been killed at Ula-Upata and Edoha in Ahoada east local government area of Rivers State by gunmen suspected to be members of an unnamed "cult group" on 30/04. The attacks came in two waves. The first during the early afternoon, and the second later in the evening. The attack may have been related to an election in the area.
Suspected Agatu gunmen attack Fulani settlements of Loko and Adayi of Nassarawa LGA on 30/04, killing 20 herdsmen and 83 cows.
Suspected Agatu gunmen attack Fulani settlements of Loko and Adayi of Nassarawa LGA on 30/04, killing 20 herdsmen and 83 cows.
Prisoners in Afikpo stage a jailbreak, then protest through the streets against the poor quality of food they are served. Police and militart responed to the protest.
Military forces launch a preemptive attack against Boko Haram in Wumbi, nine dead. Several soldiers sustained injury in the assult.

Soldiers attempt to open a road block placed by Mkpani militia in their effort against Nko militia. When the militia mistook the soldiers for mercenaries they opened fire, sparking a clash. Three killed, two injured.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.
Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani herdsmen assassinated the District Head of Fadan Karshi, along with his nephew.
A traditional ruler is murdered in Ejule in a suspected leadership tussle.
A new militant group the Niger Delta Avenger (NDA) in the Niger Delta region have blew up of the Chevron Valve Platform off the coast of Warri in Delta State.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CDHR: Committee for the Defence of Human Rights
NOTES: Members of the Committee for the Defence of Human Rights (CDHR), staged an anti-corruption rally in Minna, Niger state.

Health workers across Ondo town in Ondo West Local Government Area of Ondo State paralysed social and economic activities in the town, protesting against the non payment of their five months salary by the state government
At the Lion Building in Ukpabi Nimbo in Uzouwani Council, Enugu State, women were led inprotestby women organizations at the gates of the Government House.
A bomb detonated, suspected to be a petrolbomb, leaving seven people injured in Ogbaru, a town close to Onitsha in Anambra State

105 Students at Bida, Niger State escaped being abducted by gunmen in police uniform. Three of the students were raped by the bandits while many of them, including their teachers sustained varying degree of injuries

Six floating corpses have been reportedly recovered along the Brass River in the Bayelsa East senatorial district. The decomposing corpses are believed to be that of victims of a violent attack on a boat conveying some oil workers on a visit to an oil facility in the Nembe creek.
Workers of the Federal Ministry of Health staged a peacefulprotestto demand better incentives and the resignation of the Permanent Secretary, Mrs. Aminat Shamaki.

Hundreds of residents of Felele area in Ibadan South East Local Government Council shut down all roads leading to the area in protest of maltreatment by Ibadan Electrical Development Company (IBEDC), over inconsistency billing, irregular supply of electricity and bad public relations, among others.

The industrial dispute by the Joint Health Sector Union (JOHESU) at the Jos University Teaching Hospital (JUTH) has taken yet another dimension as the striking workers have taken to the streets toprotest the hospitals decision to stop their salaries.
An angry mob yesterday lynched an armed robbery suspect at Iponri area of Lagos.

In the second attack in as many days, Niger Delta Avengers members attacked and blew up Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) crude trunkline feeding crude oil to both Warri and Kaduna refineries. An oil flow station and gas line were also reportedly attacked in the Warri area in Delta state.

In response to the killing of two butchers, massive protest action took place in Aba, Abia as protesters marched towards the Mosque and the Hausa settlement on Hospital Road, but were quickly dispersed by soldiers who kept watch over the places.
The Nigerian Army has killed 20 bandits and recovered 12 rifles after a fierce encounter with the armed bandits, the commanding officer in Gusau, Lieutenant Colonel Abdullahi Adamu Aliyu has said.
At least three people have been killed in Aba, Abia State, in ethnicclashes between Igbo traders and their Hausa counterparts.
Nigerian soldiers allegedly killed two butchers at the abattoir in the Ogbor Hill area of Aba.
Pensioners protest a delay in benefits in Bauchi on 06/05.
Pensioners, aligned to the Nigerian Union of Pensioners, in Bauchi State staged a demonstration over the delay in the payment of their pension benefits for almost four months.
Five are dead after members of Igbide community attack Okpolo-Enhwe community on 07/05 in a boundary dispute.

Troops from 21 Brigade, 7 Division, on 08/05, successfully cleared four villages of Boko Haram - Bala Karege, Goske, Harda, and Markas 3 - which were previously under the control of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest. The military forces were met with no resistance, with the exception of Harda village, where the forces ran into a small ambush. Eight Boko Haram dead. Some sources claim 18 dead.

Military forces announced on 08/05 they have clear the Borno villages of Galtha Baba, Galtha Musa, Bulakurma, Shatimari, Chukruk, Bulangaje, and Disa of Boko Haram. No violence reported. One Boko Haram member captured alive, and fifteen hostages were rescued. The operation may have been before 08/05.

Military forces announced on 08/05 they have clear the Borno villages of Galtha Baba, Galtha Musa, Bulakurma, Shatimari, Chukruk, Bulangaje, and Disa of Boko Haram. No violence reported. One Boko Haram member captured alive, and fifteen hostages were rescued. The operation may have been before 08/05.
Unidentified gunmen attack a APC local government aspirant on 08/05 while he travelled in Sobe. No causalities.
At least six persons were killed and many others wounded when Fulani gunmen attacked Korum, Orawua and Gidan Bature villages in Gassol Local Government Area of Taraba State on 08/05.
A vigilante mob set a suspected thief ablaze in Warri.

Following the dismissal of an ill student from an Ife-Ife height school, colleagues storm a radio station in protest, assaulting employees and others. The date of the protest is not clear. Source dated 09/05.

Dissatisfied members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) from Imo West(Orlu) "took over" the state secretariat along Okigwe Road, Owerri, Imo State capital and called for the cancellation of the state congress of the party scheduled to hold today. They alleged that the ward and local government congresses were held in only four out of the 12 council areas of the zone.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: IPMAN: Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Petroleum marketers clash with security forces over the inability to dispense fuel in Udu LGA. No reported causalities.

Five members of the Rivers State police force are attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Okobe. The policemen were ambushed in the early hours of 09/05 while heading to their base at the end of their special mission in the restive north-eastern state of Yobe.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill three civilians in Bori on the night of 09/05.
Over 5,000 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, embarked on a protest march in Aba, calling for the formation and recognition of a Biafran state.
Protesters under and aegis of the Kogi Youth Forum demonstrate at the Kogi State Assembly over the impeachment of the house speaker.
Women protest in Nkwagu over the detention of the President General of the community. The women "stormed" a government house, but were stopped by police before they could enter. No reported violence.

Military forces foil a Boko Haram suicide bomber in a mosque in Sulaimanti area of the city of Maiduguri. The bomber attempted to enter the building, but was stopped by security forces. Panicked, the bomber detonated, killing only himself and injuring five others.

Military forces, along with those from Cameroon, carry out a two day operation against Boko Haram at Madawaya Forest, killing 58 and capturing a prominent leader. A number of hostages were also rescued in the operation.
Gunmen suspected to be "militants" on 10/05 killed three soldiers at Foropa, Southern Ijaw local government area of Bayelsa State.
Unidentified assailants attack and kill two guards at the Rivers State high court on 10/05.
Aggrieved members of the PDP protest at their state party congress in Illorin over a leadership tussle.

Youths on 11/05 set ablaze the personal residence of Senator Kabiru Gaya and vandalized the poultry farm of House of Representatives member from the area, Abdullahi Mahmoud during a protest against "unfulfilled promises." Police arrested 18.

Military forces, along with those from Cameroon, carry out a two day operation against Boko Haram at Madawaya Forest, killing 58 and capturing a prominent leader. A number of hostages were also rescued in the operation.
Touts and transporters clash over rights to a motor park on 11/05. Police move in, avert bloodshed. Two arrests reported.
A suicide bomber attempts to enter a Maiduguri mosque, detonates, and kills six on 11/05.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) on 12/05 protested over the refusal of Minister of Education to reinstate the 13 vice chancellors sacked by government without recourse to rules and principles governing university system.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber has rocked the busy Musa Usman Secretariat Main Gate in Maiduguri on 12/08, killing seven injuring 18. Among the dead include two police officers.
Military forces arrest a Boko Haram leader, Suleiman Umaru during an operation in Sambisa Forest on 13/05. No violence reported.
Fulani herders attack Tarfi village, Binnev Ward, in Buruku on the evening of 13/05, killing 12.
Hundreds of physically-challenged, orphans and other children catered for by Project Charilove "at the weekend" protested over non-payment of alleged five months arrears. Source dated 16/05.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack in Sambisa forest, kill two and recover weapons. Five soldiers were wounded due to mortar fire.

Military forces carry out a clearance operation at the Gwoza villages of Guduf Buba, Yagwa, Gamude, Kwatara Kasa and Kwatara Tsakiya. No reported violence. Date of the operation(s) on or soon before 14/05.

Military forces carry out a clearance operation at the Gwoza villages of Guduf Buba, Yagwa, Gamude, Kwatara Kasa and Kwatara Tsakiya. No reported violence. Date of the operation(s) on or soon before 14/05.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Two members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign state of Biafra, MASSOB, were reportedly killed by two policemen attached to Okpoko Police Division, Onitsha suburb, Anambra State, while others sustained injuries while a shop was razed. Trouble was said to have started for the MASSOB members when a woman reported a case of assault against one of them, but he allegedly put up a fight when the police tried to arrest him.
A coalition of civil society groups protest in Benin Citys Kingss Square on 16/05 over fuel prices.
Doctors at a teaching hospital protest unpaid salaries.
About 5, 000 youths in Bauchi under the aegis of Bauchi State APC Youths, staged a peaceful rally to support the removal of an oil subsidy.
Workers protest at their companys headquarters on Victoria Island over salary.
Military forces perform a clearance operation against Boko Haram at Alafa in Sambisa Forest, kill 15.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Njakia, no reported violence.

Two policemen were injured when suspected gunmen launched an attack on the Osara Police Station in Adavi local government area of Kogi State. Following the attack the assailants carted away ammunitions. No reported causalities.
Unidentified gunmen, dressed as police, shot and killed a senior officer at close range for unknown reason. A female bystander was also killed in the attack.
Protesting members of the NLC chase non-striking group workers from their offices on 18/05 during a demonstration against fuel prices.

At the Murtala Muhammed Airport, Lagos, members of the Wabba faction of the NLC and civil society organisations blocked the road leading to the local wing of the airport in Lagos at the Ikeja end resulting in traffic jam and leaving air travellers, commuters and motorists stranded. The protest was related to the price of fuel. The National Union of Air Transport Employees (NUATE) also took part in the protest.
Member of the Sokoto State chapter of the NLC protest at the government house over fuel prices.
No fewer than 40 vehicles have been burnt and 15 injured in a clash between Yoruba and Igbo traders in the Mushin area of Lagos. The violence is believed to have been sparked by use of market area.
Unidentified gunmen, on 18/05, invaded Rumukwachi community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State and abducted two residents.

A group of villagers, said to be from Umuago, Urualla, Ideato North local council area of Imo State, have attacked and destroyed part of the proposed Imo European University, IEU, after believing they had not been compensated for the land use fairly.
Members of the NLC force government employees out of their offices on 19/05 to make them join a strike against fuel cost.
Abuja NLC workers, among others, protest at Berger Junction, Abuja in conjunction with a fuel price strike.
Members of the NLC protest in Lagos over fuel prices on 19/05.
Youths from Ibeno local government area protest at an office of a western oil company following a spill in their area.
Members of the NLC protest in Yaba over the cost of fuel.
Police attack an otherwise peaceful fuel price protest along the Abakaliki-Enugu Expressway on 19/05. At least one labour leader was reported injured.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.
A woman was abducted by Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 20/05, then later escaped.
An aid of the governor is shot and killed at his Makurdi home on 20/05. The assailants entered his home while it was unoccupied and waited for his return.
Suspected Fulani gunmen on the night of 20/05 attacked Oke Ako in Ikole Local Government Area of Ekiti State and killed one man.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: RATAWU: Radio and Television Workers Union
NOTES: Workers of RATAWU attempt to forcibly shut down a broadcast station of Radio Bayelsa over non-payment of salaries, but are dispersed by police and well as the Information Commissioner who was present.
Youths in Kwal community of Kanke local government area of Plateau State protested an attempt to remove a transformer from the LGA Secretariat in Kwal and move it elsewhere.
500 pensioners who retired from the service of the Edo State Government on 23/05 took to the streets in protest of 42 months pension arrears.

A Boko Haram chief bomb maker was killed by another member of the sect when he attempted to leave the group on 23/05 in Sambaisa Forest. Formally, the bomb maker was one of the chief bodyguards of Abubakar Shekau. Disputed, the source "Vanguard" reports the bomb maker was killed by a member of the military when he attempted to flee.

Three persons have reportedly lost their lives in the past two days (24/05 and 25/05) following a fight between youths of Shibiri and Etegbin communities in Ojo area of Lagos over collection of levies from tipper drivers transporting dredged sands from waterside.

At least five communities of Ladin Buta (not named) near Khaddamari village of Jere Local Government Area of Borno state have been taken over and destroyed by suspected members of Boko Haram on 24/05. The attackers burned houses, killed 13 residents and injured several others.
Military forces engage a group of unidentified kidnappers in Afam, recover three victims who were abducted earlier in the day. Two of the gunmen dead, four injured.

Three persons have reportedly lost their lives in the past two days (24/05 and 25/05) following a fight between youths of Shibiri and Etegbin communities in Ojo area of Lagos over collection of levies from tipper drivers transporting dredged sands from waterside.
Boko Haram attacked Gurlum Kwalle and Jajeri areas of Adamari on 25/05, killing 11 and destroying houses.
Unidentified attackers abducted two men and a woman from Isiokpo on 25/05 for unknown reason. The victims were later recovered after military forces engaged the attacked in a gun battle.

Members of a group known as NDA destroy a Chevron oil pipeline in Escravos. The group, who claimed responsibility for the blast, said they are fighting for a greater share of oil profits, an end to pollution and independence for the southern region, had told oil firms to leave the Delta before the end of the month.
Traders at Alaba International Market, near Lagos State University, protest over land encroachment by a bank.
Imo State pensioners protest against non-payment of entitlements in Ezinihitte LGA.
Hundreds of traders protest a takeover of their market by the local government and a tax in Oleh.
Military forces ambushed and killed two members of Boko Haram and recovered weapons along Maiduguri-Bulabulin-Damboa road.
Electricity customers protest high prices in Abuja.

Members of NDA destroy an oil pipeline connecting the Bonny terminal and the Brass export terminal with dynamite on 28/05 as a way to protest for a share of the regions oil wealth. The militants are also angry that the government is winding down a 2009 amnesty program that had paid 30,000 militants to guard installations they once attacked.
Military forces intercept and kill "militants" who were attempting to bomb an oil pipeline near Brass. Exact causalities not known.
A PDP leader clashes with members of the National Youth Council at a "Democracy Day" celebration. Injuries unknown.

A commercial tricycle drives over an IED outside of Biu. The blast killed four civilians and a solider. Preliminary investigations show that the IED was buried a long time ago undetected. It exploded when the tricycle erroneously ran over it.
Unidentified gunmen attack Zagabutu on 29/05, killing a prominent leader and two others.

A vigilante mob attacks and kills four in Pandongari over blasphemy allegations against the Prophet Muhammad on 29/05. There was further unrest and destruction of property in the area the following day.

A vigilante mob attacks and kills four in Pandongari over blasphemy allegations against the Prophet Muhammad. There was further unrest and destruction of property in the area on 30/05, the following day.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: MASSOB embarks on a peaceful protest in Calabar.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: A fight broke out between policemen and some people suspected to be members of the Movement for the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) in Asaba. The incident occurred along Anwai Road in the city when MASSOB members were marching to demand for the independence of Biafra. According to police, the MASSOB marchers initiated the clash. Xinhua reports seven MASSOB killed in the fighting.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Members of police clash with protesting members of MASSOB in Onitsha, one police officer injured, one missing. In a conflicting reported, MASSOB claims they were attacked by the police while peaceful, killing fifteen of their members. This Day reports 30 dead.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: MASSOB protesters block roads in Port Harcourt on 30/05, police arrest 13.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Police encounter and stop a pro-Biafran MASSOB protest in Aba. No arrests reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: A clergyman and 320 others were arrested as they were beginning a pro-Biafra protest in Abakaliki.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Police arrest 13 members of MASSOB in Enugu following an "unlawful protest" in aim to establish a Biafran State and celebrated the 49th anniversary of its declaration.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: Seventeen protesting members of MASSOB are arrested following the use of tear-gas from police in Owerri. No reported violence from the protesters.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: A man was shot and 19 were arrested by police during a peaceful protest for the MASSOB 49th anniversary in Umuahia. The extent of the gunshot victims injuries are not known.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
NOTES: MASSOB holds a short protest in Ikom on 30/05 in honour of the 49th anniversary of the movement. The protest was shortened due to a counter protest by a group of youths.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill three in Agasha.
Fulanis attack the Tiv communities of Tseaondo and Tseantyo on 30/05 of Ukum LGA, killing 10.
Fulanis attack the Tiv communities of Tseaondo and Tseantyo on 30/05 of Ukum LGA, killing 10.
Workers of the Federal Ministry of Health forcibly shut down the ministry on 31/05, blocking the entrance, accusing the secretary of "high-handedness" and corruption.

Three persons, including a two-year-old girl, were killed when unknown gunmen suspected to be Tarok and Jukun ethnic militias attacked Isini Village in Sarkin Kudu District of Ibbi local government area of Taraba State on 31/05.
The Niger Delta Avengers blew up two oil wells located in Warri South West LGA of Delta State belonging to Chevron Nigeria Limited. The group claimed responsibility through their Twitter account.
The staff of the National Economic Reconstruction Fund (NERFUND) protested over management labour practices in Abuja.
Nkpor market traders protest higher tax rates at the government secretariat in Ogidi.
Military forces kill five Boko Haram, make one arrest and rescue 248 hostages during clearance operations in Jere and Konduga LGAs, dates not known - announcement from military made on 01/06.
Military forces kill five Boko Haram, make one arrest and rescue 248 hostages during clearance operations in Jere and Konduga LGAs, dates not known - announcement from military made on 01/06.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.
77 members of Boko Haram surrendered to troops of the 122 task force battalion on Operation Lafiya Dole in Borno State. Location of event not reported.

NDA on 01/06 evening attacked a military houseboat and allegedly killed two soldiers at Efe-Ugbokodo area in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta State. Agence France presses reported six dead, including civilians.

NLC protesters disrupt a meeting where leaders were discussing the privatization of area schools. Many of the protesters overturned chairs, and assaulted the Secretary to the State Government, Alhaji Ismail Olalekan-Alli and beat him with sticks, resulting in injury.
Members of the NDA blow up two oil pipelines in Bayela State on 02/06, location not known.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.

A woman trader, who was alleged to have blasphemed Prophet Mohammed, has been mobbed to death by youths in Kano on 02/06. The victim was accused of blasphemy during a religious argument at Wambai market.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Troops of 112 Battalion on patrol from Mafa to Dikwa were ambushed at Ajiri village by Boko Haram. One soldier died in the process, an officer and 3 soldiers sustained various degrees of injury. One of the civilian JTF accompanying the patrol team was also injured.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military forces, along with the Civilian JTF, launch a Friday attack on the Boko Haram camp of Chukungudu in Borno State. Nineteen Boko Haram dead, including a commander, as well as two soldiers injured.
Two dead and eleven injured in tit-for-tat attacks between militia of Ogbe-Ijoh and Aladja communities.
Two dead and eleven injured in tit-for-tat attacks between militia of Ogbe-Ijoh and Aladja communities.
A prominent businessman survives an attempt on his life in Abuja.
Kidnappers abduct the commissioner for women affairs in Benue State at Makurdi town.
Gunmen on the evening of 06/06 killed the youth leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC) on 06/06 at the Ikpoba-hill area of Benin City, circumstances not known.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NLC: Nigeria Labour Congress; NUT: Nigeria Union of Teachers
NOTES: Members of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) and the Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT) protest a plan of the state government to involve individuals, old students association and missionaries in the running of public secondary schools. The protesters caused property damage and caused the closure of schools.
Youths, both Christian and Muslim, protest at the National Assembly over a proposed constitutional amendment concerning Sharia Law, which they called "Islamization."

Suspected Boko Haram attacked and wounded three security operatives in Kanamma, the headquarters of Yunusari Local Government Area of Yobe State. A resident who fled to neighbouring Niger Republic told the source that on 07/06 that the attackers stormed the town on four motorcycles, each carrying three armed men.
Muslim youths attack and severely injure a Christian man for not observing the Ramadan fast in Kakuri.
NDA destroys a oil pipeline in Warri North LGA with explosives on 07/06.

Hundreds of rights activists as well as miners from across Lagos State gathered in Agege to protest the stop work order given by the Lagos State Governor, Mr Akinwunmi Ambode, describing it as illegal.

Unidentified gunmen, either members of a cult group or Fulanis, attacked University of Agriculture Makurdi killing seven students on 08/06. In response to the attack several students protested, though security operatives quickly dispersed the group without reported incident.
The acting Registrar, Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN) was killed by gunmen on the morning of 08/06 in Abuja. The source noted limited details.

Unidentified gunmen, either members of a cult group or Fulanis, attacked University of Agriculture Makurdi killing seven students on 08/06. In response to the attack several students protested, though security operatives quickly dispersed the group without reported incident.
Striking workers block the entrance to the government house in Akure on 09/06 over non-payment of salaries.

Suspected pipeline vandals attack Ibafo on 09/06, killing four. It is believed the attackers were trying to abduct an area leader, but upon learning of his absence became frustrated and killed the four.
NDA destroys a oil pipeline in Brass LGA with explosives on 10/06.
Students of Federal College of Education (Technical) (FCE) (T), Gombe is forced closed following a violent student protest over a water shortage.

Military forces clear several areas of Bama District, killing "scores" of Boko Haram, freeing eight captives. The villages were Kircha Goniye, Wujjah Alkelu, Kita Jiddum, Jameri, Geri Gana, Gere Kura and Jabe.

Military forces clear several areas of Bama District, killing "scores" of Boko Haram, freeing eight captives. The villages were Kircha Goniye, Wujjah Alkelu, Kita Jiddum, Jameri, Geri Gana, Gere Kura and Jabe.
Boko Haram attacks Mairari during the late hours of 10/06, killing four, taking them from their homes and slitting their throats.
Military forces kill 10 Boko Haram during a clearing operation in the Gamboru/Ngala areas of Chukungudu and Hausari on 11/06.
Military forces repel an attack by Boko Haram at Pulka, six Boko Haram fatalities.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a judge and kill his police orderly as they travelled near Lokoja on 12/06.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.
Students of the University of Nigeria Enugu Campus (UNEC) protested on 13/06 against acute water scarcity and over three months of power failure around the campus.
Youths in Jos took to the street near the government house to protest the donation of lands for the creation of grazing reserves in the state.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.

Several workers who worked in the security department of Total E&P Nigeria Limited protested the non-payment of their severance packages by the company in Lagos.

Suspended Immigration personnel protest in Abuja over pensions issues.
Two Boko Haram are killed, three soldiers and 13 civilians wounded in an ambush near Gwoza.
Military forces rescue 14 Boko Haram hostages in Chingowa village near Dikwa area on or before 14/06. No reported violence.
Troops of 114 Task Force Battalion of 28 Task Force Brigade on patrol of road linking Izge and Bitta rescued 43 Boko Haram hostages at Madube on or before 14/06.

Boko Haram attacks Kutuva village, Damboa LGA on 14/06, killing 4 and abducting 4 others. Soonafter, a local vigilante group gave chase. Though the attackers were able to escape the militia recovered armament and vehicles.
Thousands of market women and youth groups on 15/06 took to the streets of Calabar to push for a highway project.

Workers in the Oyo State Public Service in Ibadan held a rally to protest against their unpaid six months salaries and governments controversial proposal to handover the management of some schools to private bodies.
Christian groups protest a court ruling that would allow the hijab to be worn in state schools.

Hundreds of Students of Tai Solarin College of Education, Omu-Ijebu of Ogun State, on 15/06 embarked on a protest on behalf of their lecturers who they said had been denied their salaries for 13 months.
Pensioners protest non-payment of arrears by the state government.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence, with the exception of Bembem, where the troops had a short encounter with Boko Haram.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

NDA destroys an oil pipeline in Oruk Anam LGA, Akwa Ibom State on 16/06 and later claims credit via Twitter.

Aggrieved youths in their hundreds blocked the Yakowa expressway in Kaduna and matched through other neighbouring communities to protest against the frequent outage and alleged extortion by officials of Kaduna Electricity Distribution Company (KEDCO).
Military forces arrest the Boko Haram commander Ibrahim Jagwal at Gishiwa Dabua area of Potiskum, Yobe State.
Boko Haram have reportedly killed 24 persons in Kuda-Kaya village of Madagali local Government Area of Adamawa State during the evening hours.
A person was severely injured when supporters of the two chairmen of the party clashed at the national secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Abuja.
Unidentified gunmen attack Imushin during the late night hours, killing fifteen. The killings were described as "indiscriminate."
Gunmen on 17/06 invaded Imagbon, Elepete, Kajola, Glorious land and Ereko communities in Shagamu area killing 10 residents, injuring others and destroying several properties.
Suspected Fulani herdsmen on 17/06 invaded Ilewo-Orile community in Ogun State, killing three persons.
Staff of the Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company are attacked by community youths displeased with service.
Military forces clear Bulagana and Gambori of Boko Haram on 18/06. Four reported Boko Haram dead.
Military forces clear Bulagana and Gambori of Boko Haram on 18/06. Four reported Boko Haram dead.
Two are killed during a Boko Haram raid on Wumbi village on 18/06.

Police and students clash in Owo when students protest at a police station after the students accused the police of hitting a fellow student with an automobile and simply leaving. Three students reported shot and injured.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military forces in conjunction with members of Civilian-JTF vigilante group carried out a operations along Bitta-Damboa and Dikwa-Marte axis, leaving seven Boko Haram dead and others captured. Five soldiers wounded.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military forces in conjunction with members of Civilian-JTF vigilante group carried out a operations along Bitta-Damboa and Dikwa-Marte axis, leaving seven Boko Haram dead and others captured. Five soldiers wounded.
Fulanis attack Dusa of Turan in Logo Local Government Area of Benue state, killing 20 residents while they slept.

Activities were grounded at the headquarters of the Federal Ministry of Finance, Abuja, for several hours as its staff demonstrated against their unpaid allowances put at about N1.2 billion. The protest lasted over two days.
Nigerian Air Force jets bomb an Boko Haram convoy in Doron Naira, fifteen dead.
In what was described as a [economic] reprisal, a group of gunmen invaded two communities - Elegbete and Igbolomu - in Ikorodu area of Lagos from waterfronts, allegedly killing at least 20 residents.
In what was described as a [economic] reprisal, a group of gunmen invaded two communities - Elegbete and Igbolomu - in Ikorodu area of Lagos from waterfronts, allegedly killing at least 20 residents.
Fulanis attack the villages of Uzaar in Tombo, Anyii in Logo local government on 20/06 and Vase in Ukum local government on 21/06, killing 26.

A group of 30 "militants" attack a convoy of foreign workers, killing one and kidnapping three.
Gunmen suspected to be "members militants" were said to have invaded Igbolomu and Ishawo areas in Ikorodu Local Government Area of Lagos State and began shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.
Gunmen suspected to be "members militants" were said to have invaded Igbolomu and Ishawo areas in Ikorodu Local Government Area of Lagos State and began shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.

Members of the Ijaw Youth Council invade a radio station in an effort to interrupt a live broadcast over a disagreement over organizational leadership. The attackers stole items at the station and assaulted employees.

Workers unions at the Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta have paralysed activities at the institution, following series of protest embarked upon by aggrieved workers over poor working condition which they alleged the management has subjected them to.
Groups protest in Ado-Ekiti to demand the governor to resign over "his failure to live up to expectation."
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram position at Gamboru-Ngala on 24/06, killing ten.
"Pipeline vandals" attack Igbo Olomu, Ogijo killing 60. The attackers targeted "landlords and local vigilante men in the community, killing them with members of their families."

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NAPPS: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools
NOTES: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools, Ogun chapter staged a protest over alleged multiple taxation.
At least eight people are feared dead following a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers in Koh village.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.

Troops of the 192 Battalion, 26 Task Force Brigade and some vigilantes on fighting patrol along Kusarha-Zalidava general area encountered some elements of Boko Haram around Zalidava-Weige villages. During the encounter, two Boko Haram militants were killed while troops recovered 1 General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) and a belt of 7.62mm (NATO) ammunition containing 42 rounds.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Troops of the 7 Division Garrison Rapid Deployment Force (RDF) II, in conjunction with some mobile policemen and the Civilian JTF also conducted clearance operations at Masu Yiwa, Ladin Buta, Bazaka, Kesa Gala, Tabla, Fahinde, Shirori, Gizina, Maska Aribe, Maska and Maska Lawanti villages, all in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. During the operations, the troops encountered Boko Haram members at Maska Lawanti where they killed two and recovered two motorcycles.

NOTES: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.

NOTES: Troops of the 7 Division Garrison Rapid Deployment Force (RDF) II, in conjunction with some mobile policemen and the Civilian JTF also conducted clearance operations at Masu Yiwa, Ladin Buta, Bazaka, Kesa Gala, Tabla, Fahinde, Shirori, Gizina, Maska Aribe, Maska and Maska Lawanti villages, all in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. During the operations, the troops encountered Boko Haram members at Maska Lawanti where they killed two of them and recovered two motorcycles.
Unknown gunmen attack the convoy of the deputy governor in Obafemi-Owode LGA. Security force escort returned fire, casualties not known.
Gunmen killed three people and injured two others belonging to a vigilante group in Okpoga.
Anti-Buhari/pro-Ayodele Fayose protest by students in Ado-Ekiti.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate at a mosque, killing only themselves and injuring others.
Unidentified gunmen on 27/06 attacked Gurguzu village of Igabi Local Government Area of Kaduna State, leaving four dead and several others injured after the attack.
A police officer errantly shot a motorcyclist. The killing sparked a demonstration, with the people of the area pouncing on the policeman that shot the man, beating him to a coma.
Air forces launch attacks at a Boko Haram location near Kangarwa, killing 15.

For several hours, a major artery of Lagos State, the entire stretch of Ikorodu Road at Maryland was completely blocked as street hawkers went berserk destroying vehicles and smashing BRT buses in protest of the death of a colleague.

Lawmakers (PDP) of state House of Assembly held a plenary session in the middle of highway in protest against the freezing of the account of Governor Ayodele Fayose at the Zenith by the Economic and Financial Crime Commission (EFCC). It is not clear if traffic was halted during the demonstrations.

Protest against the removal of the governor on 29/06. A Federal High Court, sitting in Abuja, had removed the governor on Monday on the ground that he failed to satisfy the tax requirements as a candidate.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Ngoshe and Guva, killing "several" and rescuing 16 of their hostages.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Ngoshe and Guva, killing "several" and rescuing 16 of their hostages.
Military forces encounter Boko Haram at Gudumbali were they killed two and wounded one.

Scores of residents of Ibeju-Lekki area of Lagos State staged a peaceful protest to the state House of Assembly over the alleged imposition and appointment of Baale (local chief) on the community by the Onibeju of Ibeju Lekki.

A lawmaker representing Oorelope constituency in the Oyo State House of Assembly, Hon. Gideon Aremu, was shot dead by yet-to-be-identified gunmen at Alakia, in the Egbeda Local Government Area of Oyo State on Friday evening.
Unknown gunmen on 01/07 kidnapped Sierra-Leonean Ambassador to Nigeria, Maj-Gen. Nelson Williams (Rtd) along Abuja-Kaduna Express way while en route to Jaji, Kaduna.
The NDA bombs five oil pipelines in Abiteye.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: BYMGG: Benue Youth Movement for Good Governance
NOTES: The Benue Youth Movement for Good Governance (BYMGG) in Abuja protested against the handling of a corruption case against the former governor of Benue State.
Nigerian Army troops on Operation Gama Aiki ambushed and killed four Boko Haram militants in Kukawa, Borno State.
A robbery suspect is set ablaze is Emede by a vigilante mob.
The NDA bombs a pipeline in Batan community in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State.
Ex-militants block roads in Benin City over non-payment of arrears.

Thousands of road users plying the East-West road were stranded for hours as hundreds of ex-militants from Bayelsa and Delta States disrupted traffic for hours along the Mbiama-Yenagoa section of the road. The ex-militants were protesting unpaid salaries.

The patrol team of 157 Task Force Battalion of the Nigerian Army on 04/07 ambushed and killed a Boko Haram spy at Barwati village in Kukawa local government area of Borno State. The subject was shot while attempting to enter a secure area.

Nigerian Army foiled an attempt by three female suicide bombers to attack Internally Displaced Persons, IDPs, in Monguno. Two of the suicide bombers were shot while the third blew herself up when pursued by soldiers.
An expatriate of unknown origin is kidnapped in Epe.
Hundreds of youths in Rivers State staged a peaceful protest along Port Harcourt streets against attacks on oil facilities in the Niger Delta region.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.

A melee between two "cult groups" causes two dead and twenty injured in Ondo town.
Military and police clash in a market in Abeokuta while pursuing "fraudulent customers." Two injuries.

Suspected NDA abduct an immigration official in Ikorodu.
A middle-aged robbery suspect was on Wednesday set ablaze by angry mob at Isoko quarters (Warri city) in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta.
APC holds an anti-Governor Ayodele Fayose protest on 7/7.
Police stop an attack by "militants" on Igando shortly after they began opening fire. Two fled, two were captured.
Three people were killed in a communal clash between two communities (Okpoga and Edumoga) in Okpokpwu local government area of Benue State.

A reprisal attack between Fulanis and farmers have left four people dead and many others injured in Barakuta village in Bosso local government of Niger state. Many houses, four cars and 17 motorcycles were burnt during the attack. Investigation revealed that the crises began last Thursday when Fulanis killed a Gwari man who prevented them from raping a girl during the sallah celebration. In a revenge attack, the Gwaris gathered together and killed some Fulanis which led to the reprisal attack on the villagers.

A reprisal attack between Fulanis and farmers have left four people dead and many others injured in Barakuta village in Bosso local government of Niger state. Many houses, four cars and 17 motorcycles were burnt during the attack. Investigation revealed that the crises began last Thursday when Fulanis killed a Gwari man who prevented them from raping a girl during the sallah celebration. In a revenge attack, the Gwaris gathered together and killed some Fulanis which led to the reprisal attack on the villagers.

Governor Ayodele Fayose supporters block streets in protest of against the freezing of his accounts with Zenith Bank by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission. The rally was apparently in reaction to the All Progressives Congress (APC) led anti-Fayose protest held on Thursday.

Boko Haram attacked Rann village over two days killing 2 soldiers and 7 civilians. In response, military forces killed 16 Boko Haram. [The source] said two soldiers were killed when a suicide bomber drove into a truck and exploded. The remaining attackers carted away food and supplies.

ACTOR1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Six high profile members of Boko Haram are arrested by JTF in Festac town, Lagos.
Boko Haram attacked Gaskeri village near Dalori, killing three unidentified vigilantes. They also looted foodstuffs and livestock.
Eight people including two Boko Haram suicide bombers have been killed in a bomb attack in a mosque in Bornos southern town of Damboa.
Students of the Alvan Ikoku Federal College of Education, Owerri, took to the streets to protest the planned demolition of a flyover by the Imo State government.

Boko Haram attacked Rann village over two days killing 2 soldiers and 7 civilians. In response, military forces killed 16 Boko Haram. [The source] said two soldiers were killed when a suicide bomber drove into a truck and exploded. The remaining attackers carted away food and supplies.
"Herders" attack farmers in Logo LGA over two days killing five, two the first day, three the second.
Fulanis attack farmers in Ukum LGA over the weekend killing five.
Fulanis attack farmers in Logo LGA over two days killing five, two the first day, three the second.
NDA bombs Exxons Qua Iboe oil Terminal causing it to close.

The various industrial unions in Ekiti State University, Ado Ekiti (EKSU) paralysed activities in the school to protest over salary. The aggrieved staff prevented vehicular and human movement in and out of the institution as they locked its two gates.

Clearing and forwarding agents on the platform of Association of Nigeria Licensed Customs Agents, ANLCA gathered at Nigeria Customs Service PTML Area Command Office at Mile 2, protesting a change in exchange rate making it impossible for them to serve their customers and still make profit.
Government pensioners protest over salaries in Uyo.

An attempt to bomb an oil well head in Gelegele community in Ovia North East local government area of Edo State was foiled by police on Monday. Two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) planted near the oil well head were detonated by police in a controlled manner. No injury reported.
Four people have been killed in a clash between the Fulanis and Gbagyis in the Lambata Buko town in Paikoro local government area of Niger State.
A land dispute between the towns of Kufai and Kulishi cause one death over two days.
Three are killed by unidentified land grabbers in Agbowa on 11/07.

Fulanis kill 81 (accounting for those Ukum and Logo over this past weekend) over the "past two weeks" - source dated 11/07 - in at least 10 local government areas Benue state. The conflict arose over grazing rights.

Suspected "militants" have blown up Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, NNPC, pipelines at Ogijo in Sagamu Local Government Area of Ogun State, sending residents of the community scampering for safety after a loud explosion. The perpetrators were disguised as maintaince workers.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANNM: National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives
NOTES: The National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives (NANNM) University of Benin Teaching Hospital chapter protested the kidnap of their colleague.
Different groups in Nasarawa State protested against the indefinite strike action by the workers across the state and urged the workers unions to recall members to work.

The Nigerian Army said troops of the 119 Task Force Battalion stationed in Kangarwa, Borno State, repelled an attack by Boko Haram, killing 25. One soldier died in the battle (some sources claim 3) and 11 were wounded. The battle lasted three hours.
A land dispute between the towns of Kufai and Kulishi cause one death over two days.

Protests in Aba, Abia state, as tricycle riders blocked the Aba- Ikot Ekpene road protesting alleged extortion by the Police in the city. The protest which took off from Opobo junction saw some of the riders using their tricycles to block the Ovom street junction and waterside areas.
The students of the Kogi State University protest over a three-month closure of their school due to a strike. The protest lasted for two days.
Protest against a decision to move a local market. The protest continued into the next day.

Hundreds of aggrieved women from Gbaramatu Kingdom in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State protested the arrest and continued detention of 10 of their youths by the military for their alleged involvement in the bombings of oil facilities by the Niger Delta Avengers (NDA).
Fulani herdsmen attack Tambor Jumor in Girei LGA on 13/07, killing six.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Students led by National Association of Nigeria Students, NANS, shut Lokoja, Kogi State capital, protesting the industrial action by lecturers of the State University since May. The protesters blocked vehicular traffic. The protest began the previous day.

Owerri women trooped out in their hundreds to protest the decision of the state government to relocate the Ekeukwu Owerri Market. The women, who were all clad in traditional mourning clothes had, as early as 8:00a.m assembled at Ekeukwu Owerri, along Douglas Road, from where they marched to Okigwe Road and sang solidarity songs. The protest began the previous day.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram near Gonuri. Surprised by the attack, the Boko Haram fighters abandoned their weapons and vehicles and fled. One reported injury.
An official of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) was attacked by a mob in Mararaba after they mistakenly believe he harmed a motorist.

A group of Muslim youths on Friday attacked St. Philips Catholic Parish, Baki Iku, close to Zuma Rock in Niger State. According to eyewitnesses, some Catholics had gone to the church to pray when they were attacked by the Muslim group who claimed that Friday was their day of prayer and that the church only had right to worship on Sundays. The youths were said to have destroyed the churchs property, including doors and the windows. Some soldiers managed to get there later, but not before harm had been done to the building.

Protesters stormed the palace of Oluwo of Iwo, Oba Abdulrsaheed Adewale-Akanbi with a coffin after it is believed an alleged "unqualified" person is set to fill a vacant position of Aro of Iwo land. Police dispersed the group.
Gunmen abduct a monarch, kill his guard and wound his wife in Ojo.
In a Boko Haram clearance operation, a patrol team of 157 Task Force Battalion, 7 Brigade, ambushed and killed a Boko Haram spy at Barwati village, Kukawa Local Government Area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Security forces, including the Civilian JTF, intercept and disarm a suicide bomber in Sabon Gari.
Three suspected kidnappers were killed in an exchange of fire with a vigilante group at lallami village in Bali local government area of Taraba state Sunday night.
NDA on Monday blasted an oil pipeline belonging to the Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) in Batan community in Warri South West Local Government area of Delta State.

Scores of women under the aegis of Concern Group on Monday stormed the office of the Lagos State Governor, Mr Akinwumi Ambode, to protest the verbal attack on the Senator representing Lagos Central at the upper legislative chamber.
Dock workers protest in the Marina, Lagos area.

Military forces on Monday killed 7 Boko Haram and rescued 22 hostages including women and children while clearing Warpaya, Zenteleye, Mubarka, Jadawa and Yerwa villages. During the operations, they encountered and engaged elements of Boko Haram militants in Jadawa and Yerwa.

Military forces on Monday killed 7 Boko Haram and rescued 22 hostages including women and children while clearing Warpaya, Zenteleye, Mubarka, Jadawa and Yerwa villages. During the operations, they encountered and engaged elements of Boko Haram militants in Jadawa and Yerwa.

Troops of 114 Task Force Battalion of 28 Task Force Brigade carried out an exercise at suspected Boko Haram militant hideouts at Mbale and Madube on Monday. During the operation, the troops killed 5 Boko Haram, while some of them were believed to escape with gunshot wounds.
Suspected Fulani gunmen attack and kill a traditional ruler in Bokkos LGA.
Youth in Bokkos Local Government Area of Plateau State on 19/07 barricaded roads and took to the streets in violent response to the killing of a traditional ruler the previous day.

The Alvan Ikoku College of Education, Owerri, has been closed down indefinitely following a rampage by students that resulted to the destruction of properties worth millions of naira. The students carried out a violent protest within and outside the campuses against the hike in school fees and poor electricity supply to the campus.
The residents of Utako village, Abuja, have protested against a week-long power outage in the area.
Protest in Port Harcourt over forced eviction.

Rivers State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) led hundreds of protesters who temporarily took over the complexes of the state High Court complex and House of Assembly complex, Port Harcourt after two elected APC members were not sworn-in as scheduled.

Nigerias military says it has rescued 80 children and women held captive by the Boko Haram extremist group in Gangere, Kukawa. An army spokesman says they were freed Tuesday by troops who attacked a gathering of the [Boko Haram] at Gangere village in Borno state. He says 42 Boko Haram were killed and troops released 42 children and 38 women.

Monarch of Oluasiri community, Ibedaowei of Oluasiri clan in Nembe Local Government area of Bayelsa State, was attacked by five armed men armed with machetes. The monarch was left to die but recovered in hospital.

Protesters, numbering about 50, stormed the National Assembly, protesting the utterances of Senator Dino Melaye (APC, Kogi West ), against Senator Oluremi Tinubu. It was alleged that Melaye had threatened to [assault] Senator Tinubu.
Students of the state owned Niger Delta University, NDU, protested against the prolonged strike by the varsity chapter of Academic Staff Union of Universities.
Several soldiers are missing and other wounded following an ambush at Guro Gongon village on 20/07. Several of the missing soldiers were found in the following days.

Hundreds of workers at the Abuja Urban Mass Transport Company (AUMTCO), under the Amalgamated Union of Public Corporations, Civil Service Technical and Recreational Services Employees (AUPCTRE) locked the entrance to the company located along Kubwa road over pay.
A police officer shoots and kills a commercial motorcyclist, possibly over extortion. Following the killing, a mob of vigilantes attacked and killed the police officer with stones.

Four protesters were on 21/07 shot dead and three others severely injured by security operatives in Bokkos Local Government Area of Plateau State, as the operatives battled angry protesters to rescue Ardo (Fulani leader) of the area from being lynched. The violence is a response to the killing a tradition ruler by suspected Fulanis earlier in the week.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: 19 soldiers and 3 civilian JTF members were wounded in action while a few others were missing in action during a Boko Haram ambush is Nguro Gongon.
A police officer shoots and kills a commercial motorcyclist, possibly over extortion. Following the killing, a mob of vigilantes attacked and killed the police officer with stones.

NINE persons on 21/07 sustained various degrees of injury following an invasion by gunmen who invaded the legislative chambers of the Ughelli South local government council during a legislative session by the lawmakers.

Suspected arsonists in the early hours of razed down the office of the Independent National Electoral commission, INEC, in Bori, headquarters of Khana local government area. This development is ahead of the July 30 rescheduled rerun elections in eight local government areas in the state.
Oil militants (NDA) say they have blown up a gas pipeline in Nigerias southeastern Akwa Ibom state, but police blamed the explosion on a technical failure.

The Nigerian Army says troops on Operation Lafiya Dole ambushed Boko Haram militants around Musafanari (Sambisa Forest) in Borno State. The ambush party killed two Boko Haram while two soldiers sustained gunshot wounds.

Traders protested in the streets of Lessel in Ushongo local government area of Benue State to protest high and multiple taxation thrust on their businesses by government agencies. The protesters reportedly blocked roads.
Pensioners in Edo State protested over the non-payment of their monthly pension spanning between 10 and 42 months in Benin.

Learning and other educational activities were on disrupted at the St Francis Caring Heart Mega School, Owaluwa in Owo local government area of Ondo State following a peaceful protest staged by non-teaching staff of the school over non-payment of their 13 months salaries.
Military forces gain control of Karetu on 25/07. No specific reports of violence.
Between 10 and 14 persons were feared killed in Gaambe-Tiev in Logo Local Council of Benue State by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Several others were reported missing and many others left with injury.
A suspected Boko Haram member escaped death in the Mile Two (Oke Afa) area of Lagos State as he was almost lynched by a vigilante mob.

Heavy gunshots between unidentified displaced pipeline vandals and some security operatives (military/police) at the Igando Community. The displaced vandals had stormed the Obadore, Ewedogbon, Akesan Fatoki, and Egan communities of Igando, and left six persons injured over two days. The attackers were repelled the first day, but returned the second.

Some officials of the Nigeria Customs Service, Federal Operations Unit shot and killed three residents in Ikeja. Shooting sporadically, the three were shot out of apparent anger after "hoodlums" resisted arrest.

Members of NDA attack Ewedogbon area of Totowu, a riverine community in Ishuti, Igando, old Alimosho Local Government Area. Multiple sources said many people were killed as the militants entered into peoples houses to "torment" them.
Various civil society groups on 27/07 protested alleged illegal recruitment and nepotism in some government agencies in Abuja.

Hundreds of placard-carrying people from Oraukwu community in Idemili South Local Government Area of Anambra State stormed the Government House, Awka, protesting the alleged imposition of one Emeka Onuorah as the traditional ruler of the town.
Residents of Ibeshe protest against the ongoing harassment of an individual known as "Badoo."
Residents of Gbagyi Villa community in Kaduna protest the planned demolition of houses.
Protest in Lagos over proposed water company privatization.
Indigenes of Oghara in Delta State protest against alleged forceful and illegal acquisition of their land by Nigerian Navy Logistic Command in their state.

One student of Nasarawa State Polytechnic Lafia was shot dead and another injured in a clash between the students and the Nigeria Police in Police attempt to disperse the students who were protesting the death of a mate who was knocked down by a passing vehicle.

Heavy gunshots between unidentified displaced pipeline vandals and some security operatives (military/police) at the Igando Community. The displaced vandals had stormed the Obadore, Ewedogbon, Akesan Fatoki, and Egan communities of Igando, and left six persons injured over two days. The attackers were repelled the first day, but returned the second.
Police shoot and kill a trader for unknown reason in Kano.
Members of some Non-Governmental Organisations, NGOs and petty traders stormed the Lagos State House of Assembly, protesting against the state governments ban on street trading in the state.
Boko Haram attacks a military-escorted humanitarian convoy wounding three civilians including a U.N. worker and two soldiers.
Military forces "may" have clashed with NDA vandals in "Arepo and other coastal communities in Ogun State." Causalities not known.
Small skirmish over control of a market following a court decision. Police intervened before the clash became "bloody."
Igbo youths in Kano staged a protest over the murder of a trader at the hands of police. The man was killed on 27/07.
Troops on blocking position in Pulka yesterday Friday 29th July 2016, ambushed and killed 2 fleeing Boko Haram fighters. It is equally believed one of the militants escaped with gun shot wounds.
Police open fire on a group of protesting NLC workers, killing two and injuring others.
3,000 are displaced and property destroyed following a communal conflict among farmers fighting or land in the Busi areas. The clash occurred "over the weekend."

King Iyerite Chiefson Awululu, the paramount ruler of Oluasiri community in Nembe Local Government Area in Bayelsa State, narrowly escaped death on Sunday July 31st after he was attacked by armed men who invaded his residence, cut him mercilessly with machete and left him for dead.
Fulanis attack Kodomun community, Demsa Local Government Area, killing between 20 and 30. The attacks lasted over two days.
Military forces thwart a Boko Haram attack on the village of Yauri, outside of Maiduguri. Five Boko Haram reported dead.
Fulanis attack Kodomun community, Demsa Local Government Area, killing between 20 and 30. The attacks lasted over two days.
Eleven are killed during a series of Fulani attacks around Godogodo.

Some youths in Ogoni land in Khana local government area in Rivers state are currently staging a protest against plans by the state government to dredge the river in their community.
