According to the youths, the river is their only source of water. They allege that the state government has not done Environmental Impact Assessment.
A group of woman protest insecurity in Ninte village.
The Nigerian Army arrested a high profile suspected Boko Haram member, Mohammed Zauro, at Sabon Gari, Damboa.
Five persons were killed Tuesday in what is believed to be the latest outbreak of violence between Share and Tsaragi communities in Ifelodun local government area of Kwara state.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
NOTES: The National Union of Local Government Employees (NULGE) grounded business activities in Benin, as they protested the non-payment of their salary.
Shiites protest for the release of Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky in Kaduna.
Igbos continue their protest following the murder of a trader in Kano.
Pensioners protest non-payment of pensions at a government house in Makurdi.
Enugu Women, under the auspices of Women Aid Collective, protested the delay in signing into law the Gender Equality Bill before the state assembly.

Five are dead in a suspected case of mistaken identity as military forces clash with a local militia of Kpaidma, each believe they were herdsmen attackers. Update: Numbers were updated later the following week recording the death of 11 soldiers and seven civilians.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada). The two were later rescued.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada).
Kidnappers abduct a lawmakers father while he travelled between Okpoama to Egweama in Bayelsa State.

Scores of persons from a leprosy advocate group took over Emmanuel Uduaghan way (SUMMIT) in Asaba Delta State in protest of the backlog of their stipends and reduction in their daily meals by the state government.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.
Suspected NDA militants attacked a group of soldiers, killing three in Nembe LGA. The attackers carted away armaments.
Five persons have been declared missing and a woman is shot and killed after Enwhe and Igbide communities of Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta state clashed over a disputed plot of land.

A mob attacked the palace of the Oluwo of Iwo and attempted to set it ablaze after a suspected kidnapper was taken to be housed in the building. Earlier, the mob had attempted to lynch the suspect before a group of civilians took him to the palace.
Boko Haram establishes a base in Bauchi Forest, Burra area.
Participants of a town hall meeting protest food shortage in their area.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: Members of NDGJM blow up a pipeline in the Delta region.
Electrical workers protest over alleged anti-labour practices.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
After a police officer and a meat seller are shot during an argument, a group gathers to protest the violence.
Ex-pat Turkish citizens protest in Abuja against their countrys coup attempt, calling for support of President Erdogan.
Military forces capture two prominent members of NDA in Warri.
Unknown gun men said to be numbering about four have killed a lecturer with the University of Mkar. It is speculated the attack is politically motivated.
Abia State health workers have locked the gate leading into their premises to protest the non payment of their six months salaries by the state government.
No fewer than seven persons were feared dead in Akokwa community in Ideato North council of Imo State, following a bloody clash between the Hausa/Fulani community and the indigenes of Akokwa.
Military forces rescue 88 hostages, kill three members of Boko Haramk in Bama LGA.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Kangarwa on 14/08. 16 Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AWUMMA: Association of Wuye Ultra-Modern Market Allottees
NOTES: Traders, under the aegis of the Association of Wuye Ultra-Modern Market Allottees (AWUMMA), protested in Abuja over what they termed as harassment by policemen.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NARD: National Association of Resident Doctors
NOTES: The National Association of Resident Doctors (NARD), Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital (ABUTH) chapter, staged a peaceful demonstration over uncleanliness.
8000 Boko Haram members of Boko Haram surrender to military forces at a camp in Gombe State. Date(s) not known.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Government of Nigeria (2015-); Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
NOTES: Boko Haram attacks a UN convoy escorting immigration officials at Gwajibo village in Dikwa Local Government. Some militants were killed as well as civilians and 3 Immigration officials were also wounded. Deaths reported in the headline as scores.
Boko Haram killed five traders in an ambush on a highway near Gamboru, on the border with Cameroon. The immigration officers were injured in the ambush.

Some of the 2000 candidates recruited and trained in 2014 by the Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) staging a peaceful protest to demand for their reinstatement, at the entrance of the Secretary to the Government of the Federations office in Abuja on Tuesday (16/8/16). The reason for their dismissal is not known.
Ondo State APC members protest an alleged imposition of a governorship candidate by a national leader of the party.

Policemen believed to be attached to the Police Mobile Force, PMF 55 Squadron, Aba, have clashed with residents of Unity Garden Estate, Osisioma Ngwa council, Abia State, over who has the right to occupy the estate. Injuries not known.
The over 200 farmers marched to the Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni Local Government Council headquarters to register their complaints on the destruction of their farm crops by suspected herdsmen.
Students go on a violent demonstration, blocking roads and attacking police over insecurity in their area. The protest lasted two days.
Workers of a petroleum refinery shut their facility down and block its entrance over non-payment of their salaries.
NDA destroys a pipeline in Delta state on 19/08.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: A state owned oil pipeline is destroyed by explosive in Udu LGA. NDGJM claimed responsibility. NDA also destroyed a pipeline elsewhere in the state.
Taxi drivers protest alleged intimidation by the police.
A student is shot and killed by police during a otherwise peaceful demonstration against insecurity in the area. The protest was reportedly violent the previous day.
Prisoners in Abakaliki riot, clash with guards. 19 deaths reported.

A military air raid on Boko Haram positions in Sambisa forest kill 300, including Boko Haram commanders known as Abubakar Mubi, Malam Nuhu and Malam Hamman. Additionally, Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau is believed either injured or killed.
A man is killed in Ligari by unidentified gunmen for unknown reasons.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on Godogodo village on 20/08. Two days later the attackers besieged nearby Ningon village, near Gwantu, killing two and injuring one.

Boko Haram fighters riding on bicycles sacked Shawa village in Askira/Uba LGA of Borno state in the early hours of Sunday. Though no dead body has been found, [witnesses] said several villagers were missing.
Boko Haram attacks Kuburvwa (Kuburihu) village, near Chibok, killing 11 residents and abducting others.
Suspected Fulani attack Gwantu killing a small child.

Workers in Borno State under the aegis of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC), on Tuesday staged a peaceful rally over the recent killing of two of their colleagues by the police during a similar protest session in Nasarawa State on 29/07.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on Godogodo village on 20/08. Two days later the attackers besieged nearby Ningon village, near Gwantu, killing two and injuring one.

Civil servants in Adamawa staged a protest in front of the Government House Yola calling for the removal of three government officials from office due to their anti-worker stance. The protesters, led by the state chairman of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC), Mr Dauda Maina, shut the entrance to government house for several hours.
The Edo State chapter of the Nigerian Labour Congress ( NLC) staged a protest over pay and alleged inhumane working conditions.
Students of Students of Fidei Polytechnic in Gboko area protest for unknown reason.

Socio-economic activities at the heart Katsina metropolis were disrupted for hours as workers in Katsina state took to the streets over two Nasarawa State workers killed by suspected security operatives during a recent solidarity protest organized by national leaders of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) in Nasarawa.
Airline workers protest planned airport privatization in Lagos.
Unidentified gunmen attack a bus stand in Enugu for unknown reason. One reported dead.
Eight are killed by a vigilante mob in Zamfara over charges of blasphemy.

At least one student was reportedly killed after the second day of protest by the Students of Fidei Polytechnic in Gboko area of Benue State turned violent. It was not clear what the students were protesting.
Thousands of members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) staged a peaceful procession in Kaduna, demanding for the release of their leader, Sheikh Ibraheem El-Zakzaky.
Troops of Operation Lafia Dole have killed two senior Boko Haram commanders and several other insurgents (numbers not known) at Darul Jamel on the fringes of Sambisa forest in Borno
Protesters for and against Muhammad Abubakar, governor of Bauchi State, clashed at the All Progressives Congress (APC) national secretariat.
Hundreds of female IDPs embarked on peaceful protest barricaded the Maiduguri-Kano/Jos Road in Maiduguri over shortage of food supply to the Arabic Teachers College camp in the state capital.

Armed men suspected to be herdsmen attacked the Ndiagu Attakwu community, Nkanu West Local Government Area of Enugu state, killing a seminarian, identified as Lazarus Nwafor, while four other members of a family sustained severe injury - one of whom died later in the hospital.

Thousands of villagers from communities in Southern Kaduna staged a protest in Gwantu, Headquarters of Sanga Local Government Area, of Kaduna state against what they said was unrelenting deadly sieges on their communities by armed herdsmen and the confiscation of their lands for Cattle Grazing Reserves.
In a clearance operation military forces raid militant camps in and around Sapele, killing 5 and injuring others.
Fulanis attack Dinya community in Gassol local government area on 27/08 critically injuring 7.
Youths attack Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company officials with dangerous weapons following three days of power outages. The victims suffered severe injuries.
Lagos State university students protest at the office of the governor over non-accreditation of medical and dental programmes in the institution.
Inmates at Kuje Medium Prison riot. Police respond with tear-gas.
A human rights lawyer is assassinated by undented gunmen in Aluu.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Movement (NDGJM) launched Operation Crocodile Tears and blew up the Ogor-Oteri major delivery line, operated by the Nigeria Petroleum Development Company (NPDC) and Shorelines Petroleum in Ughelli North Local Government Area of Delta State in the early hours of Tuesday.
Members of the BringBackOurGirls campaigners on Tuesday staged a protest at the road leading to Aso Rock, Abuja, by sitting on the road and sealing their mouths with cellotape.
Members of a football team protest to the governor over several months of unpaid salaries.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ala Lumshe, near Marte. Following a period of battle air forces drove back the insurgents. Causalities not known.

The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) on Tuesday destroyed a new camp being operated by the Boko Haram sect between Malam Fatori and Kangarwa in northern Borno State. The attack which was conducted overnight followed intelligence reports. Causalities not known.

The Academic Forum of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (AFIMN) protested the December 12 and 14, 2015 killings of their members and the continued detention of their leader, Sheik Ibrahim Zakzaky in Abuja.

Members of the suspended University of Lagos Student Union (ULSU) executive Wednesday protested what they described as an "unjust rustication" of the union members. The protest took place at the schools senate building.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
NOTES: In-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Zuwa village in Marte district, killing an unspecified number.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CATE: Coalition Against Terrorism and Extremism
NOTES: The Coalition Against Terrorism and Extremism (CATE) protest near government and military buildings to protest against planned negotiation with Boko Haram.

Food vendors angered by Kaduna state government from Rigasa ward in Igabi Local Government Area, under the free school feeding programme staged a peaceful protest, alleging that they have been unofficially replaced by officials of the LG Council.

ACTOR2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
NOTES: In-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Yele and Arafa. In Yele, the Barnawi faction killed three people from the Shekau camp, injured one and took one with them, while several were killed in Arafa
Two Chinese nationals are kidnapped in Odeda LGA. The pair was rescued in the following week.

A coalition of civil society groups protest at the US Embassy in Lagos against what they termed Amnesty Internationals interference in war against terrorism in the country, describing the interference as a grand ploy to frustrate the countrys security agencies.
The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) destroyed a Boko Haram camp at Tumbun Rego in Northern Borno. Causalities not known. Source dated 02/09.
The Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Okitipupa local government area of Ondo State, Mr Niyi Pirisola, was Friday assassinated by suspected hired killers at his home.
Unidentified gunmen abduct 15 oil workers outside Port Harcourt along Omoku/Elele road.
Women of Ikot Umoessiem community at the weekend embarked on a peaceful protest to express their dismay over incessant destruction of their crops and farmland by herdsmen.
Residents protest the poor state of a local road at the weekend.

At least 6,500 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) of Arabic College camp in Maiduguri caused traffic logjam on Maiduguri -Jos road when they protested against starvation. The protesters came out of the camp and blocked the highway as they complained that they were tired of burying their children due to lack of food in the camp.

Students protest at a Benin City government house after they learned an upcoming emanation coincided with an election date. The students, believing this would disenfranchise their vote, wanted the exam moved.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
NOTES: Thousands of workers in the 16 Local Government Areas of Kwara State on 06/09 embarked on mass protest in Illorin over unpaid salary arrears.
Workers of Irepodun and Oke-Ero Local Government Areas of Kwara on Tuesday protested over unpaid seven months arrears of salaries.
Military forces arrest a Boko Haram commander (Muhammed Bulama) and two others in Gujba LGA.

Some supporters of President Muhammadu Buhari clashed with members of the #BringBackOurGirls group, as the campaigners made their way to the Presidential Villa in Abuja. The supporters of the president believed the campaigners meant to undermine the APC.
Armed youths of Odiemerenyi community, Ahoada East attack a group of oil inspectors after an extortion payment is denied.

The Nigerian Army said troops of the 4 Brigade in Abia State have arrested one Gabriel Ogbudje (an ex-militant leader) and the alleged leader of the "Otugas Fire Force", a militant group threatening to attack the Utorogu Gas Plant.
Militants (possibly kidnappers) ambush a group of operatives of the Federal Special Anti-Robbery Squad on 07/09 who were investigating a spate of recent attacks in the area. Casualties not known.

Scores were 07/09 injured and at least one killed (Vanguard claims 3) at the Lagos State government-owned abattoir at the Oko-Oba area of Agege, following a bloody clash between the Hausa and Fulani communities in the area.
Militants (possibly kidnappers) attack residents of Igando. Casualties not known. Date not clear, on or before 07/09.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
NOTES: Two soldiers of the Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF, were on Thursday killed in an explosion while fighting Boko Haram insurgents in the northern part of Borno State near the Cameroon border, location not reported.

Unrest was reported on 08/09 in Okpella, Estako East Local Government area of Edo State as supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP clashed with those of the All Progressives Congress, APC. It was gathered that the incident started brewing in the early hours when some PDP supporters were alleged to have threatened to carry out attack on any Okpellan supporting the ruling APC in Okpella.
Suspected Fulanis attack Golgolfa on 08/09 killing two.
No fewer than 3,000 Ishiagu women on 09/09 staged a peaceful protest against the destruction of farm crops by herdsmen to the Palace of the traditional ruler of the community.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
NOTES: Members of the MNJTF clear 12 villages and kill four members of Boko Haram during operation in northern Borno.
Members of Boko Haram attacked a motorist along a highway connecting Maiduguri and Monguno (at Kulukawuya village, 50 kilometres from Maiduguri) killing a driver and wounding passengers.
Fulanis attack Golgolfa two days following a similar attack in the area. One death reported.
Following an attack on Golgolfa, Fulanis attack several other villages in the LGA. Several houses were destroyed.
A mob lynches a suspected thief in suburban Abuja.
A PDP office is attacked by vandals on the night of 10/09. No reported human injury.

Military forces averted a would-be suicide bomber as she approached a check point in Dikwa. Security forces, responding on suspicions, opened fire on the suspect, causing her pack to explode. In addition to the death of the bomber, two military members were injured mildly. The alliance of the bomber is not known.
Following a series of earthquake tremors the previous day, residents of Koi protest for government aid.
Youths riot after a traditional ruler not of their choosing is selected. One civilian bystander is killed the melee.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate, NDGJM, in the early hours of Tuesday, blew up the Afiesere-Iwhrenene major delivery line to UPS/UQCC, operated by Nigeria Petroleum Development Company, NDPC/Shorelines Petroleum in Ughelli North Local Government Area of Delta State.
Occupants of a four-storey building at Idumota Market in Lagos Island on Tuesday protested an alleged illegal eviction from their offices by a developer.
Traders protest the death of a colleague after an attack by Ijaw youths.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known.
Ijaw youths attack stalls in a market place, burning them. One woman died in the attacks, sparking a protest.
Hospital patients protest over a prolonged staff strike.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NAPSS: National Association of Plateau State Students
NOTES: NAPSS protests over the transfer of a teacher.
Protest at the television college of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) in Jos, capital of Plateau State demanding that an indigene be appointed to head the college.
Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.
Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.
Unidentified gunmen attack a television station in Onitsha, sparking a gun battle with police. No loss of life, though there was property destroyed. The reason for the attack is not known.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known.
Protests in Umuahia and Aba over an election ruling.
Residents protest over the planned demolition of houses.
Protests in Umuahia and Aba over an election ruling.
[Fulani] herdsmen attack Nandu and Kabamu villages in Sanga Local [recently]. No fewer than 38 persons were killed in the separate attacks, others missing.
[Fulani] herdsmen attack Nandu and Kabamu villages in Sanga Local [recently]. No fewer than 38 persons were killed in the separate attacks, others missing.
Suspected herdsmen operating in Ubulu-Unor community, Aniocha South local government area of Delta State shot and injured two farmers on their way to their farmlands.
APC youths protest over an alleged plan to tamper with a primary election result. Exact date of the protest not clear.
Parents of students of the Federal Government Girls College, Benin City, Edo State, staged a peaceful protest over school fees hike.
Air forces flying F-7NIs conduct a series of air strikes at Tumbin Gini and Tumbin Kayewa in northern Borno. "Many" casualties.
Unidentified gunmen fatally attack an on-duty vigilante member in Omoku.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: NDGJM blow up a pipeline in Ughelli.
Boko Haram opens fire on a group of churchgoers in Kwamjilari Gana, eight dead.

The Nigerian Army encountered Boko Haram members foraging for food, ambushed troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole escorting commercial vehicles from Damboa to Maiduguri at Sanda general area, Borno State. Six civilian dead, three soldiers injured.
Twenty houses destroyed and two dead during a clash between two militias over control of land in Odukpani.
Boko Haram attacks Talari, beheading the village leader, his son and shooting two others.
Youths protest the death of a hunter they suspect died at the hands of police.
Two factions of the APC clash in Asaba. Several arrests reported.
APC and PDP supporters clash during a rally for the latter. Injuries not known.

Gunmen dressed in military camouflage on Wednesday night burnt down the home of former leader of the Rivers State House of Assembly and chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Dr. Chidi Julius Lloyd at Akpabu community in Emohua local government area of Rivers State.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CDD: Coalition in Defence of Democracy
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters under the aegis of Coalition in Defence of Democracy (CDD) protested at the precinct of the National Assembly, demanding the immediate suspension of embattled former chairman of the House of Representatives Appropriation Committee over a question of the budget.
Pensioners protest over pay in Owerri.

Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, IMN, protested in the streets of Abuja, demanding the immediate release of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, who has been by the military since last year December. Police used teargas to disperse the group.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
NOTES: The Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) has recaptured Malam Fatori, a border town on the shores of Lake Chad, from Boko Haram after a fierce battle. Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, IMN, protested in the streets of Abuja, demanding the immediate release of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, who has been by the military since last year December. Fifteen Boko Haram dead (Premium Times). Following the battle, West African arm of the Islamic State (ISIS) claimed Boko Haram killed forty military members, though the military denies this number.
Vigilantes attack a suspected thief. No fatality reported.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspected motorcycle thief in Pankshin.
NDA destroys a pipeline in Bonny LGA.
Parents of students of the Federal Government College, Ilorin, staged a peaceful protest over school fee hike.
Protest in Enugu North over the alleged seizure of ancestral land by the state government. The protest occurred "at the weekend."
Boko Haram ambushed a convoy late on Sunday near Bama, 70km southeast of Maiduguri, resulting in the deaths of an army officer, three soldiers, and three attackers
Boko Haram attacked an army position at Logomani, 110km northeast of Maiduguri city, killing four soldiers. The military claimed 22 Boko Haram died in the firefight.

The traditional ruler of Mbayongo district in Kastina Ala local council of Benue State, Tyoor Awuha Alev, has been killed by unknown gunmen. He was shot dead at his palace in Vingir village around 8:00p.m. on Sunday.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
NOTES: Hundreds of workers, under the aegis of the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities (SSANU) of the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta (FUNAAB), Ogun state on Monday protesting against university management.

The Nigerian military has lost an officer and three other soldiers with 19 others including three members of militia groups (not named) seriously injured in a Boko Haram ambush in Borno State. The attack began with the detonation of an IED, followed by an attack.
Boko Haram attacks Kwang village, near Daggu, battling a unnamed local militia group. The attackers were repelled. Casualties not known.
Boko Haram attacks the village of Kubirivour, Boftari and Kuburmbalah, near Chibok. Eight fatalities.
Unidentified gunmen attack the home of a traditional ruler, assault and kill his son.
Fulanis burn homes in Antang on Godogodo-Gidan-Way in Jemaa Local Council of Southern Kaduna.
Students parents protest after exam results were not released on schedule.
Fulanis attack Dogon Daji, killing three and destroying houses.
Truck drivers protest taxes and levies.
Hundreds of employees of Aero Contractors Airline Wednesday staged a peaceful protest over the closure of the airline by the Asset Management Company of Nigeria (AMCON) in Lagos.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Bulabulin, kill nine and wound others.
NDA and members of ISN: Imo Security Network clash in Ohaji/Egbema, one death reported.
Violence between APC and PDP members broke out during a voting exercise in Irrua.
Fulanis shoot and kill two and kidnap a priest during a raid on Nnewi.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: Members of NDGJM blow up a pipeline in Ughelli South.
Seven vehicles have been burnt by youths from Ohaji/Egbema LGA following the alleged killing of a man by the Imo State Security Network the previous day.
Supporters of the PDP protest a court ruling which declared a rival APC candidate an election winner.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS), University of Lagos, protest over school mismanagement.
Students of the Kogi State Polytechnic, Lokoja, staged a protest and demanded for the removal of the rector of the institution over poor access to amenities. The students blocked roads.
PDP supporters protest Edo governorship poll result in Benin City.
Residents and military clash over land use in the Iddo Sarki area.
Military forces clash with members of the Bakassi Strike Forces at Efut Isigi, Akpabuyo LGA in Cross River State. Seven reported dead.
24 soldiers are captured during an encounter with CML in the Bakassi waterways. Seven CML killed during the battle, a claim they deny.
Contract staff with mobile telecommunication company, MTN, in Ilorin, Kwara State, have protested termination of their appointment allegedly in violation of an earlier agreement.
Military forces arrest a Boko Haram commander in Kwaya Kusar LGA.
Unidentified gunmen attack a police armoury, cart away weapons and kill four officers.
Gunmen kill a traditional ruler in Vingir village.
Residents protest an alleged land takeover by a Chinese company.
PDP supporters protest Edo governorship poll result in Benin City.
Local militia arrest logistic operators and several Boko Haram leaders in Miringa market.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shiites) accuse members of the military of abducting a member in Dustin-Ma.
Four members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) were killed in the Gokana local government area of Rivers state. The party speculated the states governor masterminded the killings.

Youths believed to be loyalists of the National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Chief John Odigie-Oyegun protested against national leader of the party Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu. The protest took place at the national secretariat of the APC in Abuja.
Health workers protest non payment of salary.
When a food service company threatens to relocate out of Nigeria its employees protest.
Trade unions in the aviation sector staged a peaceful protest at the Murtala Muhammed Airport, Lagos over the proposed concession of the four major airports in the country.

Business and commercial activities in Akure, the Ondo State capital, were halted as armed supporters of the gubernatorial candidate of the AAPC, Chief Rotimi Akeredolu, and those of Engineer Olusegun Abraham, who was defeated at the primary poll, fought. It was learnt that trouble started when some youths stormed the APC secretariat in the morning, demanding resignation of the National Chairman of the APC.

Protesting Ijaw youths accused President Muhammadu Buhari of secretly giving the order for the bank accounts of former President Goodluck Jonathan to be frozen, alleging that the order was indicative of his "vindictiveness" towards the former first family. The protesters blocked an expressway.
Sovereign Rights Coalition (SRC) staged a protest at the Embassy of Iran in Lagos, demanding an end to the diplomatic relationship between Nigeria and Iran.
Residents attempted to attack the Durbar station of the Nigerian police in Oyo Town on Thursday, after a police traffic warden allegedly caused the death of two persons.
Two suspected female suicide bombers were shot dead by soldiers as they attempted to attack a military base in Gwoza, Borno state. Perpetrators were Boko Haram suspects.
Troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole Thursday at about 6.30 a.m., intercepted a male suicide bomber on the outskirts of Maiduguri and neutralised the bomber and later the bomb he strapped on himself.
A 42-year-old man, was beaten and stripped naked a mob when they allege he uses magic.
The entrance of the Turkish embassy were paralyzed after students barricaded the entrance in protest against the detention of some Nigerian students by security forces in Ankara.
PDP supporters again protest an election result in Benin City.
An APC chieftains wife is abducted in Omuo-Oke.
Federal University of Technology workers protest against the actions of their Vice Chancellor, attack journalists covering the event.
Federal University of Technology workers protest against the actions of their Vice Chancellor, block roads. The police later dispersed the group.
Gunmen assassinate a police escort of an APC member in Mbieri.
Violent protest after an election member of the state assembly is not permitted entrance to the legislative building.
A group within the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), the Save Zakzakys Life Group (SZLG) in Abuja protested against the continuous detention of the leader of the movement.
University of Lagso students, attempting to disrupt ongoing examinations, assault a police officer.
Church worshippers stone man to death over a land issue.

Hundreds of protesters disrupted activities at the main entrance of the National Assembly, asking the Department of State Services, DSS, and anti-graft agencies to raid federal lawmakers in order to recover more public funds. Simultaenously, groups in Abuja converge to protest the state of the economy, specifically the fall of the naira.
Boko Haram attacks Kwashebe village, killing five residents and injuring others before looting foodstuffs.

Aides of Senators and members of the House of Representatives protested against non payment of their September salaries and allowances by the National Assembly management. At the same time, police protest over their pensions.
Rioters set Awajir Police station ablaze after a motorcycle rider was killed during a police stop.
A suspected Boko Haram IED targets a military escort in the Mura Garage area of the city, killing between 10 and 18.
Air raids in the "last one week" target Boko Haram position sin Smabisa Forest, claiming the lives of "many."
Shiites exchange gunfire with security forces in Funtua following a religious procession that was considered illegal. At least three people dead
Sunnis attack a group of Shiites during a religious procession in Sokoto state. One or two deaths reported, depending on the source.
Irate youths (Sunni) attacked a group of Shiites during a procession in the Anguwan Rogo area. Several injuries and the destruction of a worship building destroyed.
Residents protest over waterfront slums.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: Members of NDGJM blow up the Oviri-Otor trunkline in Delta State.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CESYD: Coalition of Edo State Youth for Democracy
NOTES: CESYD accused the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) of complexity in a recent gubernatorial poll in the state, and protested at the INEC office in Abuja.

Violence broke out in Ido-Ekiti, Ido-Osi Local Government Area of Ekiti State on Friday night as gunmen numbering about 40 allegedly invaded the Divisional Police Station in the community and killed a police inspector on duty.
Two men suspected to be handset snatchers were burnt to death by a mob in Mararaba, near Abuja.
Police and military clash in Nkwagu, near Abakaliki, on Saturday evening. Injuries reported.
Security forces intercept and gun down a suspected suicide bomber in Madagali. The suspects alliance not described by source.
Fulani militia attack the predominantly Christian town of Godogodo. 29 dead are reported the next day
Sunni/Shiite violence continues, two Shiites killed and ten injured as they are attacked while rebuilding a school in Tudun Wada.

An armed mob attack vehicles transporting Fulanis in a vigilante style attack leaving fourteen dead. Following the attacks, Fulanis in the area rioted into next day. Police intervened to quell the violence. At least 20 dead as result of the riot.
An armed group attack vehicles transporting Fulanis, fourteen dead. Following the attacks, Fulanis in the area rioted into next day. Police intervened to quell the violence.
Twenty, identified only as "herdsmen" attack Galwyi community in Chikun LGA, killing two and stealing cattle.
Numbering 500, slum dwellers in Lagos have stormed the office of the state governor over the planned demolition of slums in the state.
Thirteen are wounded when Boko Haram attacks a military location in Gashigar. The forces exited the area the following day.
Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.
Three mobile police officers on patrol were shot dead in the early hours of Monday on a road between Plateau and Kaduna states at Hawan Kibo.
Youths have set ablaze the Magazu Police Station in Tsafe Local Government Area of Zamfara, following a misunderstanding between the police and the people of the village.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Military and Civilian JTF raided a location of Terwase Agwaza militia in Tor Donga, killing 10 and injuring others.
Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.
Boko Haram attacked, looted and burned Goptari, near Chibok. casualties not known.
Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.
Some indigenes of the Federal Capital Territory, FCT, barricaded the main entrance of the National Assembly protesting a quit notice allegedly issued to them by the Nigerian Army.
Non-academic staff at Lagos State Polytechnic protest after the rector tried to break a labour strike.
Commercial bus drivers in Kano protest over a use of a certain paint by Kano State Road Traffic Agency (KAROTA).
A pregnant woman is attacked and killed by an armed group described only as militants. Four others injured.
Unidentified gunmen stormed the Ibeshi area of Ikorodu killing a pregnant woman, her two children and another man for unknown reason.
Hunters, tasked to fight Boko Haram by military forces, kill seven at Ghantsa area of Makwan Village in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State.
One killed, several houses destroyed when members of a vigilante militia clashed with a group of locals Ejinya Abakpa and Ejinya Eheche communities in Ankpa local government area of Kogi State.
Military forces establish a base in Buratai.
Two members of the Alliance for Democracy (AD) in Ondo state, have been attacked in Owo, headquarters of Owo local government area of the state. AD leadership lays blame on the APC.
"Herdsmen" attacked Ossissa community, killing two and wounding another.
Suspected Fulanis assassinate a police officer in his home in Jos South LGA.
Hundreds of protesters barricaded the Asaba-Ughelli expressway to express their anger over an attack by herdsmen the previous day.
Market traders block Uselu/Ugbowo section of the Benin-Lagos highway in protest of a forced market relocation.
Villagers gather in protest to demand herdsmen vacate the area.
NDA destroys an offshore pipeline in Warri South.
National Agency for Food and Drugs Administration workers protest over the "plight of workers."
Health workers protest the reinstatement of a medical director.
A farmer is attacked and killed by unidentified persons wielding machetes in Abaji.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: FONGON: Forum of Non-Governmental Organizations in Nigeria
NOTES: FONGON protest at the National Assembly, accusing judges of corruption. At the same time, legislative aides protested at the National Assembly over unpaid allowances.
A group of 100 protest at a Lagos court after Ex-president Goodluck Jonathans wifes bank account is frozen following money laundering claims.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS, logo marched on the Enugu-Onitsha expressway in Awka to protest alleged extortion by officials of the Anambra government.
Protest after Patience Jonathans (former First Lady) assets are frozen over money laundering claims.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: Members of NURTW and a local motorcycle group clash in Igando over a tax or levy issue. Twelve injured.
PDP youths violently protest over the inclusion of a name on an electoral ballot.
Members of the PDP violently protest a electoral office decision in Ondo town. One student is injured when he is struck by a police tear gas canister. A similar protest took place in Akure.
The Kogi State chairman of Maiyati is assassinated by unknown assailants at his home in Lokoja.
PDP supporters continue a ballot protest in Akure. It is not known if the protest was violent.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Members of NANS against protest over alleged extortion payments "at the weekend."
Residents protest after a four-year-old is shot and killed in crossfire between police and a group of criminals. Date not clear - source dated 29/10.
More than 30 people were allegedly killed and dozens injured when [Boko Haram] and troops clashed in Golgiri village in Damboa local government area of Borno State on Saturday.
Two suicide blasts detonate during the morning hours near an IDP camp in Maiduguri. At least nine deaths reported, 24 injured. Boko Haram suspected as perpetrators.
Residents protest a planned demolition of shops.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: Five soldiers, three vigilantes and a civilian joint task force (JTF) member were killed during a Boko Haram ambush in Talala and Ajigin axis of southern Borno State on Sunday.
A military sniper shoots a suspected suicide bomber who was believed to have been targeting a IDP camp in Maiduguri.

Constitutional lawyers and human rights activists from various parts of the country staged a protest in Abuja against the continued detention of former National Security Adviser. The protesters complained the person remained detained despite several payments of bail.
A Boko Haram truck carrying a suicide ordinance explodes after the vehicle is denied access to a military checkpoint, killing its eight occupants.
Military forces clear several Boko Haram camps in Marte LGA, and rescued 38 of their prisoners. Six Boko Haram fatalities reported.
Military forces foil a Boko Haram suicide attempt in Gubio, shoot eight assailants.

ACTOR1: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
NOTES: MEND destroys a oil pipeline with explosives near Batan community in Warri South West.

Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), who took to the streets of Abuja, to protest the continuous detention of the their spiritual leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky are teargassed by police after they were refused a demonstration approval.
One dead in a clash between "farmers" and "herdsmen" in Kwayine.
Unidentified persons bomb an oil pipeline at Batan community, Warri South LGA.
PDP supporters of Osisioma Ngwa Local Government Area of Abia State protested attempts by party leadership to conduct a second ward of primaries.
Troops on patrol kill two members of Boko Haram along Monguno-Brimari road in Borno.
Military forces kill five suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers in Yamtaji. One soldier lost.

At least three persons were wounded and two others arrested following fracas that broke out during the conduct of elections into the executive positions of the Ekiti state chapter of the Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT).
Protesters marched to the Presidential Villa insisting that several judges who had been indicted step aside.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Malam Fatori, killing 14. Five soldiers reported dead.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: Students under NANS protest in Awka at the weekend over alleged extortion by officials of the Anambra government.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed Operation Karya Gwuiwa. The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed Operation Karya Gwuiwa. The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed Operation Karya Gwuiwa. The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

Military forces cleared the Boko Haram controlled areas of Geram, Bulankassa and Chukungudu on the "southern fringes" of the Lake Chad region and rescued 85 hostages "at the weekend". One soldier believed dead in the operation.
Boko Haram attacks Akwada, 10 kilometres from Chibok, killing two soldiers in a gunfight. The attackers also torched the village.
A vigilante mob lynches a suspected thief in Afikpo.
LAGBUS (red bus) operators block the Ikorodu road at Majidun Creek to protest the governments ban on them.
Youths in Akpabuyo and Ikot Nakanda LGAs of Cross River protest against alleged "marginalization" by a local cement company.
Youths in Akpabuyo and Ikot Nakanda LGAs of Cross River protest against alleged "marginalization" by a local cement company.
One soldier and 13 Boko Haram dead after the latter staged an attack in Kangarwa.

No fewer than six people from Ndi Okereke Abam in Ovukwu autonomous community, Arochukwu local government area of Abia State, sustained from bullet wounds and machete cuts in a clash with herders (Vanguard reports they were Fulani).
Attackers described only as "suspected militants" blew up a pipeline in Batan community of Warri South West and open fire on a group of company security guards. No causalities.

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.
At least three children were on Monday beheaded in Dissol village of Gassol Local Government Area of Taraba State, perpetrators not known.
NDA use explosives and destroyed a oil pipeline near Warri. A similar attack occurred in the area last week.

500 protesters from several communities around Warri blockaded a site operated by SPDC, the Nigerian subsidiary of Shell. The protesters claimed the oil company had not lived up to their agreement with the surrounding community.

Hundreds of protesters stormed the national headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) and demanded for the immediate resignation of the chairman of the commission after he allegedly refused to investigate a claim of voter fraud.

At least two soldiers are feared dead after a bomb explosion along Banki - Usmanari - Kumshe road in Borno State. About eight soldiers were also injured in the explosion which occurred at about 8:10 a.m

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.

Some traders at Drug Market Onitsha Bridgehead, Anambra State, blocked the entrance gate of the market in protest of proposed relocation of the market to Oba in Idemili South Local Government Area of the state.
Protest as police fail to arraign alleged land grabbers in Oko-Olomi community in Ibeju Lekki, Lagos.

Security forces clash with NDA at the Batan-Egwa creeks in Warri South-west Local Government Area of the state. Causalities not known. NDA had detonated explosives on oil pipelines over two days in the area.

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.

One is killed and three injured during violence at a PDP primary. The victim, who was set alight by a group of protesting delegates, was a member of staff of Isialangwa North Local Government Area. A witness said trouble broke out when some delegates who came for the poll at the council headquarters in Okpuala-Ngwa, rejected the list presented by the party officials that came to conduct the exercise.

A youth in Ayama, an outpost of Aladja, Udu Local Government Area, was reportedly shot dead by men from neighbouring Isaba, Warri South West, Delta State in communal conflict. A second victim was reported missing.
Soldiers in the early hours of Friday shot three Boko Haram suicide bombers at in Umarari village, near Mulai towards Maiduguri.
Violence against residents of Ayama by militia from Isaba continued; several houses destroyed and seven villagers abducted.
Members of the IM (Shiite) attack a group of police in Dawakin Kudu, between Kwanar Dawaki and Tamburawa. Between eight and nine deaths reported. Other sources count the death total at 20.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PASAN: Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria (PASAN) locked out members of the state House of Assembly in protest over unfulfilled demands bothering on staff welfare.
The students of Akwa Ibom Polytechnic protested against an increment of fees by the schools authority.
Militias from Onweonweiya and Mkpumaekweoku militias of Izza LRA clashed at of Ebonyi State - three deaths reported.

Fulani headsmen attack several villages in Kauru LGA including Ungwan Rimi, Kitakum, Ungwan Magaji and Kigam on 12/11. Initially, 31 deaths reported, but the number was raised to 43 later in the week.
The Ambrose Ali University (AAU), Ekpoma, Edo State, was shut down indefinitely following a violent protest by the students over alleged hike in school fees.
Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.
At least two villagers have been killed and a dozen others abducted when attackers, only described as insurgents attacked a village in Askira/Uba local government area of Borno State.
Members of NDA destroy an oil pipeline in Nembe.
Protesters block the entrance to the National Assembly, calling for the prosecution of the alleged corruption of judges. The protest lasted for two days.

No fewer than 600 residents of Otodo Gbame, a predominantly Egun waterfront community in Lekki protested the destruction of their homes by hoodlums and policemen, alleged to be working with the state government. The protesters marched to the state house in Alausa.
One lieutenant colonel and eight soldiers dead after a Boko Haram attack on government forces between Bita and Piridang, Borno State.
Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.
Protesters block the entrance to the National Assembly, calling for the prosecution of the alleged corruption of judges. The protest lasted for two days.
NUP pensioners protest over unpaid pensions, gratuity in Ife-Ife.
Indigenes and residents of Umunneochi LGA protest over a petition written by a member of the community against a company located in the area.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."

A group described as "local hunters" rescue eight Boko Haram prisoners in Sambisa Forest as they fled a "fierce battle" between the sect and military forces. The battle and rescue occurred "last week" (source dated 23/11). Details limited, including location and causalities.

A group described as "local hunters" rescue eight Boko Haram prisoners in Sambisa Forest as they fled a "fierce battle" between the sect and military forces. The battle and rescue occurred "last week" (source dated 23/11). Details limited, including location and causalities.
One dead and another injured in a clash between members of APC factions in Kano.
A young boy is burnt to death by a vigilante group after it was suspected he had stolen food.
Pensioners block roads in protest on non-payments.
Residents protest poor road maintenance.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PDP: Peoples Democratic Party; APC: All Progressives Congress
NOTES: Members or supporters of the APC and PDP attempted to forcibly enter the State Assembly Complex from adjoining roads, but were dispersed by police with tear gas and live bullets. The APC supporters said that they were at the assembly to inform the speaker of their opposition over his refusal to swear in a member, while the PDP loyalists said they were there on a courtesy visit to the Speaker.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Ngoshe. Causalities not known.

Five suicide bombers targeted a police checkpoint and a bus station near a Maidguri transit camp in the eastern suburbs, killing four of themselves and two civilian self-defence fighters. The fifth bomber was arrested.

Two suicide bombers in the early hours of 18/11 killed themselves at a police checkpoint near the Federal High Court Complex in the Jiddari Polo area of Maiduguri, after police officers on guard tried to stop them from advancing towards their post. A third bomber was arrested. No other causalities. Later investigations led authorities to believe a secondary target may have been a Catholic Church.
Militia of Ediba and Usumotong communities in Abi LGA clash over two days, claim[ing] many lives.
Unidentified gunmen abduct 40 in Maru LGA.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
Military forces gun down a Boko Haram suicide bomb as he attempted to detonated a pack near an IDP camp in Maiduguri. A similar attack was carried out near the camp the day before.
Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Kangarwa. Causalities not known.
Militia of Ediba and Usumotong communities in Abi LGA clash over two days, claim[ing] many lives.
Boko Haram attacked Thlaimaklama village in Chibok Local government area of Borno state "at the weekend", destroying several homes.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
A former minister of foreign affairs, Ambassador Bagudu Hirse, was kidnapped by three gunmen in Kaduna.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
One dead and eleven injured when a group of hunters known as "Agbekoya" attempted to raid a police armoury in Ogbere.

ACTOR1: NSCDC: Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps
NOTES: Gunmen dressed in military camouflage killed four members of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps in the oil producing region of Omoku.
A wealthy Tiv farmer and his brother are killed by unidentified assailants near Chakumi village in Abaji Area Council of the FCT.
Striking Federal Polytechnic workers protest, blocking several roads in Ado-Ekiti.
Residents of Arepo Community in Ogun State marched in demonstration to the head office of Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company, at Alausa, to protest over three months power outage.
Residents of Arepo Community in Ogun State marched in demonstration to the head office of Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company, at Alausa, to protest over three months power outage.
Teachers of Junior Secondary School (JSS) Kuje protested in the school after the principal allegedly slapped their colleague.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram group at Goneri, Kukawa LGA, capturing two trucks. Several members of Boko Haram were reported injured as they fled.
A vigilante mob pursues a suspected thief who stabs one member of the mob before getting beaten to death.

Three persons were injured while two vehicles were destroyed when two rival groups protesting for and against the recent bill passed by Edo State House of Assembly, amending a Pension bill, clashed at the popular Oba Ovonramwe Square, Benin City.

Business activities were grounded at the headquarters of the National Insurance Commission, NAICOM, as a result of a protest staged against the commissions management by workers. There was a similar protest in Lagos.
Workers of NAICOM protest activities of management in Lagos.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.
Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.
Two are killed in a Boko Haram suicide attack on a Maiduguri motor park.
Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."

Two members of youth vigilantes of Chibok Local Government Area of Borno state and scores of suspected members of Boko Haram were killed in an encounter during patrol in Shawa village of Damboa Local Government Area.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over "neglect."
Clash between APC and PDP supporters in Owo. One death reported.
Four persons were killed while several houses including the house of the village head were burnt, when unknown gunmen attacked Mile One Village in Tafan District, Kaduna State on Friday.

Boko Haram elements attempt to ambush government officials along Bama road in Gwoza LGA, between Pulka and Maiduguri. The officials, who were escorted by soldiers, provided resistance and fought off the attackers. 30 Boko Haram dead.
Two are killed and several houses burnt over two non-consecutive days during a clash between the Ebira and Bassa kwomu speaking peoples Ikende.

Six unidentified gunmen, "at the weekend" shot and killed an oil magnates aid. Several others reported injured. It is not clear if the violence is related to an ongoing land dispute between the Abagana and Ukpo communities in the area, which some investigators suspect.

ACTOR1: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
NOTES: NDGJM, on the morning of 27/11, blew up a pipeline operated by the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company, NPDC in Otu-Jeremi, Ughelli South, Delta State.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
NOTES: One person dead during a protest by some workers of the Federal University of Technology Akure (FUTA). The protesters who were said to be members of the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities (SSANU) were demanding the termination of the Vice Chancellor of the University, Prof. There is no mention of police intervention or violence against civilians by the demonstrators.
A loyalist of former Vice President Atiku Abubakar is installed a Jada district head, leading to protest from the local community, who preferred an election.
Police protest non-payment of their allowances in the Funbi-Fagun area of Ondo town.
Two are killed and several houses burnt over two non-consecutive days during a clash between the Ebira and Bassa kwomu speaking peoples Ikende.
A Chinese miner is attacked and killed and another injured by gunmen in Alogani. The motive for the attack ins not known.

Athletes staged a protest at the National Stadium, Surulere to express their displeasure with the Sports Ministry and the Cross River State governments failure to organise the National Sports Festival.

Suspected former militants attacked Umuokeduru and Imeni communities, both in Ohaji Egbema local government area, killing 11 and burning buildings. Authorities believe the attack many have been motivated by alleged partiality in the State Amnesty Programme.
A vigilante mob set ablaze two suspected armed robbers at Umuguma, new Owerri, in Owerri West council area of Imo State for allegedly snatching a handbag.
Youths under the aegis of Concerned Igbo Youths (CIY), go on a rampage to protest an investigation into the former First Ladys finances.
Residents of Ikosi, in Kosofe Local Government Area, Lagos, blocked the main entrance of Ikeja Electric (IE), Ikeja, protesting over two months of power outage in their area.

Members of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, in the Nigerian Senate have staged a protest walk out from the chamber, following uproar that trailed the defection of Yele Omogunwa to the ruling All Progressives Congress.
Aggrieved bank customers attack and nearly lynch its managing director in New Haven before police were able to free the man.
Members of the IM (Shiite) block the entrance to the national assembly in protest of the detention of their leader, Sheik Ibrahim El-Zakzaky.
Fulanis attack Ozu-Item, causing life threating injuries to scores of farmers.

An unidentified armed group attacked the campaign office of Senator Shehu Sani (APC) representing Kaduna Central Senatorial District and attacked members of the Senators social media team. The attack may have been related to APC infighting.
The Nigerian national womens football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.
Youths protest alleged extortion in a government student stipend programme.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CGGCI: Coalition on Good Governance and Change Initiative
NOTES: CGGCI protesters gathered at the Abuja division of the Federal High Court against the judgement that detained leader of the Shiite Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky be released without condition. The Nigerian womens football team continue their occupation of an Abuja hotel to protest unpaid wages

Residents of Odutan Street in Ketu area of Lagos gathered at the Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC)s office to protest blackout in the community, as well as what they termed crazy billing for services not enjoyed by them.

Protest at the National Assembly against harassment of former President Goodluck Jonathans family members by the Department of State Services (DSS) and Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) over alleged charges of corruption. The Nigerian womens football team continue their occupation of an Abuja hotel to protest unpaid wages
2 killed, 2 injured, 3 missing in hostilities between militias of Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe towns in Isoko South LGA, Delta. The dispute arose over land.
Lecturers at the Nigerian Institute of Leather Science Technology, NILEST, lock the entrance to the school and block roads in protest of a payment issue.
The Nigerian national womens football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.

Residents of Atijere community in Ilaje Local Government Area of Ondo State staged a protest against a recent invasion by gunmen from Imakun Omi in Akure. The attack is believed to be motivated by the areas oil deposits.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
NOTES: 54 members of Boko Haram, two soldiers and two members of the Civilian JTF are killed "over the course of a week" in Sambisa Forest. Military and JTF deaths occurred at Bita - other locations and dates not known.
Militia from Imakun Omi attack civilians from Atijere over oil deposits. Date, casualties not known. Source dated 12/7. The attack led to a protest in Akure.
The Nigerian national womens football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.
No fewer than 1,000 residents of Sapele Local Government Area of Delta State protest poor electricity supply to the area by Benin Electricity Distribution Company.
The Nigerian national womens football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers struck a Madagali market on 09/12, killing at least 57 and injuring 177. 59 dead inclusing bombers
A Ogbe-Ijoh carpenter is beheaded in Aladja, Udu Local Government Area by suspected Ijaw youths. Additionally, two houses and two cars were destroyed.
Protest in Ahoada West against the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) over alleged bias in a recent election.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MAJAN: Maritime Journalists Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Members of MAJAN stage an 11 hour protest against traffic congestion in Apapa. The protest took place in Apapa, as well as "the entire Lagos metropolis" - along Apapa road by 7.00am and terminated at the premises of Murhi International Television (MITV) by 6.00pm.

Protesters from 36 affected communities in Gagarawa, Taura, Suletankarkar and Gwiwa local government areas took their protest to the State High Court in Dutse, the headquarters of Jigawa state, expressing anger that their 12,000 hectares of farmland had been taken by the state government and sold to a foreign investor for cultivation of sugarcane.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MAJAN: Maritime Journalists Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Members of MAJAN stage an 11 hour protest against traffic congestion in Apapa. The protest took place in Apapa, as well as "the entire Lagos metropolis" - along Apapa road by 7.00am and terminated at the premises of Murhi International Television (MITV) by 6.00pm.
A police officer is beheaded during election related violence in Omoku.
Members of the APC and PDP clash in Opobo/Nkoro LGA in 10/12, reasons unknown. Three APC youths reported injured.

Soldiers are accused of "mass arrests and killings" during a voting exercise in Tai and Gokana LGA on 10/12. It is alleged the army connived with some politicians (PDP, suspected) to influence the outcome of the vote. Military forces deny these claims.

Soldiers are accused of "mass arrests and killings" during a voting exercise in Tai and Gokana LGA on 10/12. It is alleged the army connived with some politicians (PDP, suspected) to influence the outcome of the vote. Military forces deny these claims.
Two girls, aged "seven or eight" detonate suicide packs on their person at a Maiduguri market, killing themselves and wounding at least 17 others. Boko Haram suspected.
Ijaw youths shot and cut off the head of an Urhobo youth residing at Aladja, Udu Local Government Area in revenge of a beheading of a Ogbe-Ijoh carpenter on 09/12.

Police allegedly shot and killed an Okada rider and injured two others over refusal to pay a N50 bribe. Following this, other Okada riders attack the area police station causing police to use tear gas to disperse the group. Two injuries reported from the following unrest.
A commanding officer and several soldiers (numbers unknown) are killed in a Boko Haram IED ambush outside of Gudumbali.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
ALLY_ACTOR_2: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Two sustain gunshot wounds when RTEAN and NURTW clash in Igando on 12/12. The clash is said to have been caused as a result of the refusal of motorcyclists and tricyclists to pay imposed levies.

Police allegedly shot and killed an Okada rider and injured two others over refusal to pay a N50 bribe. Following this, other Okada riders attack the area police station causing police to use tear gas to disperse the group. Two injuries reported from the following unrest.
An army colonel is found murdered inside his quarters at a military school in Ibadan, reasons not yet known.
Youths kill a man for being a homosexual in Gudu District, Abuja.
Members of NUP protest the state government for non-payment of arrears.
A senior military officer is killed in a Boko Haram IED explosion along a road in Kukawa LGA, near Baga.
Members of the Nigerian national womens football team hold a sign carrying protest at the National Assembly over unpaid salaries on 14/12.
Midwives protest a period without pay around the governors office in Ikeja.

One person was reportedly killed and several others injured by an explosion in Adadama Community, Abi local government area of Cross River State on 14/12. The blast occurred during a renewed conflict with neighbouring Amagu community of Ebonyi State.
"Last week," (source dated 20/12) suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked Ungwan Rana, Gadani village, Gwagwada district of Chikun Local Government Area, killing 15.
"Last week," (source dated 20/12) five persons were allegedly killed in Kachira village in Kaura Local Government Area in a Fulani attack.
Pensioners barricade the entrance of the Ministry of Finance in Abuja over non-payment of gratuities and other pension entitlements.
Protest over police "high-handedness" following a legislative re-run election in Port Harcourt.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: PENGASSAN workers of Mobil Producing Nigeria Unlimited, an affiliate of ExxonMobil, protested against the sack of 145 Nigerian workers and violation of expatriate quota by the company on 15/12 in Lagos (Victoria Island).
A traffic officer is beaten to death by a group of okada riders in Apapa after they were banned from and area.
Military forces intercept and arrest a suicide bomber in Rann.
A group of three or more persons kidnap and torture two young girls they suspect of witchcraft in Gombe State. One reported dead. Date, location unknown. Source dated 12/12.
Inmates of the Abakaliki prison riot over a marijuana ban.
A group of military forces in Bula Bello go on a "rampage", firing their weapons and threating to kill their officers over unpaid salaries.
Youths block the entrance to an ExxonMobil facility in Upenekang in protest over a recent termination of contract workers.
Airline passengers protest lost or abandoned luggage at the airport.

Students demonstrate against the demolition of the Madrasatul Imamis-Sadiq for Islamic Studies, a 35 year-old school located at Wakill Road, Sabon Gari Nasarawa, in Kaduna South local government area.

Supporters of the All Progressives Congress party, APC, in Rivers demonstrate in Port Harcourt, protesting what they termed killings of their members, harassment and blackmailing of the security agencies by the Rivers state Governor, Nyesom Wike and the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, particularly during a recent election. The protest was led by Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: PENGASSAN workers continue a protest for a second day.

"In the past week" (reference made on 21/12) military forces raid areas on the Sambisa Forest, rescuing over 1,880 civilians being held by Boko Haram and arrest "hundreds" of insurgents. At least 21 of those rescued are believed to be of the "Chibok Girls."

Eighteen people are feared killed and many others missing in a violent clash between Tivs and Fulanis in Sabon Gidan village of Dan Anacha town in Gassol Local Council of Taraba State. Sources from the area said the crisis started at the weekend when two bodies of Fulani were found killed in a bush, perpetrators not known. This triggered alleged reprisal attacks on Tivs. 10,000 or more were displaced as result of the fighting.

Eighteen people are feared killed and many others missing in a violent clash between Tivs and Fulanis in Sabon Gidan village of Dan Anacha town in Gassol Local Council of Taraba State. Sources from the area said the crisis started at the weekend when two bodies of Fulani were found killed in a bush. This triggered alleged reprisal attacks on Tivs. The Daily Independent counts the dead at 24. A later breaking report from This Day counts the dead at 31.
Two suicide bombers were on Sunday night killed as their weapon went off as they attempted to invade Maiduguri at Muna garage. Several nearby residents were reported injured.
Masked gunmen killed two people and took a member of the PDP hostage from his home in Omoku town.
Staff of Abia State Polytechnic block the entrances of the school in protest over salary issues.

Traffic on the Abuja-Lokoja-Okene road was disrupted as hundreds of truck drivers used their vehicles to block the road in a protest over heavy travel taxes. The protest took place in the Kogi State portion of highway.
Shoppers protest the closure of a shopping complex during renovation.
Youths protest against frequent violence in the area. After becoming unruly, police fired teargas into the crowd and imposed a curfew.

Hundreds of youths protesting the frequent attacks and killings in Southern Kaduna communities, pelted the convoy of the Kaduna State Governor, Mallam Nasir el-Rufai, with stones. The mob also set the residence of the Caretaker Chairman of Jamaa Local Government Area ablaze. A similar protest took place in the area the previous day.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NASUGG: National Support Groups for Good Governance
NOTES: NASUGG protests recent electoral violence. At the same time Abuja residents protest a prolonged power outage in their area.
Workers of Arik Airline under the NLC hold a one day strike and protest over labour issues.
Youths protest in Minna over poor electrical supply to their area.
Pensioners protest in Owerri over non-payment of arrears.

After least 12 children were killed when a pickup van accidently (believed) ran into a procession of students marking the birthday of Prophet Muhammad in Malam Sidi, a mob attacked and killed the driver.
1,400 graduates recruited by Zamfara state government demonstrated at the State House of Assembly to protest non-payment of their salaries.

Unidentified gunmen "last week" (source dated 28/12) attack Uratta Umuoha community, prompting a defensive response from a local militia. The militia arrested one, while one escaped. Later, a youth vigilante group burned the person to death.
The traditional monarch of Agbarha Kingdom, Delta State is kidnapped while travelling in Ndokwa East.

Unidentified gunmen "last week" (source dated 28/12) attack Uratta Umuoha community, prompting a defensive response from a local militia. The militia arrested one, while one escaped. Later, a youth vigilante group burned the person to death. On 25/12, the attackers regrouped and attacked again.

One person was feared dead in Ado Ekiti during a protest by traders who were protesting what they called disturbance by the officials of a taskforce of the Ekiti State Ministry of Works. It was also gathered that the Commissioner for Works narrowly escaped being lynched as the protesters.

Workers of the Ondo State government "dragged" the state Account General to a bank to force him to withdrawal their unpaid salaries after they had picketed his office in the Alagbaka, Akure. No injuries reported on the behalf of the Accountant General.
The Taraba State secretariat complex was "shut down" by civil servants who were protesting against the non-payment and irregularities in the payment of salaries and pensions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CCCSO: Coalition of Concerned Civil Society Organisation
NOTES: Members of CCCSO protest, calling on the Attorney General of the Federation and Minster of Justice to investigate and prosecute perpetrators of killings that took place during a recent poll. A similar protest took place in the city two days ago.
Youths in Mangu staged a protest over harassment by security forces.
Between 1-2 police officers killed, with others injured or abducted in an attack by an unidentified armed group in Oye.

Military forces capture a Boko Haram stronghold in Smabisa Forest known as "Camp Zero," at Parisu causing enemy fighters to flee. Arrests reported, including a French citizen. No violence reported. Muhammadu Buhari says Camp Zero was one on the last Boko Haram strongholds in the area, claiming they have been "technically defeated."
The corpse of a Fulani is discovered in Emu-Ebendo "over the Christmas weekend."

Unidentified gunmen suspected to be members of a "cult group" have killed no fewer than eight people in Omoku in Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni Local Government Area. The attack, believed to be political, comes following a re-run election in the area.
Fulanis attack Goska, near Kafanchan over two days, killing eleven.
Protest of bus operators in Benin City after a fellow driver is killed by a suspected street gang.
A prominent APC member is assaulted while fraternising with other APC supporters in Dampar ward. Perpetrator not known.
After attacking the previous week, unidentified gunmen regroup and again attack Uratta Umuoha, killing three.
Fulanis attack Goska, near Kafanchan over two days, killing eleven.

Two Boko Haram suicide bombers are foiled after they are stopped by a local militia described only as a vigilante group. The first bomber detonated a bomb pack, killing only herself. Following the first explosion the militia physically attacked the second bomber. The bombers pack was later reported detonated. Two deaths total.
A Boko Haram commander, flushed out from a recent raid on Sambisa Forest, is captured in Ikorodu.
Unidentified assailants attack and kill three police officers in Idu.
Protesters barricade an expressway after two are killed in an auto accident.
Protest in Sapele over a prolonged power outage.
The Nigeria Army said it had arrested about 1,240 suspected Boko Haram during a "mop-up" operation by troops inside the Sambisa forest in the days that followed the takeover of Camp Zero.

Hunters clash with Boko Haram at Karetu "a week ago" (source dated 06/01). Fifteen of the hunters were reported dead, five of whom were beheaded, after their remains were found between Gubio and Mobbar Local Government Areas.
The convoy of an APC chieftain is attacked in Mala village, Ibi LGA. One dead, three injured. One of the injured was assaulted days earlier in Dampar ward.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the "past three days" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.

Police forces arrest a "oil militant" leader (identified as Abiodun Amos alias SENTI) and confiscate explosives on or around 29/12. The bombs were allegedly to be used in a plot to destroy the Third Mainland Bridge in Lagos.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the "past three days" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.
Boko Haram attacks military forces at Rann, leading to a three hour battle. Fifteen Boko Haram dead.

On December 30, 2016 at about 1330hrs, the troops arrested a confirmed Boko Haram member at Goni Kalla. While the suspect was being moved from Goni Kalla to Damaturu, the Boko Haram member attempted to escape by jumping out of the vehicle. He was therefore shot and killed.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the "past three days" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.
Security forces capture 1,400 suspects between 28 December, 2016 and 4 January, 2017 "at the fringes of Sambisa forest."
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate a pack at a market late into the evening, killing herself and injuring one other.
